story:
Friends! Romans! Web Series Aficionados! Lend me your Ears!

Hello! We are The Loons, part of Cream-Faced Loons Theatre Company. Not content with just performing on stage, we're now expanding our bid for world domination by teaming up with Squad Four Productions to bring you 'The Real Ceels' - a new web series adaptation of Shakespeare's 'As You Like It'.

We're really passionate about bringing Shakespeare to new audiences, and this is the perfect chance to join us on our mission! 

What We Need & What You Get

We're aiming to raise £2000 for this project. This will go towards:

  • Extra equipment we need to make this the best web series we possibly can!
  • Paying our amazing actors and incredible behind-the-scenes team...even creative people have to eat!
  • Marketing for the series to get it out there! There's no point making the thing if nobody sees it!

The best thing is, by supporting our campiagn you're not only helping with the creation of an amazing web series, but you also get some great perks in return! Like social media shout outs, exclusive merch, mystery goody bags, tickets to our live theatre performances or even a song written just for you! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone will be able to support us with £££ but there are other ways you can help!

  • Share this campaign to everyone you know!  Tell your friends, tell your Grandma, tell your postman, tell your postman's Grandma!
  • Follow us on Twitter and Facebook @theloonstc
  • Watch, enjoy and share the series when it comes out in January
  • Use those lovely Indiegogo share tools!

Want to find out more or have any questions? Check out the FAQ section or tweet us @theloonstc!

story:
UPDATE: CAMPAIGN EXTENDED

We’ve been overwhelmed by the generous donations and lovely messages that have come through so far in support of Life, Camera, Awkward. She and the Others have the BEST fan club going around, so thank you from the entire team for getting us this far. 
It's been quite the journey to get here, and we didn't think it would be right to end this without a show-stopping send off. So we've decided to extend this fundraising campaign and throw her the retirement party she deserves, giving you and your friends more time to get involved and spread the word!
So put the date in your diary (April 26) and don’t forget to shout about She and the Others on social media to help us hit our target.

Who the heck are you?

We are SHE AND THE OTHERS - a brand-new female-driven production company based in Melbourne, Australia.

We are a community of collaborators, inspiring women to gather, connect and unite and celebrate our collective experience through authentic and humorous storytelling.

There has never been a more important time to share our stories and we recognise the important role that screen content plays in challenging and shaping societal norms.

So why help us?

The show will be available free to watch for everyone, and we will make it no matter what. But we want it to be GREAT. 

There's something special about sharing comedy. Ever helped a friend move house and shouted "PIVOT, PIVOT!" as you sweatily drag their crap up three flights of stairs? Or exclaimed "Bingpot!" at just the right moment, causing your little brother to unexpectedly spit his mouthful of chips out and half-choke as the dog cleans up the crumbs at his feet? What about singing "Bye, Bye, Little Sebastian" on a train carriage full of strangers and everyone gets their phone torch out? No?

We want to make those moments but, more importantly, we want a community that laughs at our moments. It makes us feel connected, reminds us we are not alone and convinces us that, while we may not be perfect, we may just be a bit of alright. 

So why help us? Because you can, and if you've gotten this far already, you probably get it. 

About Life, Camera, Awkward

Life, Camera, Awkward is our debut project, a comedy web series that follows Lily and Millie, two best friends who are new-ish to Melbourne and trying their luck in the 'big city'. Lily is determined to ‘make it’ as an actor while Millie would be happy to simply discover her purpose in life. Witty and intelligent, awkward and uncomfortable, neither of our heroines quite fit the mould. 

Millie – keen for a challenge – joins Lily at her acting classes, where we meet an impressive but flawed group of women: the effortlessly beautiful Alicia, warm and generous on the outside with a lust for fame brewing beneath the surface; Charlotte, endlessly curating her life via social media; Jess, over-ambitious, over-educated and over being second-best; and Rachel, the fiercely competitive and self-cast outcast. Throw the hyperactive Anita and her subdued side-kick Ana, along with Lily's socially oblivious housemate Mathilde, into the mix and you'll find something hilarious, anxiety-inducing or awkward to relate to. 

This bunch of babes will remind you that you are awesome just as you are and that no-one needs Manolo Blahniks to be breathtakingly brilliant. 

We are planning to shoot in winter this year (that's Aussie winter to our north-of-the-equator friends) - which is pretty soon! We have incredible people working with us and would love to have a bunch of our episodes available for your viewing pleasure around Christmas.  

What will Life, Camera, Awkward be like?

We love shows like Brooklyn 99, Parks and Recreation and The Marvellous Mrs. Maisel. These are shows with incredible women and while they all have great stories driving them it's the characters and their genuine relationships that keep us wanting more. We love these women. 

Physical comedy also makes us happy. There have been countless times when we have fallen into a Kristen Wiig or Lucille Ball YouTube vortex for a few hours, unsure of when we will return to the real world. There are so many outstanding, funny women from Saturday Night Live who can make us laugh-cry the same volume of tears as when Dobby.... well.... you know. We're not ready to talk about it. Old British TV like Fawlty Towers and Only Fools and Horses also inspire us with their great physical comedy. We hope to bring an element of that to Life, Camera, Awkward. 

In terms of what the show will look like… well, let’s just say we love colour! Our characters and our city are all very alive so expect to see beautiful visuals similar to Russian Doll. Have you not seen Russian Doll? Why are you still here!? Cancel everything and watch it all RIGHT NOW! (Amy Poehler if you're reading this – we love you.) 

Making amazing content is expensive... like, really expensive. Even without paying a single member of our incredible company, creative team or production crew who have generously signed their lives over to us for the duration of this project without expecting a cent. (What do we mean? Did you not read the 'Surprise Pie' perk??) Which is just one more reason we need your support to make this show sensational. 

We would like a budget of well over a million dollars to make the epic show we really want and realise Jamie's dreams of an enormous, outrageous Austin Powers-style dance scene.

But Georgia says this is unrealistic and what we actually need is a total of $20,000 to realistically, make this show work.

Thanks to the support of our fabulous network in Melbourne and the company members' contributions we are already part of the way there. 

We are hoping to raise at least $10,000 via Indiegogo. This is where you can help us.

Risks and challenges

She and the Others is a new artistic venture that draws on the skills our company members have individually developed over the past decade. We have spent the last 12 months planning for this project and have two contingency plans should we not reach our funding goal. Or three if you count running away to hide in the jungles of Borneo. But Georgia says that apparently isn't a viable contingency plan. 

You can be sure that your donation will help see this project through to fruition but we sure as heck would love to reach that target (Mama wants a dance scene!).

So what's in it for me?

If you decide to support this project, not only will you be able to say that you helped make Life, Camera, Awkward possible, but you can also get in on our fabulous perks! 

Perks

Our perks start at just $12 for exclusive digital content. You'll be able to follow us right through our production period and see how we 'Do Funny'. 

Want something more personal? For $25 or more you'll receive a one-of-a-kind photo from behind the scenes, posted to you via snail mail.

Each perk includes everything from the lower perk levels plus something extra special: see below.

Other ways you can help

Looking for other ways to get involved? We love you!

Sharing this page is a GREAT help. Not a good help, a GREAT help. And the best way to do that is to go back to the top of the page and click on these buttons. 

We're always looking to grow our audience and to get the word out about Life, Camera, Awkward. The sooner people are excited about this project, the better! So if you'd like to give us a hand, follow us on our social pages, share our content and show us some love with those likes.

Instagram: @sheandtheothers

Facebook: She and the Others

Website: www.sheandtheothers.com

Reach out to us! We'd love to hear from you.  xx

story:
RootsxWings Digital is the purpose of two Black womxn who dare to re-imagine how Black teen femmes are represented and to create a space where they can be whoever they want. We are foundationally committed to building a brand that centers the experiences of Black teen femmes through digital storytelling and live events. Our goal is to aggregate the influence of the Black teen femme community to usher their ideas, interests, and musings into mainstream culture where they belong.

Believing in the mission God placed in our hearts, we have built RootsxWings from our own pockets for the last 3 years. We have been blessed to receive the consultancy of very accomplished friends for legal, administrative, and creative operations all on the promise of our drive and an “IOU.” 

Betting on ourselves in such a precarious time, we are investing 100% of our talent and time into launching RootsxWings. Our inaugural campaign, “In Black Girls We Trust,” will kickoff our flagship talk series RAW Convos, a platform for Black teen femmes to share their thoughts and interests unapologetically. 

With this fundraiser, we hope to recoup the costs of the pilot episode, fund the production costs of the following 4 episodes, pay our talented design, media, and strategy teams, cover any necessary tech/software needs, and create revenue-generating merchandise to achieve sustainability. 

This has been the most rewarding and challenging experience of our 20+ year professional journey. We have questioned how we’d cover costs to meet our goals and execute on projects, only to have the end results turn out greater than we could have imagined. We have gotten accustomed to the fleeting hope of grant applications, while somehow acquiring top talent for the low! We have had inspired conversations with brilliant young femmes from all over the US, Liberia, Nigeria, and Jamaica. We have conducted shoots and interviews in Brooklyn, Philadelphia, and Los Angeles that capture the essence of our target audience. We are developing a dynamic team of Black and brown business leaders and creatives who prioritize mission alignment and professional development. With your help, we can continue to build this meaningful platform!

What We Need 

A lot of love, sweat, and creativity goes into producing each episode. While we operate on a lean strategy, proper funding will help us mitigate tech risks, increase production value, acquire key talent, produce quality products, and ultimately enhance our brand impact. 

Here’s a breakdown of the overall campaign costs:

Follow us on Instagram @rootsxwings to catch more episodes and bonus footage. 

Visit www.rootsxwings.com to learn more about the brand and purchase merch! 

Donations of any amount are appreciated. As a symbol of our gratitude, each donation comes with a perk! Check out our perks page. Welcome to the RxW Fam! 

RxW Fam: 10% merch discount code 

RxW Fam Deluxe: 10% merch discount code + Deluxe Sticker Pack

RxW Stan!: 10% discount code + Deluxe Sticker Pack + coin tee

Ultimate RxW Stan: 10% discount code + Deluxe Sticker Pack + coin tee + limited release hat

IBGWT Starter Pack: 10% discount code + Deluxe Sticker Pack (limited release hat, tagline tee, gold coin sweatshirt)

IBGWT Deluxe Pack: 10% discount code + Deluxe Sticker Pack (coin hoodie, l/s tagline, Iris sweat)

IBGWT Premium Pack: 10% discount code + Deluxe Sticker Pack (limited release hat, Iris tee, gold coin tan tee, l/s tagline, coin hoodie)

*Note: no international shipping at the moment

Other Ways You Can Help

We value all contributions:

  • Follow us on Instagram @rootsxwings to catch more episodes and bonus footage. 
  • Subscribe to our YouTube channel.
  • Repost our content to your stories, like, and comment on our posts.
  • Share our campaign on your social 
  • Tell your family and friends about our merch

story:
THE PROJECT

Synopsis

We all know what it’s like to live in a world of chaos, but very few of us have the ability escape it entirely through our dreams. In the distant future, our protagonist, Saskia, has recently lost her job as a special agent in law enforcement due her declining mental health. Saskia seems not to have anyone in the world who cares for her, she is always isolated in her small apartment while undergoing the mental health program that is meant to ‘fix’ her. But she is one of the lucky ones. 

When Saskia sleeps each night, she is taken to the 21st century in her dreams by an advanced AI program embedded in her subconscious, CHI-98. These dreams show her how much freedom there was in the past and allow her to learn more about herself, they have a surrealism that is exciting and she even meets characters that embody people from her past that she has lost, making it an addictive experience. Yet, she is constantly questioning what CHI-98 is, especially when these dreams start filling in the blanks of her amnesia and revealing a sinister conspiracy that was erased from her memory.

Visual Inspiration

Visually, the entire project will have an eerie thunder cloud of unpredictability hanging over it, partly suspense, partly the unknown as the audience can never guess what is around the next corner. Season 1 will have a visual contrast between the dystopian, cyber punk world that Saskia lives in and the soft, welcoming world of her dreams.The Matrix (1999) and Blade Runner 2049 (2017) will be key visual inspirations for the sci-fi city that Saskia lives in. The neon colours and creative framing choices in those films will reflect the style we will emulate to create the intriguing yet isolating apartment that Saskia seems to be trapped in. The Dream World will juxtapose this, instead being bright and inviting, exuding sunshine and warmth while creating a surreal, other-worldly experience for audiences. The cinematography will be often abstract, reflecting the experience of real dreams and creating psychedelic atmosphere. Sometimes colours will be bold and vibrant  - glowing neons, the rich greens of nature, the ambient lights of a cityscape - and other times they will be more subdued, industrial even, as CHI-98 leads Saskia further away from safety. 

The Purpose 

Saskia's Dream World aims to bring attention to the importance of mental health in a world driven by technology. The series will act as an escape for audiences, while dually commenting on the potential damages of escapism and exploring themes such as grief, oppression, redemption and love. Though, this series isn't entirely grim, it is a high concept sci-fi that will excite audiences as they get to finally see what their dreams look like while they're awake.

THE ARTISTS

Creator/Director -

Isabella Susigan is a film student who is halfway through her degree at the Australian College of the Arts. Isabella has worked on numerous short films and also has experience directing episodic content and documentaries. She is passionate about her work and in particular loves the joy and memories that come out of collaborating on a production. Saskia's Dream World is Isabella's dream project and she is extremely eager to get it out there for everyone to see. She wrote the series during a time of intense isolation for her due to the COVID-19 pandemic and wishes to explore both the delights and downsides of escapism.

Isabella's favourite film is: Chinatown (1974).

Assistant Director - 

Jasmine Schultz is an actress and photographer with a keen eye for cinematography. She has been interested in film since she can remember, claiming it was the first thing that really left an impact on her life. Having completed acting courses and participated in several productions, Jasmine will be a key collaborator with Isabella to ensure all aspects of the series reach their maximum potential. Her history in photography, passion for cinema and drive to create means she knows exactly what is needed to make a film production run its best.  

Jasmine's favourite film is: Train to Busan (2016).

Camera Department -

Zach Kennedy is a documentarian, animator and cinematographer who is passionate about history and politics. His enjoyment of filmmaking and videography dates back to his primary school days when he began making Youtube videos.  Since then, he has worked creatively on travel documentaries, wedding videography, student films and several more successful Youtube videos. This experience provided Zach with a vast knowledge on cinematography theory as well as the nuances of different editing software, leaving him with a great eye for detail. 

Zach's favourite film is: Apocalypse Now (1979).

Ayden Cook is a film student studying at Swinburne University of Technology. Ayden, like many, began his career in theatre and photography, having these hobbies slowly guide him to a passion for film. He is confident in cinematography and lighting design, having been the DoP for the films The Curtain Calls and Dies Irae and the gaffer for Blocked Up.  Ayden describes himself as a passionate workhorse, willing to throw himself into any role as he has adequate knowledge and experience across vast areas. He also has experience in sound recording and mixing, so will switch between roles in any area he can lend expertise on this production.

Ayden's favourite film is: The Gentleman (2019).

Sound Department -

Luna Atkinson-Ladic is music production student at the Australian College of the Arts. She has been interested in music and sound since she was four years old when she demanded a violin from her parents and has been playing since. Luna is excited to work on scoring a film as she believes music is one of the magic elements that can make a production start from words on a page and transform into a realistic, immersive experience. Her classical training, instrumental knowledge and deep understanding of music theory and sound physics will allow her to create an intricate and mesmerising score for the series, but also assist with sound recording, foley and post-production sound.

Luna's favourite film is: The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993).

Art Department -

Killian Peter is a film student halfway through their degree at the Australian College of the Arts. Killian has always wanted to tell stories, starting off in writing and working their way up through photography and theatre. It was in their mid teens that Killian realised that they can combine all of those passions into film and they have since continued being involved in productions, creating short films and improving their screenwriting. Killian is particularly talented in the visual areas of  production (set design, props, lighting and costuming) and will be taking on the role of production designer for this series.

Killian's favourite film is: Beetlejuice (1988).

HOW YOUR DONATION HELPS

The budget needed to create this ambitious production is minimal, as all cast and crew are eagerly volunteering their time in exchange for experience and credit. Yet there are still some things that we need to purchase to make this happen. We need to reach our goal budget of $3000 AUD for Season 1 in order to begin shooting this December. So, this is where we need your help - any donation will count toward this $3000 AUD goal that will bring this exciting web series to fruition. 

$3000 AUD Budget Breakdown -

- Equipment: Most equipment will be hired out through the various universities that the crew attend but some purchases still need to be made. A high quality gimbal is an imperative purchase as there are many tracking shots and steady camera movements throughout the series. Other purchases include lighting equipment, data storage drives and sound recording equipment.

- Costumes: Saskia will wear a new outfit in each episode, representing the often strange and contrasting differences between our real dreams, but also playing with colour psychology and symbolism that relates to the meaning of the dream. Secondary characters will also be needing costumes. Some of this money will be for purchasing whole garments and accessories, while the rest will be for purchasing materials to sew original designs for the production.

- Props: There are many props throughout the series, from notecards to weaponry and our goal is to ensure that they look as realistic and effective as possible. 

- Production Design: Most of our filming locations are free and convenient, but it is the actual decorating and design of these places that will make them memorable. Simple, yet adequately styled objects like a single bed or a desk and chair will allow us to make a seemingly normal space look as though it is from the distant future. 

- Transport: We plan to take advantage of the beautiful state that we are located in (Victoria, Australia), which means travelling far and wide for shooting locations. This area of the budget covers costs such as petrol and public transport fees.

- Catering: Volunteering on any project is rewarding, yet often tiring. We will ensure all cast and crew are well fed and hydrated during the entire shoot. 

- COVID-19 Safe: This production is dedicated to adhering to the COVID-19 safety measures and practices put fourth by Work Safe Australia. Therefore, a portion of the budget will be delegated to purchasing hand sanitiser, face masks and other imperative health related items. 

THE REWARD

We have plenty of perks to choose from, from heartfelt thank you messages to exclusive behind the scenes footage! But it also should be included how rewarding your donation will be to the Australian film industry, this project: 

- Furthers the diverse representation of artists in Australia's film industry. We have several members of the LGBTQ+ community involved in this production, as well as a vast range of people from different socio-economic circumstances and cultural backgrounds.

- Will be free to watch through online distribution via Youtube. We want this web series to be accessible at a high quality for anyone with an internet connection.

- Explores and addresses important issues within our society that aren't often touched on in Australian film & television. 

- Supports independent artists who are trying to rebuild the Australian film industry in the post-COVID-19 era.

NO MONEY?

There are other ways you can help make this project happen! Utilise the Indiegogo sharing tools and share this campaign with your friends, family, co workers and anyone else you think would love to contribute to the arts. 

Also, direct yourself and others to our pages: 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/saskiasdreamworld

Website: https://www.s4skia.com
story_txt:
THE PROJECT
Synopsis
We all know what it’s like to live in a world of chaos, but very few of us have the ability escape it entirely through our dreams. In the distant future, our protagonist, Saskia, has recently lost her job as a special agent in law enforcement due her declining mental health. Saskia seems not to have anyone in the world who cares for her, she is always isolated in her small apartment while undergoing the mental health program that is meant to ‘fix’ her. But she is one of the lucky ones. 
When Saskia sleeps each night, she is taken to the 21st century in her dreams by an advanced AI program embedded in her subconscious, CHI-98. These dreams show her how much freedom there was in the past and allow her to learn more about herself, they have a surrealism that is exciting and she even meets characters that embody people from her past that she has lost, making it an addictive experience. Yet, she is constantly questioning what CHI-98 is, especially when these dreams start filling in the blanks of her amnesia and revealing a sinister conspiracy that was erased from her memory.
Visual Inspiration
Visually, the entire project will have an eerie thunder cloud of unpredictability hanging over it, partly suspense, partly the unknown as the audience can never guess what is around the next corner. Season 1 will have a visual contrast between the dystopian, cyber punk world that Saskia lives in and the soft, welcoming world of her dreams.The Matrix (1999) and Blade Runner 2049 (2017) will be key visual inspirations for the sci-fi city that Saskia lives in. The neon colours and creative framing choices in those films will reflect the style we will emulate to create the intriguing yet isolating apartment that Saskia seems to be trapped in. The Dream World will juxtapose this, instead being bright and inviting, exuding sunshine and warmth while creating a surreal, other-worldly experience for audiences. The cinematography will be often abstract, reflecting the experience of real dreams and creating psychedelic atmosphere. Sometimes colours will be bold and vibrant  - glowing neons, the rich greens of nature, the ambient lights of a cityscape - and other times they will be more subdued, industrial even, as CHI-98 leads Saskia further away from safety. 
The Purpose 
Saskia's Dream World aims to bring attention to the importance of mental health in a world driven by technology. The series will act as an escape for audiences, while dually commenting on the potential damages of escapism and exploring themes such as grief, oppression, redemption and love. Though, this series isn't entirely grim, it is a high concept sci-fi that will excite audiences as they get to finally see what their dreams look like while they're awake.
THE ARTISTS

Creator/Director -

Isabella Susigan is a film student who is halfway through her degree at the Australian College of the Arts. Isabella has worked on numerous short films and also has experience directing episodic content and documentaries. She is passionate about her work and in particular loves the joy and memories that come out of collaborating on a production. Saskia's Dream World is Isabella's dream project and she is extremely eager to get it out there for everyone to see. She wrote the series during a time of intense isolation for her due to the COVID-19 pandemic and wishes to explore both the delights and downsides of escapism.
Isabella's favourite film is: Chinatown (1974).

Assistant Director - 

Jasmine Schultz is an actress and photographer with a keen eye for cinematography. She has been interested in film since she can remember, claiming it was the first thing that really left an impact on her life. Having completed acting courses and participated in several productions, Jasmine will be a key collaborator with Isabella to ensure all aspects of the series reach their maximum potential. Her history in photography, passion for cinema and drive to create means she knows exactly what is needed to make a film production run its best.  
Jasmine's favourite film is: Train to Busan (2016).
Camera Department -
Zach Kennedy is a documentarian, animator and cinematographer who is passionate about history and politics. His enjoyment of filmmaking and videography dates back to his primary school days when he began making Youtube videos.  Since then, he has worked creatively on travel documentaries, wedding videography, student films and several more successful Youtube videos. This experience provided Zach with a vast knowledge on cinematography theory as well as the nuances of different editing software, leaving him with a great eye for detail. 
Zach's favourite film is: Apocalypse Now (1979).
Ayden Cook is a film student studying at Swinburne University of Technology. Ayden, like many, began his career in theatre and photography, having these hobbies slowly guide him to a passion for film. He is confident in cinematography and lighting design, having been the DoP for the films The Curtain Calls and Dies Irae and the gaffer for Blocked Up.  Ayden describes himself as a passionate workhorse, willing to throw himself into any role as he has adequate knowledge and experience across vast areas. He also has experience in sound recording and mixing, so will switch between roles in any area he can lend expertise on this production.
Ayden's favourite film is: The Gentleman (2019).
Sound Department - 
Luna Atkinson-Ladic is music production student at the Australian College of the Arts. She has been interested in music and sound since she was four years old when she demanded a violin from her parents and has been playing since. Luna is excited to work on scoring a film as she believes music is one of the magic elements that can make a production start from words on a page and transform into a realistic, immersive experience. Her classical training, instrumental knowledge and deep understanding of music theory and sound physics will allow her to create an intricate and mesmerising score for the series, but also assist with sound recording, foley and post-production sound.
Luna's favourite film is: The Nightmare Before Christmas (1993).
Art Department -
Killian Peter is a film student halfway through their degree at the Australian College of the Arts. Killian has always wanted to tell stories, starting off in writing and working their way up through photography and theatre. It was in their mid teens that Killian realised that they can combine all of those passions into film and they have since continued being involved in productions, creating short films and improving their screenwriting. Killian is particularly talented in the visual areas of  production (set design, props, lighting and costuming) and will be taking on the role of production designer for this series.
Killian's favourite film is: Beetlejuice (1988).
HOW YOUR DONATION HELPS

The budget needed to create this ambitious production is minimal, as all cast and crew are eagerly volunteering their time in exchange for experience and credit. Yet there are still some things that we need to purchase to make this happen. We need to reach our goal budget of $3000 AUD for Season 1 in order to begin shooting this December. So, this is where we need your help - any donation will count toward this $3000 AUD goal that will bring this exciting web series to fruition. 
$3000 AUD Budget Breakdown -
- Equipment: Most equipment will be hired out through the various universities that the crew attend but some purchases still need to be made. A high quality gimbal is an imperative purchase as there are many tracking shots and steady camera movements throughout the series. Other purchases include lighting equipment, data storage drives and sound recording equipment.
- Costumes: Saskia will wear a new outfit in each episode, representing the often strange and contrasting differences between our real dreams, but also playing with colour psychology and symbolism that relates to the meaning of the dream. Secondary characters will also be needing costumes. Some of this money will be for purchasing whole garments and accessories, while the rest will be for purchasing materials to sew original designs for the production.
- Props: There are many props throughout the series, from notecards to weaponry and our goal is to ensure that they look as realistic and effective as possible. 
- Production Design: Most of our filming locations are free and convenient, but it is the actual decorating and design of these places that will make them memorable. Simple, yet adequately styled objects like a single bed or a desk and chair will allow us to make a seemingly normal space look as though it is from the distant future. 
- Transport: We plan to take advantage of the beautiful state that we are located in (Victoria, Australia), which means travelling far and wide for shooting locations. This area of the budget covers costs such as petrol and public transport fees.
- Catering: Volunteering on any project is rewarding, yet often tiring. We will ensure all cast and crew are well fed and hydrated during the entire shoot. 
- COVID-19 Safe: This production is dedicated to adhering to the COVID-19 safety measures and practices put fourth by Work Safe Australia. Therefore, a portion of the budget will be delegated to purchasing hand sanitiser, face masks and other imperative health related items. 
THE REWARD

We have plenty of perks to choose from, from heartfelt thank you messages to exclusive behind the scenes footage! But it also should be included how rewarding your donation will be to the Australian film industry, this project:

story:
Short Summary

DMV Nailed It is an instagram TV /Youtube  series that spotlights Nail Techs from all over the DMV area. The DMV is full of many talents, one being our creative, business booming, independent Nail Techs and it's time they deserve their shine! The creator of the show, Alexis Cobbs alongside the writers of Alexander Milan Productions wants to shed a light on the lives of these self-made business women and what it is like to spend a day in their lives. The show will consist of several different segments in which will provide interesting conversations and never before seen footage on the process and creativity DMV nail techs create through their nail art and its influence on DMV, nail, fashion and pop culture. 

What We Need & What You Get

For the show, our goal is to reach $2,750 for the following purposes:

  • Studio Time- $360
  • Travel- $140
  • Location rentals- $500
  • Props- $250
  • Set Design- $400
  • TV Host- $600
  • Crafty (snacks)- $200
  • Special Guest- $300

The Impact

This project means a lot to the Alexander Milan production family. Starting a production company from the ground up during 2020 has been a task but it only motivates us to keep going, that's why it's imperative that we make our mark and put on for the DMV area. Every project put out by Alexander Milan Productions is based in the DMV, by local artist, creatives, talent and much more!

This show will not only put on for the DMV area but also serve as an inspiration to the youth, on the rise entrepreneurs, business women & men, creatives and much more! We want to show everyone from the DMV area that your goals and dreams are attainable!

Risks & Challenges

Given that we are experiencing a global pandemic, it is a priority that we take every precaution needed to ensure the safety of our cast and crew. In doing so, production and cast will be required to:

  • Frequently get tested for CO-VID
  • Keep set to a minimum socially-distanced number
  • Wear mask and gloves 24/7 while on set (aside from cast filming)
  • Required temperature checks before walking on set

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, here are some other ways to help:

  • Go to our social media pages and repost our DMV Nailed It covers @AlexanderMilanproductions (IG) & @Alexmilanprod (Twitter) 
  • Give us a shoutout on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook
  • Hashtag the name of our show on Twitter
  • Mention our show to your favorite nail tech

story:
Unstable follows the life of an Afro-Latina who decides to pursue her dreams in Hollywood. Soon she finds that it's not as easy as she thought, as she deals with heartbreak, homelessness, and trying to fit in she follows along on the journey of life.

Our goal is to empower Afro Latinos to embrace their heritage and transform the image of the Latinos in the media.

Our main character Dashay Jocelyn is a Dominican cutie from Yonkers, New York, who is destined for television. Her quirky personality, Latina flair and beautiful melanin is a combination that came to slay.

She spends her days working as a server, and her spare moments dreaming. Finding a balance between doing what she loves (acting/creating), and living sustainably. 

We're telling a story of growth. Taking situations that seem unfortunate and finding light no matter what. We're so excited to share our truths with you and give you some giggles! 

What We Need & What You Get

We've set our goal at $20,000, but of course every contribution matters! This money is going to be used in many spectacular ways.

We'll be using the funds raised for locations, COVID tests, production design, equipment, wardrobe, transport and of course to pay and feed our awesome cast and crew!

We have also added some awesome perks to bribe you all and thank you for helping us create this story.

 

 

The Impact

Unstable is my baby. It's crawling and ready to start walking, and eventually one day running. With your help we will be able to achieve this. You have no idea how much your contribution means to me, and the impact it will have on my journey as a storyteller. It will be forever appreciated! We hope you will join us and be part of helping this beautiful project grow. You never know how strong you are until you need to be!

 

Risks & Challenges

As this is based on our personal journey navigating "The City Of Angels," The most important thing is keeping this honest, authentic, and fun! The story itself is powerful, encouraging and hilarious. I have no doubt we can help change the world if we take our time, have patience, and always do our best!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow our process on our Instagram page @unstableofficial

Share us, talk about it, and help us make it great!

Thank you again for your time, and I hope we can make some really awesome things come to fruition together =)

story:
Short Summary

We created the concept of Eat Austin Eat because we were faced with that daily question, "Where do ya'll want to eat?"  And in Austin, Texas that's an especially hard question to answer because there are so many amazing places from which to choose.  Since we come from a TV background we didn't just want to tell you about them ... we wanted to show you. 

This project is a passion of ours because not only are we giving the audience a peek inside some truly unique Austin eateries, but we are supporting these restaurants by telling their stories.  Your contribution helps make this all happen.

Eat Austin Eat is produced by X Horn Productions and Creative Kong.  We've got over 20 years of experience in television and film.  The show will be hosted by Danny Trevino.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're producing six, 30 minute episodes for Season 1.  Each episode will include up to 6 different restaurant profiles with one segment taking you inside the kitchen where a signature dish will be prepared just for you.  Another segment takes us on the road for a day trip where we'll visit a favorite spot outside the city limits.  The show, Eat Austin Eat - Season 1 will be available on Vimeo OnDemand beginning in May 2018.

 

A lot goes into making an entertaining and polished show.  We've gathered the resources to get it done, but we need your help to make it happen.  As a contributor, you'll get access to all the shows we produced.  Want to have your product inside the show, we've got a perk for that.  Who wants to be the next Food Star?  We have a perk that puts you in front of the camera as a segment host!   

 

Risks & Challenges

We are small, independently-funded and determined to create this series. Creating broadcast-quality programs is expensive, but our team is uniquely experienced with delivering great content on a limited budget.

We need to spread the word about this project and so that means advertising.  Part of our goal amount includes marketing and we have a lot of ideas on how to make some noise and create valuable partnerships. We'll be using our foot hold on our social media accounts to get the ball rolling. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.  Share and share some more!

Tell your friends and fellow foodies! Indiegogo has some great, easy sharing tools located at the top of the page.  Thank you visiting our page.  Now let's eat!

story:
Don’t you hate all the negativity on TV today? Doesn’t it seem like every show about weight loss, transformation, and healthy lifestyle is more set on shaming people than lifting them up? Wouldn’t it be great to see a show that was all about the positive journey and the little changes that you can make that will help you not just survive, but THRIVE!? A show that would make you laugh, and inspire you to be the best you, you can be? I want that too.

For those of you who don’t know me, my name is Sandi Masori and I wear a lot of hats. I’m a mom, a full-time balloon artist, a best-selling author, a book strategist (that is I help other people write/ publish books), a TV personality, and a fluffy serial dieter. A couple of years ago, in the process of trying to heal from my divorce, I got a crazy idea: I wanted to produce a TV show about transformation where the focus was on the journey, not the end result.  As John Lennon says, “Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans”.

I noticed that all the weight loss shows out there are really about shaming people and making you feel bad. I didn’t want to do that. I wanted to do something light-hearted and uplifting. A show that would leave people with a smile on their face, and the desire to get out and do something.

Around the same time, I accidentally met with a big reality tv show producer and told him about my idea for a show. He loved the idea, but said that since I was an unknown, no one would back a show like that, because they didn’t know if I could carry the show as the talent. But, he said, since I already had a Youtube channel, I should go out and make my show, get 1,000,000 views on each episode, and then come back to him as that would be something that a network would find interesting.

Challenge Accepted! Said I!

So I got some friends to help, hired some other people, and we started shooting videos. Whenever I had a little extra money, I would put it into doing something for the show. For the past 2 years, I’ve been going out of pocket, robbing Peter to pay Paul, so I could keep moving forward with my dream. Basically I jumped in head first with no idea of what I was doing, or what it would take.

So that pretty much brings us to today…

Right now, I have 20 of the first 30 episodes taped, and nothing edited. Editing is expensive and time consuming. It’s not just editing that I need, it’s also production. Who knew that there was so much to know and plan to make a TV show?? I need help, professional help. So, that’s why I’m here.

The money you contribute will go to production costs for the last few episodes, post- production costs to get everything edited, and marketing to get the eyeballs.

I have a few dreams for this show- to get it to TV and to put some quality feel-good broadcasting out there that will lift people up, and help them get out of their own way. The message that I want to get across is “you’re perfect the way you are, but if you’re not happy, or in a rut, try something new, because along the way, when you’re moving out of your comfort zone, life happens!”

This show is everything to me. There is so much junk tv out there, and every time you turn on the news, it’s all bad things. I want to show that life is good, and that there’s no reason not to enjoy yourself while on the way to a healthy lifestyle.

Even if you can’t donate money, you can still help support the cause. Share this fundraiser, when the show debuts on September 18th on the Sandiballoon Youtube channel, watch it, share it, like it and comment on it. There will be a new episode out every Tuesday after that.

And if you can donate money, a little or a lot, I really appreciate it, and your faith in me and my ability to make this come to life. From the bottom of my heart to the tip of my soul, I thank you for helping me make my dream a reality.

Love and Affection,

Sandi

Shape Up Sandi

 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:  We need at least $30,000 to go into post-production.  All of the money will be used for production, post-production and marketing the series.  

We have 20 of the first 30 episodes taped, and are waiting on funding to go into post-production (editing, sound, all that good stuff) 

What You Get: Some awesome perks with exclusive behind the scenes footage, access to full interviews, and some fun merchandise.  Check out the perk levels on the side of the page to see the specifics of each one.  But more to the point, you get to know that you were an integral part in making this show happen and helping mount a movement towards adopting a healthy lifestyle; body, mind, and spirit, on a grand scale.  

The Impact

This show is meant to inspire people to take chances in their own lives, and to get out of their rut.  Through this show, goodwill and happiness will be spread on a large scale, making the world a better place.  

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk is that I'm going to make a big fool out of myself.  But I'm willing to do that if it will help others make positive changes in their own lives.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Share this campaign, and on September 18, when the show debuts on the Sandiballoon channel, watch it, and share it with everyone you know.  Also, join our Facebook group Shape Up Sandi, where you can ask questions from some of out experts and tell us about your adventures.
story_txt:
Don’t you hate all the negativity on TV today? Doesn’t it seem like every show about weight loss, transformation, and healthy lifestyle is more set on shaming people than lifting them up? Wouldn’t it be great to see a show that was all about the positive journey and the little changes that you can make that will help you not just survive, but THRIVE!? A show that would make you laugh, and inspire you to be the best you, you can be? I want that too.
For those of you who don’t know me, my name is Sandi Masori and I wear a lot of hats. I’m a mom, a full-time balloon artist, a best-selling author, a book strategist (that is I help other people write/ publish books), a TV personality, and a fluffy serial dieter. A couple of years ago, in the process of trying to heal from my divorce, I got a crazy idea: I wanted to produce a TV show about transformation where the focus was on the journey, not the end result.  As John Lennon says, “Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans”.
I noticed that all the weight loss shows out there are really about shaming people and making you feel bad. I didn’t want to do that. I wanted to do something light-hearted and uplifting. A show that would leave people with a smile on their face, and the desire to get out and do something.
Around the same time, I accidentally met with a big reality tv show producer and told him about my idea for a show. He loved the idea, but said that since I was an unknown, no one would back a show like that, because they didn’t know if I could carry the show as the talent. But, he said, since I already had a Youtube channel, I should go out and make my show, get 1,000,000 views on each episode, and then come back to him as that would be something that a network would find interesting.
Challenge Accepted! Said I!
So I got some friends to help, hired some other people, and we started shooting videos. Whenever I had a little extra money, I would put it into doing something for the show. For the past 2 years, I’ve been going out of pocket, robbing Peter to pay Paul, so I could keep moving forward with my dream. Basically I jumped in head first with no idea of what I was doing, or what it would take.
So that pretty much brings us to today…
Right now, I have 20 of the first 30 episodes taped, and nothing edited. Editing is expensive and time consuming. It’s not just editing that I need, it’s also production. Who knew that there was so much to know and plan to make a TV show?? I need help, professional help. So, that’s why I’m here.
The money you contribute will go to production costs for the last few episodes, post- production costs to get everything edited, and marketing to get the eyeballs.
I have a few dreams for this show- to get it to TV and to put some quality feel-good broadcasting out there that will lift people up, and help them get out of their own way. The message that I want to get across is “you’re perfect the way you are, but if you’re not happy, or in a rut, try something new, because along the way, when you’re moving out of your comfort zone, life happens!”
This show is everything to me. There is so much junk tv out there, and every time you turn on the news, it’s all bad things. I want to show that life is good, and that there’s no reason not to enjoy yourself while on the way to a healthy lifestyle.
Even if you can’t donate money, you can still help support the cause. Share this fundraiser, when the show debuts on September 18th on the Sandiballoon Youtube channel, watch it, share it, like it and comment on it. There will be a new episode out every Tuesday after that.
And if you can donate money, a little or a lot, I really appreciate it, and your faith in me and my ability to make this come to life. From the bottom of my heart to the tip of my soul, I thank you for helping me make my dream a reality.
Love and Affection,
Sandi
Shape Up Sandi
 

What We Need & What You Get
What We Need:  We need at least $30,000 to go into post-production.  All of the money will be used for production, post-production and marketing the series.  
We have 20 of the first 30 episodes taped, and are waiting on funding to go into post-production (editing, sound, all that good stuff) 
What You Get: Some awesome perks with exclusive behind the scenes footage, access to full interviews, and some fun merchandise.  Check out the perk levels on the side of the page to see the specifics of each one.  But more to the point, you get to know that you were an integral part in making this show happen and helping mount a movement towards adopting a healthy lifestyle; body, mind, and spirit, on a grand scale.  

The Impact
This show is meant to inspire people to take chances in their own lives, and to get out of their rut.  Through this show, goodwill and happiness will be spread on a large scale, making the world a better place.  

Risks & Challenges
The biggest risk is that I'm going to make a big fool out of myself.  But I'm willing to do that if it will help others make positive changes in their own lives.  

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word!  Share this campaign, and on September 18, when the show debuts on the Sandiballoon channel, watch it, and share it with everyone you know.  Also, join our Facebook group Shape Up Sandi, where you can ask questions from some of out experts and tell us about your adventures.

story:
EXT. STORY - PITCH

Over the past year I developed a  comedy series "Appropriate Culture". My goal for the show was to create a platform that brought artists/personalities together behind and in front of the camera. Having a background in TV/film production I've witnessed first hand the lack of creative control we hold when it comes to telling OUR stories.

We produced  first season (5 episodes in total) without a budget which was a testament that it can be done independently through the proper execution.

INT. GOAL - 5,000

Our goal is to raise 5,000 USD. Your contributions would cover production costs, promotional services, marketing tools, merch, event spaces,  equipment rentals, locations etc.

One of the biggest challenges that we've found with producing independent content is the lack of resources/funds. Your contribution would give us leverage in maintaining our independent creative freedom, the ability to build a solid production team and build opportunities for freelance creatives.

INT. SUPPORT - NIGHT

Tbh, Word of Mouth is the most valuable form of support so I simply ask for continued support and sharing of the show via social media etc if you're unable to support financially. I appreciate you even reading this far! (laughs) Always remember to Like! Share! Subscribe!

story:
Concept

Sitting Ducks follows the adventures of five young friends as they attempt to solve a mystery that has been haunting the local area for decades.
Suddenly thrust into a strange world of danger and intrigue, the group must use every resource they have to get to the bottom of a series of shady occurrences within their town before they too become victims of the town’s dark past.
With time against them and terrible forces working unseen to undo their every action, do they have what it takes, or will they too lose themselves in the underworld the town thought was buried all those years ago?

Purpose for Funding

Funding for Sitting Ducks will go towards many areas, with the aim of the production being of the highest quality and professional standard:

  • To finance camera lens and equipment hire.
  • To provide professional lighting for outdoor and indoor sets.
  • To ensure a high level of audio and visual production quality.
  • To provide catering for cast and crew during long days on set.
  • To cover transport and logistics costs.
  • To cover the cost of promotional material.
  • To provide adequate resources for professional level props, costume and set design.
  • To cover film festival entry costs.
  • To ensure high quality colour grading across the entire production. 

The more funds we have, the better the production quality. We are aiming to spend approximately $2000-$3000 per episode (four episodes in total. If we raise more, we will have a higher budget for each episode).

Our Goals

-  To support and build the local acting and creative community in regional Victoria.

-  To promote the region as both an artistic hub and emphasise the value of its unique environment.

- To create a free web series that is available for all.

- To pitch the series to companies such as Stan, Netflix and local Australian free to air television stations such as SBS or ABC.

- To create a professional, high quality production on a low budget that is something we can all be proud of, including the local community and those involved outside of the core team. 

- Give experience for those who are passionate about film and television and looking to enter the industry, and to expand the breadth of their previous experience.

Cast

We have a ridiculously talented young cast who are extremely excited to showcase their craft and bring the world of Sitting Ducks to life. 

LAUREN

Grace Williamson

ASHLEE

Aven Hogarth

PARKER

Lily Hylands

RUSSELL

George Oakley

TYLER

Aron Pitout

NICK

Max Neal

ALEX

Larissa Zanardo

SAMANTHA

Ali Cruickshank

EDWARD

Harvey Carmody

JOSIE

Angela Peric

BENJAMIN

Keaun Anwari

DESIREE

Anabel Pearson

Crew

Sitting ducks is an original project, from the script to the score, and we are very excited to share our journey creating it with you. Meet our production team!

DIRECTOR, WRITER, PRODUCER, CASTING

Jessica Leaming

PRODUCER

Lance Fidler

ASSISTANT DIRECTOR, CASTING

Shani Clarke

CO-WRITER, SCRIPT EDITOR, MUSIC

Josiah Herma

CO-WRITER, SCRIPT EDITOR

William Cartwright

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY (DOP)

Peter Foster

1st AC

Leiko Lopez

COSTUME

Mienna Brown

RUNNER

Madeline Royce

RUNNER

Michaela Gunn

Perks

  • $20: A signed cast and/or crew photo (50 available).
  • $50: A signed A3 promotional poster (20 available).
  • $75: A printed copy of the Sitting Ducks screenplay, signed by the writers and director (5 available).
  • $100: A personalised and unique cast member photo signed by the cast member in the photo (12 available).
  • $100: One month of classes at Grace Studios, Geelong (kids and teens, 4 available).
  • $150: A “Special Thanks” credit in every episode (unlimited).
  • $200: Advance screening package (5 available).
  • $250: Advance screening package and downloadable link of the 1st episode (5 available).
  • $500: An extra role in the show (3 available).
  • $1000: Professional photo session with Peter Foster (not for corporate use, 2 available).
  • $3000+: An executive producer credit for the entire series (2 available).

Other Ways You Can Help

Every small donation counts but we understand that not everyone will be able to contribute financially. It would be an amazing gift if you could help by sharing this campaign  with friends and family, or liking us and/or sharing our Instagram and Facebook page:

Follow/like and share us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/sittingduckswebseries/

Follow/like and share us on Instagram: www.instagram.com/sittingduckswebseries

story:
Short Summary

We will are an out of the box paranormal show that will touch on everything from  your average ghost story to crazy urban legends to aliens and crypids. How do you plan on standing out from other paranormal shows you may ask???? Well we want YOU to be the investigator. Thats right!!! All right from the comfort of your couch. We will NOT go through the evidience at the end of each episode instead we will run a live stream to discuss each episode with YOU!!!

We are a group of misfits that came together to highlight the unknown in an unique way. We appreicate any and all support

See who is involved in our cast and crew by visiting our IMDb page! 
https://pro.imdb.com/title/tt14279390?s=9ebc2c4...

Keep up with all things Strange-N-Sinister at our Facebook page! https://www.facebook.com/StrangeNSinister

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how the budget breaks down and why:

• Location pay: covers the cost of securing renting locations.

• Travel and food: covering the cost of travel and food for our crew. 

• Equipment use and rental: Helping purchase the few pieces of equipment we need for filming

• One of the great things about contributing is that even the smallest contribution gets you something. Even $1.00 gets you a shout out on the Facebook Strange-N-Sinister Page. You can also purchase autographs, a chance to investigate on location with us, original art work, producer credits, access and attendance at our premiere live event (will include investigation) and more.  There will also be an opportunity to be the STAR in your own horror photo session. 

• If we don't reach our entire goal, we will complete a follow up fundraiser and also attempt to raise private donations. The series will be completed no matter what - your contribution ensures it will be as good as possible. 

Risks & Challenges

Covid is our primary challenge and we do not take that lightly. We have had lots of experience filming during Covid and have learned how to approach filmmaking in the safest way possible. 

• All of the normal procedures for Covid-19 safe practice will be practiced: Masks, sanitizing and cleaning frequently, monitoring of symptoms and temperature, and social distancing as possible. 

• Our biggest tool against Covid-19 is our ability to film with the best quality while maintaining a small crew.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please help share this project with everyone you know

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! Elizabeth and Frankie here. We'd like to personally thank you for taking the time to learn more about #CANCELLED, our latest artistic endeavor. 

We are honored to announce that we've adapted #CANCELLED, our hit theatrical production, into a television pilot! The theatrical performance proved to be a major success at the 2019 Hollywood Fringe Festival. The run of the show was nearly sold out, and the production even won an Encore Award! 

#CANCELLED is a new pilot where a comeback-seeking-ex-child-star, her mega-millionaire mogul manager, and their social-media-scheming assistant become the stars of a murderous scandal of their own. Nearly thirty years old and still living at home, former teen icon Ashley Idaho is desperate to re-invent herself in the music industry. With the help of a couple of strangers, she seizes the chance to reclaim her pop princess crown. This gut-curling comedy is sure to keep you laughing, and also simultaneously question how our obsession with social media affects our relationships, our perception of others, and our perceptions of ourselves. Featuring original pop and rap tunes, fresh talent, and unfiltered fun, #CANCELLED is a murderously entertaining, killer new pilot.

We plan to pitch the finished pilot to film festivals, production companies, and potential investors to develop #CANCELLED into a full-length television series. We are seeking funding to produce creative material of superior quality; with your financial support, we will be one step closer to fulfilling this vision.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations towards our project will help us pay for the cost of production insurance, equipment and location rentals, and compensation for our talented cast and crew members to bring #CANCELLED to life.

We are seeking $4,000 to fund the following expenses:

Equipment Rentals- We are seeking donations to rent state-of-the-art filming equipment to produce a top-quality production. We will submit the finished pilot to film festivals and production companies to develop #CANCELLED into a full-length television series. Proper camera equipment is key for producing a top quality pilot for the silver screen-- or just to binge on your laptop.

Location Rentals- Proper locations help us build the world of #CANCELLED to life! We are renting 4 locations to make our pilot.

Production Insurance- Operating a professional, safe set for our actors and crew is of utmost importance to us, and we will run a set that adheres to top industry standards . We are creating our pilot under a SAG New Media Agreement, where all of our actors will be protected by union stipulations and an insured set.

Talent Payments- Above all, we are so thrilled that producing #CANCELLED allows us to hire our talented friends and colleagues as actors, crew members, and producers. While our SAG New Media Agreement is one of deferred talent payment for our cast, it is important to us to pay our entire cast and crew in a timely fashion for their time and talent.

Festival Submission Fees- Upon completion of post-production, we will submit #CANCELLED to top film festivals and production companies with the intention of developing #CANCELLED into a full-length television series. Your donations will help to cover festival submission fees across the world!

What You’ll Get

Check out all of the incredible perks you’ll receive with your donation, and get #CANCELLED!

Stan Us- We'll send you a link to download "My City, My Time," the hit single by Ashley Idaho!

Follow Us - You'll get an Instagram video shout out from the cast!

Go Viral with Us- Ashley Idaho or Todd will perform a cover of a song of your choosing for you!

Stay Relevant with Us- You'll get a special thanks in the credits for #CANCELLED!

Be Famous with Us- Your name appears *somewhere* in the show!

Become a Legend with Us- Ashley Idaho will write you an original tune- spoiler alert, it'll be a banger.

Get #CANCELLED with us- All of the above, and you'll be credited as a Producer of #CANCELLED.

The Impact

When we first started to write #CANCELLED, our main prerogative was to highlight the effect of the digital age on our poor little lives. These days, we live in a world attached to a screen that filters only the latest and greatest of the mundane everyday. Our digital reality in 2020 consists of 8 year-olds sacrificing their childhood for levels of unimaginable YouTube fame, workout gurus starving themselves behind the scenes, and influencers actually convincing us that they got their clear skin from Proactiv. The conclusion? Life online is not what it appears to be. #CANCELLED tells a story about women in the music industry, and how their lives and relationships are affected by their viral online presences. Now more than ever, we’re all just one click away from being permanently #CANCELLED.

Other Ways You Can Help/ Get #CANCELLED with us!

We get it! Funds can be tight. Sharing this post to socials (ironic, we know) and with your friends is just as appreciated. Follow us on Instagram @cancelledthepilot !

Thank you so much for taking your time to read about our project! Your support is our greatest donation of all.

Drop us a line at cancelledthepilot@gmail.com

story:
The Story

Alice, Danielle, and Kory are in their sophomore year at Douglass University. Having become close friends over the course of their freshman year they’ve formed a tight bond. As it goes with a lot of college students you tend to find lifelong friends as you set out into your first steps of adulthood away from home. Up until this point, the trio has shared a common interest in art, music, and academics which hasn’t left a lot of room for the other side of college, nightlife. This all changes as they set out to have more fun this year. 

Being that Douglass University is a predominately white institution or PWI, the black community is small. That means everyone knows everybody as groups begin to form and kickbacks become large social gatherings. Outside of the frat parties, smoke outs, and game nights that make up the black nightlife experience our group also explores the other night experiences the University has to offer. 

As Alice, Danielle, and Kory have their first meaningful encounters with sex, drugs, and alcohol, they are left to wonder about their place in all of the chaos. How do they fit in? What are society's norms? What does it mean to have fun in these types of environments?  These are questions best answered with experience. Experiences that lie ahead of them.

The Impact

Kickback Chronicles is an online streaming series. ​Created by young filmmakers of color, those with disabilities, and women; each episode runs approximately 8-12 minutes. Kickback Chronicles provides an unfiltered look into the social fabrics that define the collegiate nightlife. Through entertainment and style, we aim to start the conversations that needs to be had.
It is often said that comedy is a great way to deal with difficult topics. While Kickback Chronicles is a drama at heart, humorous moments will serve as a vehicle to provide social commentary on today’s young adult's experiences. Drawing inspiration from the likes of Justin Simien, Kenya Barris, Stefani Robinson, and Issa Rae. Kickback Chronicles will also serve as an innovative way to tell the diverse stories of black collegians.

Each episode will have at least one central theme that we believe is relevant to today, especially on the black college scene. Many of the themes that'll be tackled are the over-sexualization of black women’s bodies, masculinity’s role in the sexuality of black men, and police relations, abuse of drugs, and more. With the story taking place during college, we intend to highlight real experiences that may have not been seen on screen in it's rawness. These experiences are black communities at white institutions, fraternity parties, race relations on campus, college nightlife in the Midwest, and much more.

Filmed on location in Springfield & Kansas City, MO, we hope to highlight the Midwest life onscreen. While other shows have shown the ins and outs of nightlife and black culture on the coasts, very few deal with the unique perspective of the country’s central population. With the Mid-west comes artistry. This form of expression will provide a backdrop to the experiences of our characters. Kickback Chronicles will be an immersive online experience where every character, story-line, and scene will remain authentic to what life is like in today’s kickback culture.

What We Need & What You Get

The details always matter:

  • Our monetary goal is $2,500 as this will be used to pay for lodging for our traveling cast & producers, craft services to feed both cast & crew both production weekends, and set design props and wardrobe.
  • Select donations are rewarded with special KickBack Chronicles merchandise!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and we understand but there are other ways to show support:

  • share, Share, SHARE! Make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to put the the word out there more effectively & efficiently!
  • Like our Facebook page KickBack Chronicles and our Instagram page @Kickback Chronicles

share, Share, SHARE! Make some noise about our campaign.

story:
Who We Are

VIBES: The Game For Music Minds is a LIVE Filmed multi-city mixing competition, created by BEY MEDIA VISIONS, LLC. The game tests a DJ's ability to entertain the audience while playing music from a multitude of genres. Since February 2018 VIBES: The Game For Music Minds has taped 9 shows in Washington D.C. and Los Angeles. With over 70 DJs registered to play across the country, we have plans of expanding to New York, Atlanta, Texas, and Cleveland beginning this fall. Supporters of the campaign will be given credits in the live and taped productions, exclusive content from the champions of the show, sponsored gifts and more!

BEY MEDIA VISIONS, LLC was created in 2018 by Cleveland native, entrepreneur/producer, Jamahn Warren-Bey. A graduate of Howard University, Mr. Warren-Bey cultivated his experiences in LIVE production, night life, and dynamic social settings to craft a platform that aims to highlight the cultural flavors of the time with interactive competition.

 

How Does Vibes Work?

  1. The word "VIBE" can be formally defined as a setting, state of being, or common human experience.
  2. The VIBES guide the DJs to the songs and genres they will play in each round; and also, allow room for their creative interpretation of the VIBE.
  3. The goal of each round is to create a mix of songs that is entertaining, within the preselected VIBE, and scores the highest amount of points.

To begin each round the audience is given three options of VIBES they want to hear. 

Once the VIBE is selected by the audience, each competitor is given four minutes to mix their music.

Points are given based on the songs the competitor plays, and at the end of each round the competitor with the loudest applause receives an extra 10-points added to their score. The competitor(s) with highest score at the end of the round advance.

There are two rounds for competition, and a final freestyle mix by the winner of the event.

 

The base of our model is Audience Engagement 

The aim of the game is to test each competitor's ability to entertain the audience while mixing music from a multitude of time periods and genres to best keep the audience LIVE. The active audience start and end the game; and have the space for live interaction with competitors to directly impact their experience.  Supporters of the campaign have opportunity to simulate show experience with their"VIBES" by purchasing a curated playlists from one of our previous champions.

 

What Have We Done Thus Far/Traction?

VIBES has utilized the social platform Instagram to cultivate our core following. The vehicle has been utilized for promotions, live streaming of content, and providing recap of each taping.  The consistent engagement the vehicle provides allows for VIBES to be direct space for DJs featured on the platform to interact with our audience. With the resource from the campaign VIBES will be able to consistently produce content such as live stream events and episodes, create daily content for audience engagement, and expand our reach to other social platforms. 

 

Social Media #'s:

1.3 K Followers

1.1k Impressions / Week

11,466 Total Video Views

 

 # of attendants:

VIBES provides a dynamic platform for live and in-home audience engagement. The live audience is provided a unique experience to directly interact with the talent to best improve the competitors performance. VIBES will use the resources from this campaign to build a consistent sensory atmosphere for all markets we enter.

75 / event

 
 

Previous Venues:

VIBES targets premier showcasing venues each market. The versatility of the platform has allowed for the event to be held as a ticketed showcase or be featured as a happy hour game for regular patrons of the venue in exhibition format. Supporters of the show can experience VIBES at their next event, or be apart of a championship taping. See the perk options for more information Below is a list of several venues we have partnered with for tapings:

 

Interested Sponsors :

Sponsorship has been key in the growth of our audience reach to our core group of 18-34 in Washington D.C. and Los Angeles. The  current sponsorship group has contributed to our live and social growth through cross promotions, sponsored giveaways, and facilitating resources during preproduction. VIBES aiming to utilize resources from this campaign to provide more mediums for current and future sponsors and talent to interact wit our growing audience; and develop more outreach methods to explore more local sponsorships. 

 

What We Need? Why Are We Doing This Campaign?

With DJs across the country registering  to play the game format, and the growing hunger to craft a consistent and quality experience for the audience; VIBES is looking for help to enhance the production experience for competitors and viewers. With your support VIBES will not only be given the resources to ensure a sustainable and consistent product, but launch the next sharing space for culture.

 

How do you do this?

The success of this campaign will allow VIBES to be brought to you LIVE, once a week from a different market, hosted by premier local talent. The resources from the campaign will be used to consistently staff crews in each market, develop consistent promotional content for each market, enhance the live atmosphere for patrons, and develop outreach to local sponsors.

 

- Cities

       - DC (LIVE)

       - Los Angeles (LIVE)

       - New York (LIVE)

       - Atlanta (PREPRODUCTION)

        - Austin, TX (PREPRODUCTION)

      - Cleveland, OH (MARKET EXPLORATION)

- 24 DJs  / city 

- Championship tapings once a month / city

 

Expenses? 

The game format for VIBES can be played in variety of settings and develop and organically create an intimate atmosphere for all in attendance. To create consistent production experience for talent, live attendees, and viewers the platform asking for support to facilitate the resources needed to properly promote the to events across multiple social platforms; package produced interviews and competitors mixes to drive traffic before an event; develop more sensory engagement for the LIVE audience, and provide a consistent and timely packaged show for at-home viewers.

- Marketing:

The marketing expenses include editing and promotion of social media ads, VIBES branded stickers for event, promotional fliers for event, and to fund the resources to execute promotional giveaways at the event with staffing.

 

- Production Crew

The production expenses are concentrated on man power, as VIBES partners with local production teams with equipment to execute the local productions. 

 

- Belts

Each city receives a customized championship belt from proambelts.com

 

- Champions Fee

Champions who successfully defend belt are paid a talent fee for their performance

 

- Signage / Decorations

To develop the engaging atmosphere of the taping we would like to improve the signage, posters, and decorations at the event used

 

- Post Production

To ensure a consistent turn around of each episode, and provide marketing materials for the platform and contestants.

 

Team NEEDS:

VIBES has been unable to consistently provide the resources to produce each episode with consistent execution. The lack of resourcing has created an inconsistent experience for talent and attendees. These needs have also delayed the packaging of content for the platform. The success of this campaign will facilitate the resources to add staffing to our current productions, and be able to execute production partnerships to bring a quality and consistent experience across the nation.

- Two Camera Men / city

- Two Live Stream Cameras / city

- One Producer / city

- One Brand Ambassador / city

- Two Audio / Video Editors

 

Timeline to complete? 

Having successfully produced Four shows in Washington D.C. during the 2019 spring and summer seasons VIBES is planning fall showcases in Washington D.C., Los Angeles, New York, Atlanta, and Austin. The remainder of the year will be used to package much of our unreleased content from 2018 and 2019. The execution and support from this campaign will facilitate a formal national launch in 2020 from the months of March - October, with fully packaged content being released to the audience between the tapings. 

OCTOBER 2019 - OCTOBER 2020

 

LETTER FROM THE CREATOR:

To Supporters and Viewers of the Show,

On behalf of the VIBES Production team, talent, and sponsors I would like to extend a thank you and welcome for supporting the growth of the VIBES community. Our team is working diligently to craft the best experience for our dynamic audience of DJs, LIVE patrons, at-home viewers, and active music listeners of all types. Your support and direct engagement on the platform brings us the resources to provide more of what you want to see, and grows our sharing community. We're looking forward to consistently providing a cultural sharing space for you to actively enjoy and attend.

Keep It LIVE, Stay With The VIBE!

Jamahn Warren-Bey

Creator and Founder

VIBES: The Game For Music Minds
