story:
What is StoneXVI?

StoneXVI is a new network that creates videos, articles, films, music, and podcast's dedicated to the preaching of the Gospel of Jesus Christ. Entirely free on YouTube, Podcast apps, Spotify, and iTunes. With the growing rise of "anti-Mormonism" in media, we need an engaged, timely, artistic platform to faithfully and confidently explain misunderstood topics in Church history, scriptures, and theology. We also need to galvanize the Latter-day Saint youth in artistic expression, with entertainment value! StoneXVI is the platform to do this. 

StoneXVI was created by young people, for everyone!

 

Articles

Multiple weekly articles from our website, written by faithful members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Addressing doctrinal and historical topics about The Book of Abraham, Kinderhook Plates, Blacks and the Priesthood, Polygamy etc. As well as theological subjects like multiple Gods, Exaltation, Revelation and more. We will use articles to teach people about evidences of the restored gospel. Archaeological evidences of The Book of Mormon, and The Pearl of Great Price. Textual evidences, fulfilled prophecies of the modern Prophets and more. We also will publish about social topics from a faithful Godly perspective, and and cultural subjects like divorce, school, depression, relationships, and all things that make us human.

 

Films

Pairing with Utah filmmakers, we will create religious films unlike any you've seen before. Usually 40-45 minute short films covering a wide range of topics. Each film is written with the goal of furthering conversion, and creating comfort, while holding to the value of quality entertainment. The films will be both family appropriate, and relatable to Generation Z and Millennials. We want to entertain, and uplift.

 

Music

StoneXVI will release music videos by Latter-day Saint artists. The more Latter-day Saint influence in music-the better. These songs will be hymnal covers, pop, rap, folk, and R&B music about the gospel. No other platform has ever done this. We will use music to bring the gospel back into the culture.

 

Videos

Weekly 8-15 minute long gospel discussion videos highlighting topics about the Church and gospel, and providing evidences for our beliefs. We will also use these videos to explain our beliefs, share great stories, bear testimony, and have dialogues/interviews with various people.

 

Weekly Podcast

A weekly video podcast, also available on podcast apps, discussing all things connected to the gospel and The Church.

 

If you want to be a part of this vision, and journey don't hesitate to donate and spread the word! We need a presence like this online, and there is no better time than now.

story:
Short Summary

It's short and sweet: we got a bunch of amazing actors to help us out while I continue my journey of being a real animator, and not a bump on a log calling myself outrageous nonsense like "Director" and "Executive Producer". That's right: Keith is actually teaching me how to be useful, and our new show is going to be the centerpiece of that education!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $1000 per episode this time around. But Episode 1 is here as proof-of-concept! This will cover the (currently) nominal salaries of the voice actors, and the acquisition of art assets from my good artist friend, Handerson Soares (we call him "Oshigan" around the Studio). I'm doing quite a bit of the assets myself, and I have a background artist queued up on DeviantArt who will assist us further. It's a solid team, but I do not intend to pay myself directly. I hope to get YouTube and Patreon to handle that part when we finally acquire "Partner Status".

Actors include Carey Means (Frylock of "Aqua Teen Hunger Force"), Sammi Bold, Loran Bolding, Kaylie Horsley, Joelle Aliana Ferguson, Jenna Sharpe, Julie Shields, Keith Wood, and a bevy of guest stars, like my good friend Clare Halstead, Lec Zorn, Shelby Iacometti and many, many more. All of them incredibly skilled actors who are ready to get to work bringing this to life.

In addition to the acting team and acquiring assets for this episode, I'm hoping to be able to get a slightly upgraded Mac Mini for production purposes. My old 2011 beast is giving up and running three OS's behind!

Since this is a smaller campaign, contributors will get some fun stuff: shoutouts from our live podcast, mentions in the credits, downloadable PDFs of the scripts and more! Large contributors will receive an "Associate Producer" credit.

No matter how much we get, it will go into production, and you'll still get your perks*, But this time around, we have a couple physical perks in the form of posters autographed by me and Keith Wood! (Censorship not included on final product ;) )

 

*minimum $100 must be collected, or campaign will be cancelled by IndieGoGo

 

 

The Impact

As before,I want to learn new skills, but hate the antiseptic environment of a classroom. So Keith is teaching me the needed programs on-the-fly. We already have the first episode completed, and Oshi is creating all new models for some of the characters. But again, 80-90% of this is me. And for YEARS, I've lacked the confidence to do this all on my own. I always felt like an impostor with my art. This is my therapy. And, if I succeed, I can help with production of the vastly more polished and expensive "Starship Moonhawk" series so we may actually release more than an episode fragment each year. Seriously, everyone wins here.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is simply that I won't have the time or finances to make a 6-10 minute episode every month because I'm scrambling to pay for all of it, and somehow maintain our household on Uber and Lyft and the occasional commissions alone. That would be tragic, because did I mention we are working with CAREY MEANS OF AQUA TEEN HUNGER FORCE? I shoulda led with that...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
It's short and sweet: we got a bunch of amazing actors to help us out while I continue my journey of being a real animator, and not a bump on a log calling myself outrageous nonsense like "Director" and "Executive Producer". That's right: Keith is actually teaching me how to be useful, and our new show is going to be the centerpiece of that education!
 

What We Need & What You Get
We need about $1000 per episode this time around. But Episode 1 is here as proof-of-concept! This will cover the (currently) nominal salaries of the voice actors, and the acquisition of art assets from my good artist friend, Handerson Soares (we call him "Oshigan" around the Studio). I'm doing quite a bit of the assets myself, and I have a background artist queued up on DeviantArt who will assist us further. It's a solid team, but I do not intend to pay myself directly. I hope to get YouTube and Patreon to handle that part when we finally acquire "Partner Status".
Actors include Carey Means (Frylock of "Aqua Teen Hunger Force"), Sammi Bold, Loran Bolding, Kaylie Horsley, Joelle Aliana Ferguson, Jenna Sharpe, Julie Shields, Keith Wood, and a bevy of guest stars, like my good friend Clare Halstead, Lec Zorn, Shelby Iacometti and many, many more. All of them incredibly skilled actors who are ready to get to work bringing this to life.
In addition to the acting team and acquiring assets for this episode, I'm hoping to be able to get a slightly upgraded Mac Mini for production purposes. My old 2011 beast is giving up and running three OS's behind!
Since this is a smaller campaign, contributors will get some fun stuff: shoutouts from our live podcast, mentions in the credits, downloadable PDFs of the scripts and more! Large contributors will receive an "Associate Producer" credit.
No matter how much we get, it will go into production, and you'll still get your perks*, But this time around, we have a couple physical perks in the form of posters autographed by me and Keith Wood! (Censorship not included on final product ;) )
 
*minimum $100 must be collected, or campaign will be cancelled by IndieGoGo
 

 
The Impact
As before,I want to learn new skills, but hate the antiseptic environment of a classroom. So Keith is teaching me the needed programs on-the-fly. We already have the first episode completed, and Oshi is creating all new models for some of the characters. But again, 80-90% of this is me. And for YEARS, I've lacked the confidence to do this all on my own. I always felt like an impostor with my art. This is my therapy. And, if I succeed, I can help with production of the vastly more polished and expensive "Starship Moonhawk" series so we may actually release more than an episode fragment each year. Seriously, everyone wins here.

Risks & Challenges
The risk is simply that I won't have the time or finances to make a 6-10 minute episode every month because I'm scrambling to pay for all of it, and somehow maintain our household on Uber and Lyft and the occasional commissions alone. That would be tragic, because did I mention we are working with CAREY MEANS OF AQUA TEEN HUNGER FORCE? I shoulda led with that...
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
What's this?

This Is Hell.

Okay, great, but what's it about?

Sally & Mel have been best friends since school and have wasted the better part of their youth coasting along doing Sweet FA. Just when things seem to be on the up, a sudden bereavement throws their lives into chaos and tests the limits of their friendship to breaking point.

This Is Hell is a darkly comic drama about female friendship, isolation and the brutal reality of grief and how we deal with it.

Why have you written it?

A few reasons ... 

  • To show what grief is really like

We can be really bad at dealing with grief, whether our own or other people's, and this is especially true of any death which is unusual or stigmatised. We wanted to tell an uncompromising story that shows the real, ugly side of grief - the rage, the bitterness, the cruelty - but also the funny, ridiculous side. 

  • To show what female friendship is really like

Too often we see female friendships on screen either idealised as sisterly altruism or plagued by competitiveness and catty jealousy. Our aim is to represent a female friendship that feels fully complex and real, through all its highs and lows.

What's the plan?

In a few weeks time we will be filming the first two episodes (six parts in total) and we need a little help to get them done. We plan to use these first two episodes to secure funding to complete the web series early next year. 

Our ultimate goal is to get This Is Hell in front of TV production companies with the aim of securing enough funding to expand and develop the show into a fully budgeted series.

Who's the team?

Writers - Laura Waldren & Sarah Livingstone

We are real life best friends who trained together as actors at the Bristol Old Vic Theatre School. This Is Hell is our debut web series.

Director & Editor - Hunter Allen

Hunter is a co-founder of videography company Neuron Hub, and has directed and edited for the BBC, Comic Relief, Comedy Central and the Beano. 

Producer - Max Park

Max is a Development Editor for Film 4 and holds a diploma in Script Development from the National Film and Television School.

Co-producer - Euan Shanahan

Euan is a graduate of the Bristol Old Vic Theatre School.

What do you need the money for?

Production design - as the first two episodes are set primarily in flats we've managed to find free filming locations, but we need some extra money for props and set dressing to make it look fantastic.

Sound design - part of our budget will be spent on securing high quality equipment and sound recordists. 

Camera hire - we will be hiring a professional TV quality camera for shooting week to make the series look as brilliant as possible.

Soundtrack - music is a big part of the series, so some of the budget will go on securing song rights.

Travel and food - we're fortunate enough to have lots of talented and generous friends who have agreed to work on the series for free as they believe in the script, and at the very least we'd love to be able to reimburse people's travel to and from set and feed them proper meals on shooting days.

Contingency - we have factored a contingency into the budget in case of any last minute extra costs.

Is there any other way I can help?

Absolutely! If you aren't able to contribute financially but like the sound of the show, please do share our IndieGoGo page on social media and give us a follow on Twitter and Instagram at @thisishell.series

story:
​The Story

Adulthood. You've got to make it work right? Alisha, Dan, Jess and Temi are friends struggling with adulthood post uni. They commit small time robberies in order to make ends meet.  One day they commit a crime that has consequences no one is ready for.

 

Who are we

We are, The Basement Bunch, a collective of women working across theatre and film made up of team members, Adeyinka, Charity, Hannah and Shakira. We began this company because we wanted to create opportunities for others in our community and have since created theatre shows such as, The Eden Effect and short films, Nāca and 4C. As we've grown, we've realised collaboration is at our core which is why we have teamed up with actresses Jessica and Mariah to create a web series.  We were intrigued by ensemble pieces and wanted create one of our own. We hope that this web series is a fun and exciting watch for the audience and leads to more collaborations in the future with other creatives.

To give you an idea of what the web series will look like, have a look at our teaser below.

 

 

So who will be involved?

The series will be directed by:

Shakira Francis 

Shakira directed her first short film '4C' that was selected as a finalist for the South East Film competition. It then went on to screen at the Cambridge Film Festival, the Brighton Cinecity Festival and tour the South East of England.  Her next short film 'The Lost Land Girl' was supported by the BFI and is currently making the festival circuit rounds. As a member of BFI network x Bafta Crew 2019, Shakira continues to write, direct and act

https://www.independentcinemaoffice.org.uk/film...
https://vimeo.com/350063403

Mariah Nonemacher

Mariah Nonnemacher a graduate with a Masters from the Royal Central School of Speech and Drama. Having directed documentaries in Shanghai for over a year with company LPfilms has started her career in Europe recent credits include La Vita, a documentary about refugees and locals finding common ground to find happiness in the small Italian village of Amantea. And La Visita, a short film LGBTQ thriller shot in Italy about life after coming out, and the trauma one endors even after accepting themselves. Now focused on the series of Thick as Thieves, a Luton based production as Director hopes to make it a truly ground breaking and unlike any other female driven crime series.

....and the cast?

The Goal?

In order to get this series made, we would love your help in raising £11,150. This will cover the pre-production and production of the first series (3 Episodes) of Thick as Thieves. You can see below how this will be spent:

Post production will be handled by The Basement Bunch in-house amongst our team we have editors who are ready to bring this series to life. 

 

Perks, Perks, Perks

As a thank you for your support we have some exciting perks for you!  Take a look to your right but also see what you could get below:

Shout out on twitter, 
A4 Poster
A3 Poster
Set of 3 Posters
Special Credits
Access to the series before anyone else
Set Visit
Online Press Pack
Associate Producer Credit

It would be fantastic to reach our goal however if we don’t quite make it any money we raise will first and foremost go towards paying our crew. As filmmakers we believe in paying crew members for their time, feeding our cast and crew and as well as paying for locations. 

The impact you can help us make

As Women of Colour our representation both in front and behind the camera is our passion. This is why Thick as Thieves was developed. We wanted to showcase a story with WOC in the drivers seat with mutli-dimensional characters that are relatable. The industry is slowly changing with how it represents WOC and we are contributing to that.

Risks and Challenges

With filming there are always risks and challenges. From actors falling sick to the English weather not cooperating, however we have made sure to take in as many factors as possible, when scheduling the film shoot. As a collective we have a wide range of production experience on multiple sets and have had to deal with cancellations of locations, clashes of personalities and unforeseen events on set.  We have overcome them and we are confident we can do the same with the web series- filming it on time and on budget.

Other ways you can help

Any contribution is appreciated however we understand that is not always possible. There are other ways you can still help us make an impact.  By:

1) Sharing our campaign with your friends and family and social media platforms.

2) Following us on social media.

We can’t thank you enough for simply visiting our campaign page, make sure you share, follow and like!

Thank you !!

P.S Thank you to Magic Records for the Music

Track: E.P.O - Turn Up [Magic Release]
Music Provided By: Magic Records
Listen To The Original: https://bit.ly/2CKB9e2
Fanlink: https://fanlink.to/l4r

story:
Welcome!

First, I would like to thank you for visiting this site and for considering making a donation.

The Age of Maturity is a web series that was written to shed light on some of the issues that young adults face as we go out into the world and try to make it on our own. I feel that it is important to share these types of stories to let this group of people know that they are not alone. We all have issues dealing with family, relationships, education and finding the right career. I believe this series can be both inspirational and entertaining.

I was fortunate enough to have quite a few aspiring filmmakers come on board to help bring this vision to life. Now I ask that you help continue the process. A donation of any size would be helpful and all the proceeds would go into the production. The money would be used to post-production (video editing, color correction, sound design, graphic design, etc.) of the first season and pre-production (location scouting, makeup and wardrobe, etc.) for the second season.

If do not have the means to donate, you can also help us out by promoting our campaign to friends and family. We would greatly appreciate anything you can do for us.

For more updates like The Age of Maturity on Facebook, follow us on Instagram (@ageomaturity) and be sure to visit our website, which is currently under construction and will be up and running soon!

ageomaturity.wixsite.com/webseries

Thanks again for the consideration and your support!

Best,

Michael C. Anderson Jr.

Writer, Director & Producer

The Age of Maturity

Cast & Crew

A large amount of talented individuals all dedicated a great amount of time to bring this story to life. Donating to the series would also help to promote their brands and highlight their talent.

Cast

Shawn Lawrence

Isaiah Jimenez

Parnesha Ingram

Audrey White

Daja Walker

Sebastian Serra

Tashika J. Moore

Marcus Anthony Nieves

Crew

Writer, Director & Producer: Michael C. Anderson Jr.

Spoken Word Writer: Mariah S. Herring

Executive Producer: Candrace M. Martin, Sammie Ann Fontaine, Calvin Greer & Adam Rideaux

Co-Producer: Candrace M. Martin, Sammie Ann Fontaine & Jonathan Bowens

Cinematographer: Calvin A. Greer & Kyle Crowder

Production Designer: Candrace M. Martin

Editor: Ulysees Turner & Nicole Torres

Casting Director: Michael C. Anderson Jr.

Unit Production Manager: Brittney McPherson

1st Assistant Director: Laurence Ramsey

2nd Assistant Director: C'aira T. Hall

Camera Operator: Alex Narvaez, Luis Rodriguez, Jewel Brown, Syretta Tucker, Jacqueline Ross, Ulysees Turner & Darshae White

Assistant Camera Operator: Ulysees Turner, Syretta Tucker & Brandon Lee Bennett

Behind the Scenes Photographer: Syretta Tucker, Ulysees Turner & Jacqueline Ross

Behind the Scenes Videographer: Jewel Brown, Ulysees Turner & Jacqueline Ross

Art Director: Daja Walker

Set Decorator: Erica Lyn MacLeod & Deborah Berrios

Wardrobe Supervisor: Candrace M. Martin & Michael C. Anderson Jr.

Prop Master: Sammie Ann Fontaine

Makeup Artist: Daja Walker, Deborah Berrios & Vitiesther Torres

Post-Production Supervisor: Ulysees Turner

Colorist: Nicole Torres

Sound Designer: Lisa Gallagher

Graphic Designer: Vitiesther Torres

Visual Effects Editor: Ulysees Turner

story:
Do you know what it’s like to be forgotten? Well here at Chaotic Animations our goal is to make sure it doesn’t happen to a toon! Meet Miko the forgotten toon, she plans on becoming a star and she needs your help to do it! Chaotic Animations is asking you, the people to help us make a fully animated short around 3-8 minutes long so we can show off Miko and the gang to various entertainment outlets so that she and her friends can have the television show that she's always dreamed of. A show where being the star means to never be known as “The Forgotten Toon”. So come on don't you want to help this poor little toon reach her dream? 
We want the world to see that black and white toons as well as classical hand drawn animation is still alive and well but we need your help in making this dream and story come to life. 



Written and created by Gloria Barbosa a YouTuber with a dream of making a cartoon series. This ADHD and Learning Disabled writer tends to throw her energetic and slightly silly attitude into every character and story she creates thus making a series consisting of fun and entertaining episodes.

Animated by the breath taking animator Nippy13 he uses his skills to bring dreams to life.

Character designs by Andrea Boscolo a very cartoony guy who can always make you laugh.

And staring the one and only- Jon St John or as the world knows and loves him as The Man Mr. Duke Nukem who will be taking the role once again of everyone’s favorite voice in the sky the Narrator himself.

We have many more voice actors coming in to the project soon!

story:
We began production on the show in September 2017. Since then, we've shot two and half episodes, plus the awesome promo video you see here. How did we make this happen? We pulled together our resources to assemble a filmmaking team comprised of industry professionals who have years of experience and who just love the project. It's really become a family atmosphere amongst cast and crew (we literally recruited family members). 

DIRECTOR'S STATEMENT:

"For most of my twenties, I struggled to find my niche in the world. It was through traveling, working odd jobs and meeting unforgettable people that I became a storyteller. Hired Education is based mostly on my own experiences working odd jobs and navigating the world as a young, independent woman. As a writer first and foremost, I put an emphasis on a strong story that is compelling and relatable to the everyday person. I then seek out talented actors who can bring the story to life. We've got a fun and comedic team of people who connect so well with each other, and I think that shows on screen." --Michelle Dos Santos

 

We worked tirelessly to find talented actors who could bring the writing to life and add a whole new dimension to the characters and their world. We held auditions after auditions, then callbacks after callbacks to find the right people. We made a commitment that if we didn't find the best talent who could embody these characters like no other, we would push production back. Thankfully, we found the right people! 

And we have to say... not only are these actors super talented, they're also really hilarious (at least we think so). And we're proud to say, that we have a female-driven cast... So let's get to introductions!

KEELEY BRIGHT - "I wanted to do the project because of the writing, that's what drew me in right away... I thought the concept for the series was so fun, and to be backed up with great writing is a dream come true for me." 

 

MADISON BROWN - "I'm extremely thankful to be a part of this production with a very talented cast and crew, and can't wait to show everyone the magic we've created."

 

CARLOS ALFREDO JR. - “As an actor, you can only hope to work on material and projects that inspire you and challenge you. HIRED EDUCATION is one of those projects! Michelle has a very unique writing style that is both entertaining and with a lot of heart. I am honored to be a part of this series..."

 

VICTORIA PALMA - "I previously had the pleasure to meet and work with Michelle. She's a very talented new writer/director. I was excited to hear about her new project, and I'm very thankful to be part of it. It's been a lot of fun with fantastic, talented and dedicated people, and I hope everyone is going to like it as much as we do!"

What our team had to say:

"I just love putting music to picture. So when this amazing opportunity came up, I jumped at it!" --Jake Boring, Composer

"I am so proud of this project! Not only are the scenes fun, but behind [the scenes] too! Creating the characters' faces has been a good challenge for me as a professional, but everything becomes easier with this great crew!" --Camila Grobério, Key Makeup Artist

"...when I read the script, I loved the humor, and how relatable the characters are. I’m glad I signed on! I’ve been so impressed with the cast, and Michelle and the crew has been a delight to work with..." --Stan Eng, Director of Photography

"Not only do I believe in the project itself as an entertaining story, but our fearless director creates a wonderful work environment that makes it virtually impossible to say no." --Mark Busch, Production Manager

Take a look at us doing what we do best - having fun!

 

FAQ's

What are you raising the money for specifically? The money raised will be used to shoot the Pilot episode. Among the many expenses comes the cost of locations, locations, locations! The Pilot episode has six different locations. 

Why does the pilot have so many locations? To effectively tell Adriana's story, we have to start from the beginning. That includes sharing her story as a med student and establishing all the locations that will be recurring throughout the series. These locations are essential to the story and believe us when we say, there's a reason why Michelle chose the locations she did. Every location has a purpose and tells a story within this much bigger story.

So how many episodes exactly will you be filming? We plan to use money raised to shoot the Pilot episode as well as finish the last two scenes of an episode we began production on. If we exceed our goal, we will re-evaluate our budget so that we can shoot the second episode as well. We just really like making stuff!

How many episodes will air in the first season? The first season will be comprised of 10 episodes.Three episodes will be released beginning February 2018. We also have a Halloween Special that was released as a pre-promo to the promo (seriously). You can watch below!

Where and when can I watch the show? Kickstarter Backers will have  the opportunity to attend a live screening of the first three episodes. The pilot episode will be available to watch on YouTube and on our website,  http://www.hirededucationwebseries.com in February 2018. 

How long is each episode? Each episode is approximately 8-10 minutes in length. Shorter in the case of "promo" and "specials" episodes, which are about 4-6 minutes in length.

What is your long term plan for the show? Our goal is to continue producing the show for as long as the audience enjoys watching it and the actors love acting in it. It's such a fun dynamic on set and Michelle gets (overly) excited writing every single episode and is constantly developing more episodes on paper every day... in fact, she's probably writing one now as you're reading this. And yes, we would love the series to "take off" and be distributed on a larger platform but we cannot promise anything. We CAN be optimistic though. We're good at that! 

What if you don't meet your funding goal? How do you plan to use the money raised?  Firstly, the money raised will go towards locations. That is our biggest expense and without funding for locations, we will be unable to shoot the pilot episode. At that point, we'll have to re-evaluate our budget and most likely run a second campaign round. And as always, we'll continue to develop new story ideas, particularly for short sketches and mini-episodes.

Risks & Challenges

Each individual working on this production was hand-picked because of their talent, merit and work ethic. We've got a great cast and crew, all fueled with passion that's driving this project. We constantly do our homework, plan, and put our best foot forward every day in hopes of making the best thing possible given the resources we have available.

However, all productions face unforeseen obstacles. The more funding we have, the higher quality, more controlled locations we can secure. We can also finish episodes in a more timely manner with a larger post production team. Ultimately, having the proper budget makes the entire process smoother, and the result is a great final product.

We'll communicate to our Backers any updates we have on the filming process, let you know if we're meeting our shooting schedule, what we plan next, make sure you receive your perk(s) by the estimated delivery date, etc. We're always happy to answer any questions you may have about the campaign or show in general. We want to keep our Backers in the loop because our Backers are as much part of the filmmaking process as we are!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Ask friends and family to share the page and help build our fan base.
  • Like us Facebook, Follow Us for updates, and Subscribe to our YouTube channel
  • Retweet, share, comment and show your support on social media. Word of mouth goes a long way!

And that's all there is to it.

BONUS!

CHECK OUT OUR HOLIDAY SPECIAL
story_txt:
We began production on the show in September 2017. Since then, we've shot two and half episodes, plus the awesome promo video you see here. How did we make this happen? We pulled together our resources to assemble a filmmaking team comprised of industry professionals who have years of experience and who just love the project. It's really become a family atmosphere amongst cast and crew (we literally recruited family members). 
DIRECTOR'S STATEMENT:
"For most of my twenties, I struggled to find my niche in the world. It was through traveling, working odd jobs and meeting unforgettable people that I became a storyteller. Hired Education is based mostly on my own experiences working odd jobs and navigating the world as a young, independent woman. As a writer first and foremost, I put an emphasis on a strong story that is compelling and relatable to the everyday person. I then seek out talented actors who can bring the story to life. We've got a fun and comedic team of people who connect so well with each other, and I think that shows on screen." --Michelle Dos Santos
 

We worked tirelessly to find talented actors who could bring the writing to life and add a whole new dimension to the characters and their world. We held auditions after auditions, then callbacks after callbacks to find the right people. We made a commitment that if we didn't find the best talent who could embody these characters like no other, we would push production back. Thankfully, we found the right people! 
And we have to say... not only are these actors super talented, they're also really hilarious (at least we think so). And we're proud to say, that we have a female-driven cast... So let's get to introductions!


KEELEY BRIGHT - "I wanted to do the project because of the writing, that's what drew me in right away... I thought the concept for the series was so fun, and to be backed up with great writing is a dream come true for me." 
 

MADISON BROWN - "I'm extremely thankful to be a part of this production with a very talented cast and crew, and can't wait to show everyone the magic we've created."
 

CARLOS ALFREDO JR. - “As an actor, you can only hope to work on material and projects that inspire you and challenge you. HIRED EDUCATION is one of those projects! Michelle has a very unique writing style that is both entertaining and with a lot of heart. I am honored to be a part of this series..."
 

VICTORIA PALMA - "I previously had the pleasure to meet and work with Michelle. She's a very talented new writer/director. I was excited to hear about her new project, and I'm very thankful to be part of it. It's been a lot of fun with fantastic, talented and dedicated people, and I hope everyone is going to like it as much as we do!"

"I just love putting music to picture. So when this amazing opportunity came up, I jumped at it!" --Jake Boring, Composer

story:
If you cannot contribute immediately, please consider going to the Indiegogo share tools and Share of Facebook, Retweet on Twitter, and Regram with friends!

 

WE NEED YOUR HELP raising $22,300 to finish a proof of concept trailer, which will begin principal photography on March 20, 2018. Your contributions will make this happen!

So, what's the show about?

Story Synopsis. Not much is known about the women of the Old West, not because they weren't prominent, but because their courage, strength, and contributions were largely left out of the history books. Our series is going to change that! You're not only supporting when you buy a perk, but you are contributing to history!   

BADLAND WIVES is not a documentary; it's but a full-fledged, all hands on deck episodic drama; an original, and some are saying "daring", program akin to a Desperate Housewives in the Old West. Don't get us wrong, we've done our homework—all of the sets, backgrounds, wardrobe, guns, rifles, ages and character personalities are historical, fit the time period, and match those persons portrayed in the series during a time when "let's noodlehang 'em" was more prevalent than "let's give them a fair trial." But the women in this town have had enough! They're speaking out and acting out! 

 The planned series is a female-driven, 1-hr dark drama and contemporary Western set in an Old West town that is ran by sometimes sensible, other times incensed, women. They've got probable cause for their lasso madness... the town is run by a bunch of gold-laudering corrupt businessmen who no longer doff their cowboy hats at passerby women. Didn't wives make a lot of the decisions behind their husbands and what they did back in this era? We're just refocusing the lens and bringing the women upfront and personal. While still ineligible to cast ballots in this venomous town, these wives choose to vote with their guns... and they know how to aim better than the men; they had to shoot fowl and pheasant to feed families!

_____________________________________________________

ABOUT THE WOMEN.

We're sure you want a peek at our main characters. The 5-big personality femme fatale wives living with their outlaw husbands in the Badlands, include:

- Zerelda "Zee" James (wife of outlaw Jesse James) —girl gang leader, confident, action-oriented, sensible, street smarts 

- Paulita Maxwell (girlfriend of Billy the Kid) —anxious, hormonal, agile-fighter, precocious & pretentious, book smarts

- Belle Starr (wife of Cole Younger) —reliable, respect-demanding, feminist, confrontational, starts fights and finishes them

- Marthy "Calamity" Jane (mistress of Wild Bill Hickok) —bi-curious, manly, tenacious, quick to anger, vocal, sharp-shooter, tracker

- Jenny Hardin (wife to the meanest outlaw, John Wesley Hardin) —sweet as apple pie, honest, clueless but extremely lovable

THESE OUTLAW WIVES refuse to be imprisoned by the shackles of their society. They're women who throw off the chains, pick up the guns, ride the horses, and occupy center stage in a town rifled with danger and intrigue.

These women were either insane to be married to these outlaws, or they were badass, and YOU ALREADY KNOW what we went with--the Badass version.

_______________________________________________________________

What We're OFFERING—The Perks. We've worked hard on putting together and providing you some awesome perks, prizes and rewards. For pledges ranging from $55-$250.00 we're offering custom screen-printed Badland Wives T-shirts, signed advance copy of the pilot episode, "Pardon My Bullet." For more serious backers, we're saving back some of the costume wardrobe to be worn by the Cast, and awarding others a rare opportunity to have their face and likeness planted on WANTED bill posters in an actual scene. One lucky pledger will be flown to L.A. with hotel accommodations and be a Supporting Actor in a scene on the actual set. Wow! All because of one thing:

We'd really like you to become part of the Badland Wives family!

Take a look—

We've taken the best scenes from our completed pilot script, "Pardon My Bullet," and written a kickass Trailer that our onboard Sales & Packaging firm will be shopping the entertainment Industry with; places like HBO, AMC, USA, TNT, Amazon and History Channel.

How You Can Join Our Growing Team: We not only have a badass lineup of characters, but a kickass team of filmmakers, including: Director of Photography Collier Landry, Sound Supervisor Jussi Tegelman (Batman vs Superman, Great & Powerful Oz, Spiderman II & III, Hurt Locker, Poltergeist) and the visual effects team of BFX ImageWorks, Steve and Benni Blasini in Los Angeles.  

Now we need you to JOIN OUR TEAM and help us raise the remainder of funds behind what has been 3 yrs of commitment and mountains of pre-production work.  

_____________________________________________________________________________

DEVELOPMENT PHASES   Budget—$22,300.00. 

What are the funds being used for?

TREATMENT/Development Phase I. -- further development of Badland Wives show treatment. Including a formidable website, additional written episodes, and further fleshing out the first 13-episode story arc. 

Associated Startup Costs: $750.00                    _____________________________________________________________________________

PILOT SCRIPT—Development Phase II—while the 1st Draft of the pilot episode, "Pardon My Bullet"  is completed, it along with the upcoming sizzle reel will require further development: (i) Analyze script for compelling story elements, twists, conflict and resolution. (ii) Analyze sizzle reel for action and emotional beats.  

Associated Startup Costs: $2,000    _____________________________________________________________________________

 VISUAL EFFECTS/CGI—Development Phase III—visual effects are important and a necessary component to good story. We've brought on one of the best VFX companies in Los Angeles and they deserve hard cash for completing the VFX Shot Sheet List of visual effects we've already provided them.   

Associated Costs: $8,300   

_____________________________________________________________________________

AUDITIONS—Development Phase IV—Over 2700+ Actors submitted their resumes and actor reels from all over Los Angeles and surrounding areas for one of the five principal roles on the developing series. Our 1ST ROUND AUDITIONS were held on November 18, 2017 with the 2ND ROUND AUDITIONS  planned for December 16, 2017. Submitting were actors signed by over 70 Talent Agencies. Funds provide us the hosting site for the auditions, craft services, necessary props for the set and audition environment, countless labor hours sifting through over 3000 actor submissions by our Casting Director, wardrobe that actors may use on-stage when auditioning, all the way down to the wardrobe re-stocking fee. These fees quickly add up.

On December 16, 2017, the 2nd Round of Auditions will be held for Badland Wives with a 4-Person Casting Panel at the helm--

Associated Costs: $1000.00                                                 

_____________________________________________________________________________

CURRENT DEVELOPMENT PHASE—Phase VI—PRODUCTION & POST PRODUCTION

RAISING SEED CAPITAL (in the amt. of $22,300.00) for the Production and Postproduction of a proof of concept reel. We plan to do this through Indigogo in order to provide our Sales & Packaging team the necessary visuals to solicit the Industry. 

This includes expense of: storyboarding, location fees, set builds, 43 actors, wardrobe, hair & makeup, lighting, carpenters and scenics, SFX, sound/music scores, film and grip crew, postproduction editing... and everything associated with producing a full-fledged series trailer.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Associated Costs: $10,250.00    _____________________________________________________________________________

Who We Are

We are Dawghouse LLC., a team of drama producers and writers, specializing in formulating pilot scripts and movie screenplays. We create unique and fresh programming; new and edgy shows you'll spill a drink over in your living room or popcorn in the theatre. We are currently crowdfunding for the Trailer of our new live-action drama TV show series, "Badland Wives."

Production is expensive! The average cost of producing a 2-3 short or trailer ranges from 15,000.00 - 54,000.00. Dawghouse, LLC. has line-budgeted the production of our above board trailer at $22,300. This finished production also provides the first phases and initial elements in creating our eventual 22-minute Badland Wives pilot episode.

The Team

 

How We're Different

Dawghouse, LLC

COMPANY OVERVIEW & BACKGROUND

Dawghouse, LLC began its operations as Leroy, Jobst & Curley in 1993 as Midwest producers of locally originated television programming. Pidge Jobst did much of the creative for the local FOX WTTE-28 Kids Club affiliate, which later became the template for the National FOX Kids Club, which spread into markets across the U.S.  Dawghouse LLC. also provides specialized graphic and illustrative services for both national and local corporate entities, along with high-profile advertising campaigns that utilize television, radio, web and internet, magazine print mediums for market distribution. 

INFANCY SUCCESSES:

       Dawghouse, LLC. enjoyed immediate success. Early on, the company was awarded commissioned contracts for the development of two weekly television series programs for Production Partners, Inc., namely "Ohio Golf" and "Columbus Cooks". In addition, the company produced and developed a third in-house, 52 episode, children’s live-action educational program known as "Crystal Palace." These programs embodied all phases of development, including: (1) Concept Development and Packaging, (2) Distribution, (3) Site Management, (4) Pre-Production, (5) Editing and Post-production, (6) Major Sponsor Sales and TV Avails Commercial Solicitation, along with (7) Product Placement and General Merchandising.
     The weekly children’s television series aired for three years and was produced before a live-studio audience. It was the first locally-originated children’s television program to be produced in over 22 years of Columbus' history. The conpany also produced "Crysta Palace's Tribute To Luci's Toyshop, "THE MOVIE." in November 1994. Joined by Wendy’s International, LJC distributed the movie into area AMC Theatres.

Now since moving its operations to LA in 2010, the studio is embarked on providing viewers new and original, edgy animation, drama series, reality and docu-drama series, game and competition series, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel this show would make for good programming, please Share, Retweet, and Regram this campaign with friends on social media sites. You can go to the Indiegogo share tools. 

Thank you!

Badland Wives Team

This includes expense of: storyboarding, location fees, set builds, 43 actors, wardrobe, hair & makeup, lighting, carpenters and scenics, SFX, sound/music scores, film and grip crew, postproduction editing... and everything associated with producing a full-fledged series trailer.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Associated Costs: $10,250.00    _____________________________________________________________________________
Who We Are

We are Dawghouse LLC., a team of drama producers and writers, specializing in formulating pilot scripts and movie screenplays. We create unique and fresh programming; new and edgy shows you'll spill a drink over in your living room or popcorn in the theatre. We are currently crowdfunding for the Trailer of our new live-action drama TV show series, "Badland Wives."
Production is expensive! The average cost of producing a 2-3 short or trailer ranges from 15,000.00 - 54,000.00. Dawghouse, LLC. has line-budgeted the production of our above board trailer at $22,300. This finished production also provides the first phases and initial elements in creating our eventual 22-minute Badland Wives pilot episode.
The Team


 
How We're Different
Dawghouse, LLC
COMPANY OVERVIEW & BACKGROUND
Dawghouse, LLC began its operations as Leroy, Jobst & Curley in 1993 as Midwest producers of locally originated television programming. Pidge Jobst did much of the creative for the local FOX WTTE-28 Kids Club affiliate, which later became the template for the National FOX Kids Club, which spread into markets across the U.S.  Dawghouse LLC. also provides specialized graphic and illustrative services for both national and local corporate entities, along with high-profile advertising campaigns that utilize television, radio, web and internet, magazine print mediums for market distribution. 
INFANCY SUCCESSES:
       Dawghouse, LLC. enjoyed immediate success. Early on, the company was awarded commissioned contracts for the development of two weekly television series programs for Production Partners, Inc., namely "Ohio Golf" and "Columbus Cooks". In addition, the company produced and developed a third in-house, 52 episode, children’s live-action educational program known as "Crystal Palace." These programs embodied all phases of development, including: (1) Concept Development and Packaging, (2) Distribution, (3) Site Management, (4) Pre-Production, (5) Editing and Post-production, (6) Major Sponsor Sales and TV Avails Commercial Solicitation, along with (7) Product Placement and General Merchandising.     The weekly children’s television series aired for three years and was produced before a live-studio audience. It was the first locally-originated children’s television program to be produced in over 22 years of Columbus' history. The conpany also produced "Crysta Palace's Tribute To Luci's Toyshop, "THE MOVIE." in November 1994. Joined by Wendy’s International, LJC distributed the movie into area AMC Theatres.
Now since moving its operations to LA in 2010, the studio is embarked on providing viewers new and original, edgy animation, drama series, reality and docu-drama series, game and competition series, and more.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you feel this show would make for good programming, please Share, Retweet, and Regram this campaign with friends on social media sites. You can go to the Indiegogo share tools. 
Thank you!
Badland Wives Team

story:
My name is Aaron Simmons. I suppose I began this journey as an actor.  I've been working towards this moment for decades. My first gig as an extra was in a film titled "Andersonville". After a multitude of gigs as an extra, I  was finally given the opportunity to act and to portray some very interesting characters. Along this journey, I explored other avenues of creativity such as painting and writing to cope with the dry spells and the day jobs. I was finally getting booked but it wasn't enough because my ultimate goal was to tell my own stories and to work behind the camera while wearing many different hats. After a long hiatus from auditioning and taking acting gigs, I decided to take this script I call "Iridescence" off of the dusty shelf and make it my life goal to transform it into the vision that had been trapped inside of my head for so long. While on this hiatus, I was given the opportunity to learn all aspects of a production, along with cinematography and post production not excluding visual efx. Everything you've seen so far, I have edited or created myself. 

This campaign is very important of course because I want to make sure that this is done right and all cast and crew are well taken care of for their support, faith and hard work while we roll out the carpet for this multilayered story. This began in 2014 as a 44 page short/feature but I never felt the story had the creative justice it needed. So after many revisions, the script finally landed just where it was destined to land. I began doing tests with some of the scenes that I had written and the results transformed a simple idea into the prospect of a feature. During that one last revision of the script, I realized that it would be even more conducive to the vision to convert it into a series. This is the trend now and it is a very marketable trend. I realized that my story and its characters needed a lot more room to breathe rather than be constricted to a 90-120 page feature script format. 

This train is rolling faster towards principal photography and I want to ensure that it is given the life it deserves as we aim to share this with a vast audience. Any contribution whether it be creative investment from talented artists, funding or simply putting out the word will help myself and everyone that is on board so far to take this completely from preproduction to distribution with our eyes set on such platforms as Hulu, Amazon and Netflix with several seasons to show. 

If you look up "underdog" in your dictionary, you just may find my picture. I can say that I've accomplished a lot so far but there have been many obstacles. I believe that with every small obstacle, there is an even larger opportunity just waiting around the corner. There are always risks involved with an ambitious project like this but I am an individual that simply does not ever give up on a dream. This is my dream and it can be your vision as well. We are always seeking inspiration through many facets of our lives to keep us smiling, to keep our hearts beating and to stay motivated. Allow me to inspire you with a story not too far from my own life story and  I will show you things that you never thought you could imagine.

story:
More Than Just a Fan Series

Ghostbusters has touched us all. It's one of the most beloved film franchises of all time.  For many years the fans have been starved for a continuation of the original movies in film form, we seek to rectify that problem. Not only that, we want to make something for the fans, by fans, where our audience can contribute to what they would like to see this world to go.

First, a little bit about myself:

  • My name is Christopher J. Tomlinson and I have had over a decade of experience in the film and television broadcast industry.  I have been on countless professional sets, and have had the privilege of writing and/or directing 7 distributed feature length films.  In the midst of all that I have always maintained one foot in the realm of independent filmmaking, where instead of having to wade through countless meetings, bureaucracy, and creative stifling- artists are allowed to examine storytelling in ways they truly want.  I hope to bring all the awesome power a financed studio could bring to the raw talent and passion an indie set has to wield in further episodes of Ghostbusters: Station 6.
  • Ghostbusters has been in my life as long as I can remember.  One of the first times I ever sat down to write a script I wrote a Ghostbusters one.  I grabbed my dad's VHS camcorder, and trusty Kenner backpack- and any willing souls in my neighborhood.  I was in 7th grade, it was lame- and you will NEVER see it.  My 3rd, 5th, 12th, 18th, 25th, and 30th birthday cakes donned the GB logo- and I plan to see that on my cake many more times.  
  • This project is my dream project. Almost every Ghostbusters fan thinks, "man, if only they did this or that with the story," but they don't have the resources. We have the ability to create our own stories within the universe and we can help you bring other stories into the universe. We have our plan for how this show will play out - and some of your ideas might even already be incorporated into our plans - but there is room for additional story elements, even scene ideas or Ghostbuster moments you've always wanted to see. For instance, you might think, "What would happen if some criminal stole a proton pack? How much damage would that cause? What are the insurance ramifications of such things?" Those are good questions and similar ideas could be submitted to us and might be incorporated into the show!

We hope you share the same love and the same vision for Ghostbusters that we do. The bottom line is, we want to make something that all of us can enjoy as fans. Now, let's get a little more specific.

What We Need & What You Get

Why not use our own money?! Well, we did. It's all in the first episode. We also called in every favor we could from industry professionals to give it as much production value as possible.  We left it "all on the field" so to speak.  This of course, is not sustainable for any extended period of time.

The good news is, we can now involve the audience! We know you love Ghostbusters just as much as we do, so we value your contribution. Not only monetarily, but also your feedback. An unsuccessful crowdfunding campaign is pretty indicative that our show did not sit well with the general audience, and saves us the time and embarrassment of playing where we're not wanted.

However, if Ghostbusters: Station 6 strikes a chord with fans like we think it will, your ideas and feedback might make it directly into the show! Remember, this is by the fans and for the fans. With the money and resources from this campaign, we'll be able to solicit ideas from hardcore fans, such as yourselves, to make the series appeal to a wider range of Ghostbusters fans (and hopefully beyond). Obviously, from a practicality standpoint, we would not be able to include every idea submitted to us, but we will consider all of them and if we take your idea, we'll include your name in the credits!

  • We're looking to raise $20,000 for episode 2 ONLY. We can only take this on an episode by episode basis for now, but any excess funding is not excess! We will put that money towards future episodes. The larger the contributions, the more efficient we will be in getting you more episodes!
  • It's important to note that because this is a fan project, nobody is legally allowed to profit on this venture. Therefore, all the money donated will end up directly on the screen.
  • For your contribution, you get some amazing perks in return. All the usual stuff is there - , copies of the finished product, autographs, screen credits, and on set visits... But we also offer stuff unique to this campaign, including customized Ghostbusters uniforms, screen-used props from the show, and for a lucky few... YOUR VERY OWN PROTON SCREEN USED PACK!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we admit our first episode didn't land with fans as we'd hoped and we will stop production of the series. However, the money donated will go to fulfill the perks of those who contributed. Obviously, if we come close to the goal, we will still produce the second episode, but will likely stop after that.

Past Work

Chris and Chris' Fortune & Glory Productions initially formed for their stoner comedy student film, Alien Abdicktion, featuring Jonathan "Lil' J" McDaniel (That's So Raven!, Hit the Floor) and Robbie Moore (Reno 911!, Bones) and Station 6's Veronica Ray.

They followed that up with the 2012 award-winning dramatic short film, Forgetting Regret, starring Station 6's Chris Kato, Veronica Ray, and Brent Huff, which you can watch here:



If you haven't already checked it out, here is Ghostbusters: Station 6 Episode 1!

 

Risks & Challenges

The original pilot episode took 2.5 years of pre-production and nearly a year of post production.  This is not only because our entire cast and crew has day jobs in the industry, it is also because our "budget" was only for the construction of equipment, costumes, and food for the filming days.  There was absolutely no wiggle room.

  • Luckily, most of pre-production was because we were hand building our equipment and costumes- good news!  They're already built!  That takes care of pre-production, although the more we have contributed the more we can explore incorporating new equipment designs.  What would a proton pack look like if Spengler and Stantz built it in a laboratory with all the parts they could possibly ever need instead of the firehouse garage?  Station 6 has the decrepit hand me down equipment, but would the Los Angeles branch?  We would love to see the creativity of fans who could design this and watch it come to life on screen!
  • Production worked out great last time!  But we have nearly exhausted all of our free locations we have access to, this will require us to find places who are not only willing to have us, but are also willing to cut us some slack as film permits alone for a single day are upwards of 800 dollars in our area.  We don't exactly have the Mayor asking us, "What do you need from me?"  Luckily, our producers have extensive experience in stretching a budget, so we could get some cool locations while tightening our belts in other areas and still maintaining high production value. 
    We shot the original 45 page pilot over the course of 3 days. This is unprecedented for any film set, but it was because that was the only way we could work out locations, actors, and not get fired from our day jobs.  Once we cross the boundary from free locations to paid locations, scheduling becomes much easier.
  • On the first episode we found out our largest time drain was post-production, specifically special effects.  This is because we were scrounging for free versions of what we could do with more powerful software.  Ghosts were literally us on green screen, or bought for pennies from template CGI sites.  It "worked" but that's because we had dedicated volunteers learning programs they had never used to create effects they had never done.  The proton streams were built from scratch, and had to be adjusted frame by frame.  There are plugins and generators, as well as high powered programs we can utilize, are familiar with, but just don't have a copy we could use.  We are also in touch with several puppeteer companies as the goal has always been to mimic the same style of ghosts found in the movies.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody has the ability to contribute financially. We get it. We've been there. In fact, we're still there! Trust me, if we could fund it all ourselves, we would. But there are other ways you can help!

  • The easiest way to help us out is to use that "SHARE" button here on the campaign page and share the campaign with all your Ghostbuster fan friends and family that appreciate what we're trying to do. If you're strapped for cash, but have a rich uncle who loves Ghostbusters, you might be able to see every episode without contributing a cent! Ain't that the life? (DISCLAIMER: If you do have that uncle, please let us know...everyone has three mortgages nowadays.)
  • Do you have a business where we can shoot? Or Ghostbusters-related props and/or costumes we can borrow? Or do you own a food establishment and wouldn't mind donating food for a relatively small crew for one of three or four shoot days? We can't pay people, but we still have to feed them! Any and all of this helps reduce expenses and therefore stretches our budget a little further, perhaps another episode.

And that's all there is to it.  You've seen what we could do with no budget, now see what we can all do together and take this franchise into a direction where we know it has all the potential of being.  Suit up, switch on, and join the team.  These ghosts ain't going to bust themselves.

**If Episode 2 is not fully funded, any perks pertaining to receiving Episode 2 items (digital downloads, screen credits, walk on parts, etc.) will not be fulfilled.  Station 6 crew apologizes, however something special will be given to you.
