story:
Why are we GROWING GREEN?

The goal of this campaign is to raise enough resources to complete a killer Pilot Presentation that's going to "WOW" networks -and- streaming services that might be interested in picking it up. From there, we take it to the next level. As a job, it's going to be awesome to work on in every role from actor to cameraman to props master. As a home viewer, it's going to be hilarious and uplifting in it's honest, poignant comedy. At the end of the day, this is about entertaining the masses and providing the very best story and music possible. It's a show where you will want to listen to the soundtrack every week.

ABOUT THE CREATOR:

  • ALEX YACOVELLI is a New York City based Actor-Musician. He's a graduate of NYU Steinhart Vocal Performance (Music Theatre) and is currently enrolled at Parsons School of Design (Graphic Design). Alex has released two solo rock albums to date, Electri-Fi and Sweet Nimbus Nothings [EP], as well as singles and videos with his band, Not Your Queen's English. In 2008, he played with Weezer during their encore at Madison Square Garden. He's a proud member of Actors Equity and soon to be SAG-AFTRA.    
  •  Tweet @alexyacovelli      www.AlexYac.com
    • PREVIEW HIS CINEMATIC WORK in "The Crunchy Crusader," a Doritos superhero commercial he wrote and produced here:
      • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X82UpeYjkGA
    • PREVIEW HIS ROCK STYLINGS in this cover of "Can't Change Me" by Chris Cornell (solo, Soungarden, Audiosoave):
      • https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Eo-l-rVeiCA

How can I help "plant the seeds?"

Cost Breakdown

  • Considering many films and series spend $20 Million plus in production, we're setting a modest goal of $20K. No matter what we raise, this production's going down. We will sell our blood like Robert Rodriguez, if need be.
    • Some areas where funding will go include:
      • Casting - $2K-3K
        • A professional Casting Director, generally gets $1K per main role. However, in recognizing that this is an "indie" project, they've agreed to lessen costs and throw in some supplementary roles with the package.
          • Greyson Green is CAST. So there's one role down!
      • Equipment - $6K-8K
        • Camera
          • Covers daily or weekly rental, insurance, and things like lenses, rigs, tracks, and other setups.
        • Lighting
          • Just like photography, the exact equipment depends on the needs of the shot. But it's KEY that this look crisp and ultra professional.
      • Props - $1K
        • Fake cannabis plants (sorry growers, no real deal).
          • We need a family of at least 6-10 plants for this story.
        • Fake US currency - bills marked "for cinematic use only"
        • 3D figurine of Mr. Moonbanks, space chimp
          •  The mascot of Greyson's employer, Moonbanks Coffee, is one of the most essential points in the script.  (Think E-Corp in Mr. Robot. What would the story be without it?)
          • 3D plans and rendering normally cost about $3K, but we've got an "inside man" who's offering an extremely modest rate cause he believes in the godliness of this monkey as much as we do.
      • Production - $10K+
        • ​Actors
          • May be SAF-AFTRA union rates -or- Non-Union rates, depending on the needs of the production. A union contract will most likely fall under "New Media" or the like.
        • Director / Director of Photography (DP)
          • I have a great network of NYU and other talented filmmakers. I'd like to be able to pay all party's involved a fair day's rate.
        • Assistant Director
          • ​This is always a wise person to have on set to keep an eye on various aspects of production.
        • Production Assistants (PAs)
          • ​The cogs and gears of the set. Without them, the watch doesn't tick.
        • Continuity
          • Nothing's worse than when the next shot doesn't make sense! If things are green, we need to make sure they stay green.
        • Sound Crew
          • ​It's a show about Rock & Roll! Sound is ultra important! We need a small crew who know their equipment, are nimble, and never miss a good take.
        • Lighting Crew
          • Film is about light. If the lighting isn't good, the greatest performance in the world won't matter.
        • Makeup/Costumes
          • ​I'm super excited to have some good friends, well accredited pros, that will step into these roles. They're well versed in the television scene.
        • Catering (craft services)
          • ​A hard days work calls for a good meal. Luckily, my parents are restauranteurs and pro caterers, so I'm pretty sure I can handle this on whatever budget necessary.
      • Miscellaneous - $500
        • Last shoot I did, I needed to purchase a 30' rope out of nowhere. Believe me, just like in any other business, stuff comes up.
      • Post Production
        • Editing - $1500
          • ​Hours and hours of time go into good editing. Although I'll take on a lot of this myself, it's great to have a pro with a keen set of eyes and an innate sense of cinematic timing. Especially in comedy.
        • Audio Engineering/Mastering - $800
          • ​There will be quite a bit more music involved. Robin Lai did an amazing job assisting with the recording of the theme song. I'd love to continue to have him onboard as well as a Mastering Engineer to get that final sound toned, compressed, and buzzing with "in your face" goodness.
      • Website - $200
        • The series is going to need a good website. I've already parked a good amount of URLs, but hosting and design will be needed. Having a home for future investors and fans is key in the success of this project.
      • In the spirit of Green-ery, any excess funds will be donated to The Nature Conservancy of NY, or a similarly green-friendly cause.

The Payoff

Not only can you say you knew about it first, but you're going to get some awesome swag to prove it! By the time your friends are binging, you'll be old hat. Check out our AWESOME PERKS below. Remember the first time you tried on that Pollos Hermanos tee shirt? I know I do. Welcome to the future of television...
story_txt:
Why are we GROWING GREEN?
The goal of this campaign is to raise enough resources to complete a killer Pilot Presentation that's going to "WOW" networks -and- streaming services that might be interested in picking it up. From there, we take it to the next level. As a job, it's going to be awesome to work on in every role from actor to cameraman to props master. As a home viewer, it's going to be hilarious and uplifting in it's honest, poignant comedy. At the end of the day, this is about entertaining the masses and providing the very best story and music possible. It's a show where you will want to listen to the soundtrack every week.
ABOUT THE CREATOR:


ALEX YACOVELLI is a New York City based Actor-Musician. He's a graduate of NYU Steinhart Vocal Performance (Music Theatre) and is currently enrolled at Parsons School of Design (Graphic Design). Alex has released two solo rock albums to date, Electri-Fi and Sweet Nimbus Nothings [EP], as well as singles and videos with his band, Not Your Queen's English. In 2008, he played with Weezer during their encore at Madison Square Garden. He's a proud member of Actors Equity and soon to be SAG-AFTRA.    
 Tweet @alexyacovelli      www.AlexYac.com

PREVIEW HIS CINEMATIC WORK in "The Crunchy Crusader," a Doritos superhero commercial he wrote and produced here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X82UpeYjkGA


PREVIEW HIS ROCK STYLINGS in this cover of "Can't Change Me" by Chris Cornell (solo, Soungarden, Audiosoave):https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Eo-l-rVeiCA





How can I help "plant the seeds?"
Cost Breakdown
Considering many films and series spend $20 Million plus in production, we're setting a modest goal of $20K. No matter what we raise, this production's going down. We will sell our blood like Robert Rodriguez, if need be.Some areas where funding will go include:

Casting - $2K-3KA professional Casting Director, generally gets $1K per main role. However, in recognizing that this is an "indie" project, they've agreed to lessen costs and throw in some supplementary roles with the package.Greyson Green is CAST. So there's one role down!



Equipment - $6K-8K
CameraCovers daily or weekly rental, insurance, and things like lenses, rigs, tracks, and other setups.

LightingJust like photography, the exact equipment depends on the needs of the shot. But it's KEY that this look crisp and ultra professional.




Props - $1K
Fake cannabis plants (sorry growers, no real deal).We need a family of at least 6-10 plants for this story.

Fake US currency - bills marked "for cinematic use only"
3D figurine of Mr. Moonbanks, space chimp
 The mascot of Greyson's employer, Moonbanks Coffee, is one of the most essential points in the script.  (Think E-Corp in Mr. Robot. What would the story be without it?)
3D plans and rendering normally cost about $3K, but we've got an "inside man" who's offering an extremely modest rate cause he believes in the godliness of this monkey as much as we do.





Production - $10K+

​ActorsMay be SAF-AFTRA union rates -or- Non-Union rates, depending on the needs of the production. A union contract will most likely fall under "New Media" or the like.


Director / Director of Photography (DP)I have a great network of NYU and other talented filmmakers. I'd like to be able to pay all party's involved a fair day's rate.


Assistant Director
​This is always a wise person to have on set to keep an eye on various aspects of production.


Production Assistants (PAs)
​The cogs and gears of the set. Without them, the watch doesn't tick.


ContinuityNothing's worse than when the next shot doesn't make sense! If things are green, we need to make sure they stay green.


Sound Crew
​It's a show about Rock & Roll! Sound is ultra important! We need a small crew who know their equipment, are nimble, and never miss a good take.


Lighting CrewFilm is about light. If the lighting isn't good, the greatest performance in the world won't matter.


Makeup/Costumes​I'm super excited to have some good friends, well accredited pros, that will step into these roles. They're well versed in the television scene.


Catering (craft services)
​A hard days work calls for a good meal. Luckily, my parents are restauranteurs and pro caterers, so I'm pretty sure I can handle this on whatever budget necessary.




Miscellaneous - $500Last shoot I did, I needed to purchase a 30' rope out of nowhere. Believe me, just like in any other business, stuff comes up.


Post Production

Editing - $1500
​Hours and hours of time go into good editing. Although I'll take on a lot of this myself, it's great to have a pro with a keen set of eyes and an innate sense of cinematic timing. Especially in comedy.


Audio Engineering/Mastering - $800
​There will be quite a bit more music involved. Robin Lai did an amazing job assisting with the recording of the theme song. I'd love to continue to have him onboard as well as a Mastering Engineer to get that final sound toned, compressed, and buzzing with "in your face" goodness.




Website - $200The series is going to need a good website. I've already parked a good amount of URLs, but hosting and design will be needed. Having a home for future investors and fans is key in the success of this project.

In the spirit of Green-ery, any excess funds will be donated to The Nature Conservancy of NY, or a similarly green-friendly cause.




The Payoff
Not only can you say you knew about it first, but you're going to get some awesome swag to prove it! By the time your friends are binging, you'll be old hat. Check out our AWESOME PERKS below. Remember the first time you tried on that Pollos Hermanos tee shirt? I know I do. Welcome to the future of television...

story:
Overview:

The Pointe is unlike any show you've seen before – when Krish Shetty becomes the first Indian lifeguard in this conservative beach town, we meet The Pointe's all-too-familiar characters in situations that will keep you laughing and face-palming throughout. Krish wittily maneuvers through a bombardment of stereotypes, showing everyone who he really is, and even making a few friends in the process. Sort of. The series is perfect for the city-goer who remembers growing up in a small town, the small townie who wants a relatable escape, or the urbanite who likes to roll their eyes at folks who move to the city and still use phrases like "alternate lifestyle." Master of None meets Community meets Baywatch, The Pointe is a show that you won't want to miss – but we need YOUR help to make it happen!

 

What We Need:

In order to make the best possible show for all of you, we’re going to need some serious help! We have set a budget of $10,000. The funds raised in this campaign will go towards professional sound, lighting and camera equipment.  As well as helping with some killer set design. As you will see below we have a rather large crew that is sure to work up an appetite. We would also like to cover some of our marketing and post production costs.  Below we have listed a more detailed chart so you can see exactly where your contributions are going.

 

Why Contribute?

With all these others projects on Indiegogo you're probably asking yourself, WhatsThePointe? Great Question!  Here at The Pointe we have a cast and crew of over 40 people who are all working for free to help make this project the best it can be. This is a huge budget cut but it is still not enough to bring our vision to life. Your support will not only help us take this project to the next level but it will also keep us motivated to bring you a show unlike any other. We know that taking on a project this size always comes with some risk. We believe that as a team we will be able to overcome the odds and deliver the goods. We have pushed to shoot this all on location, with as small a budget as possible. How will we deal with these challenges? Lot’s of planning! Making sure everyone is completely prepared before we even arrive on set and taking into consideration that not everything will go according to plan. We have already scheduled extra shooting days and have formed numerous backup plans to account for unforeseen circumstances. If you want easy, make a sandwich! We are taking this chance with the belief that true art comes from pushing the limits of your own creativity!

 

What’s in it for you?

As you can see, here at The Pointe we have developed a motto: The more the merrier! And we would love to bring you along for the ride! We have come up with a long list of Perks for you to enjoy! Can’t find a Perk that works for you? No problem! Feel free to email us at: ThePointeProduction@gmail.com with any questions or requests! We promise to do do our best to accommodate you. Even if you can’t contribute don’t worry, we still love you! Sharing this campaign with your friends on social media is a big help! Be sure to follow us for all the latest updates!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ThePointeTVShow/

Instagram: ThePointeTV

Thanks to Young Harbor for their awesome tunes!

P.S. WE WILL HAVE OFFICIAL “THE POINTE” MERCH COMING SOON!

 

Our Team:

Vishnu Prasad (Krish Shetty) - Director/ Writer

My name is Vishnu Prasad and I’m an Indian-born writer and director from Stamford, Connecticut. I’ve lived in India, England and the US. Growing up in three different countries has it’s side effects. I don't see the world like everyone else and I have always felt like an outsider. Through these experiences, one of the things that i’ve learned was that even though on the outside many things are different, we are more alike than we realize. All of these adventures have helped me in creating deep and interesting characters and the worlds they live in. After graduating from Business school and landing a desk job, I soon realized what I truly wanted to do with my life. I quickly shifted my focus and started learning more about filmmaking. Although I have been writing and creating stories from the age of 8, I never thought I could make a living as a filmmaker. After honing my skills by working on several independent film projects, I wrote and directed my first short film with a $0 budget and minimal crew. Now it’s time to take the next step. After teaming up with my writing partner, Clay Morsey, we believe that we have created an interesting and humorous story that will resonate with anyone who’s ever felt like they’ve been on the outside, or on the inside for that matter.

Clay Morsey Jr. (Ryan Blake) - Director/ Writer

My name is Clay Morsey Jr. and I am a writer from Norwalk, Connecticut. I am a graduate of The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute, where I studied Method acting, writing and directing. During my time at Strasberg I frequently wrote video shorts that were often selected to be produced during class. I have had a passion for writing since a young age and always look for ways to push the boundaries of what can be achieved. After working on an independent feature in New York City last summer, I decided to to create a production of my own. Vishnu and I currently have two projects that are in the works. Both revolve around a group of diverse individuals trying to survive when they are forced out of their comfort zones. As a writer, I have a habit of creating characters that are out of their element. As people I believe that we all at one point develop a routine and a comfort zone. It’s only when that routine and comfort disappears that we truly see ourselves for who we really are. Throughout my life I have had to constantly change and adapt to meet others’ expectations, something that has never been easy for me. Regardless, it has made for some interesting tales and has enabled me to insert a small piece of myself into each new work I create.

Gabrielle Greer  (Sam Blake)

My name is Gabrielle Greer and I’m playing Sam. I'm an actress and theatre artist based in New York City. I hold an MFA from Columbia University's MFA Acting program. Recent theater credits include TheatreLab's production of Closer directed by Tom Martin, and Columbia Stages production of Blue Window directed by Ken Rus Schmoll. I also appeared in the New York Theatre Festival this July in Caught Dreaming. Recent film and commercial credits include t.v. pilot Gener's People directed by Ryan Casey, the short film The Run by Vebs Rao, and a New Balance commercial directed by Dave Bour. I enjoy the collaborative process, and love working on projects that combine my interests in theatre and social justice.

Justin Younts  (Jason Crouse)

My name is Justin Younts. I play Jason, one of the leads in The Pointe. I'm extremely excited about the role. I've been with the production since the beginning. Jason is a role I can bring to life. He's the type of person you can hate and love at the same time.This is one of the reasons that I was drawn to him. As for myself, I am originally from Charlotte, North Carolina. I've been in New York City for four years. I studied at The Neighborhood Playhouse and The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute. I've been in London and studied Perdekamp Emotional Method. Since being in NYC, I've worked in short films. I played Nick in Whiskey Soda, Sport in Holly's Not Home, Ray in Trustworthy, and Bruce in Sunset Psycho. As well as in theatre, I played Antonio in Twelfth Night, Victor in Dead End, and Petruchio in The Taming of the Shrew. I am looking forward to working with the cast and crew on the Pointe.

Jessie Kane Gill (Zoey Scott)

Hi I’m Jessie. I'm a fun lil’ lady who grew up in Ohio and recently graduated from NYU Tisch. I’m an avid ukuleleist who is learning to play the autoharp and working on perfecting my banana bread recipe. I'm an actor and voiceover artist as well as a singer. Also, I wrote one song and it was not that great. I like small dogs, big pizzas, and medium sized cups of black coffee.

Delaney Harter (Charlotte Horne)           

Hi, I’m DeLaney Harter and I’m thrilled to be one of the cast members of the Pointe. I’m a Chicago native and a graduate of New York University, Mannes College of Music, and Walnut Hill School for the Arts in Natick, Massachusetts. I have appeared on Amazon Prime’s “Mozart in the Jungle” and “Law and Order SVU” as well as several commercials. Aside from being an actor, I’m also a classically-trained violinist and enjoy recording and concertizing in ensembles and as a soloist both in New York and around the world.

Chara Kirk (Tiffany Mulligan)

I’m Chara and I’m from Pennsylvania. I moved to NYC three years ago where I studied at The American Musical and Dramtic Academy (AMDA). I have been working as a actress singer and dancer primarily in Musical Theatre. My recent work include "Gypsy" at The Gallery Players and "La Cage Aux Folles" at The Axelrod PAC. I’m excited to have my first on screen debut with "The Pointe" and I’m looking  forward to this brand new adventure.

Chris Cenatiempo (Austin Aldo)        

I am thrilled to be playing the role of Austin in The Pointe. I was born and raised in CT, and have been performing locally for years. My favorite roles include, St. Jimmy from American Idiot and Moritiz from Spring Awakening. I studied Method Acting at Lee Strasberg Acting Institute and at Norwalk Community College under the direction of Heather Parady. When I’m not acting, I work for a nonprofit agency that promotes life skill training and character building for middle schoolers within the community. In my free time, I love anything music related from, going to live shows to crafting the perfect playlist. I also enjoy cooking, experimenting in the kitchen and can make pretty damn good tacos.

Jon Abrado (Derrick Wilson)

My name is Jon Abrado, an American actor, published model, & comedian, from Stamford, CT. I'm playing Derrick, one of the supporting roles of "The Pointe". Derrick is THE smoothest and coolest guy around, and I am very excited to help bring him to life. I have been involved in the arts primarily my entire life.  From a young age, I found myself surrounded by anything that included being in front of an audience, whether it was school musicals, plays, dance acts, and talent shows. That all transpired later on in life, to what I am truly passionate about now, which is TV&Film. I am fascinated by the process of turning stories into live action realities for the audience. Most of my previous work consists of print advertisement, TV&Film background, and commercial work. ESPN, Sprint, Budlight, NFL, Macy's, and KMart are some of the biggest clients I have had just to name a few. Working with some of the production team in the past is going make this process that much more fun, and I can't wait to see how much trouble Derrick can keep Jason out of at The Point.

Steven Moskos (Garrett)

Steven Moskos rose to fame playing the character Ellis in the Off Broadway musical adaptation of Die Hard. His ballad Hans Bubby (I'm Your White Knight) went silver in Australia. Since then he's become an MFA Acting graduate from Columbia University. Now he embarks on a new mission (he, being me. I'm Steven Moskos... Was that not clear?). He--as in me--is to portray the role of Garrett, the alcoholic, failed magician, for the silver screen. Boy can he--as in me--make a beer disapbeer. Disappear! Forgive me, for I, as in Steven Moskos, am a method actor, and I have been preparing most of the night... and day.  Who am i again?

Tony Republicano (Mr. Dumas)

Tony Republicano is thrilled to be back in front of the camera doing his first love, no, not his sexy The Pointe wife… comedy! His long and so called “career” has included: Plays and Musical Theatre - Sisters Rosensweig, Lend Me a Tenor, Annie, Film - The Adderall Diaries, Amazing Spiderman 2, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and Television - The Last Laugh-a comedy pilot for Jimmy Fallon, W.W.E., O.I.T.N.B. and any other New York filmed show that has policemen, prison guards or mafia. Tony brags that he shared a cell on death row with Mike Tyson on Law and Order (sadly his big scene was cut) and that like most of his film and TV credits you can not blink during the show or you’ll miss him. When he’s not performing educational theatre, or playing patients for YALE Medical School he likes to instruct IMPROV comedy workshops. He loves working with the wildly funny cast of The Pointe, and says he doesn’t mind being one of the oldest characters on the show. "Afterall", says Tony, “they don’t call me Daddy for nothing!”

Justin Campbell- Producer

I'm Justin Campbell and I'm a producer based in Connecticut.  In the last couple of years, I have been involved with producing different pictures including the feature Axis and the short film Dumplings.  I have also been involved in the successful indiegogo project for Code 8 starring Stephen and Robbie Amell.  I hope to bring my experience to the project and make it the next best show.

David White- Associate Director & Producer

I’m David White and I’m a self taught screenwriter and cinematographer with an emphasis on Film Directing. I began making short films at 16, and I currently make commercials and promo videos. I studied acting and motion picture editing at the University of Connecticut, where I made my thesis film “Waiting For Nick”. I focus on the complexities and hardships of the human society in my work. Wishing to spark healthy discussions, I often select film topics that have a high level of controversy or social activism. I look forward to working on this show and to collaborate with a fantastic cast and crew.

Paulina Simkin (Mrs. Dumas)- Producer/Casting Director 

My name is Paulina Simkin and I'm an actress, producer and pianist originally from Europe. After getting my Master's in Piano Performance from The Juilliard School I decided to add an acting degree from The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute and it was the best decision of my life. Ever since that I have been acting in feature films, TV shows, commercials, I produced a couple short films and sometimes I even get to play the piano in my projects. And like Mrs. Dumas, I also like to swing... Being part of The Pointe and making it succeed is a matter very close to my heart! I believe it is a unique and at the same time very relatable story that needs to be told. I love our team and would love for everyone to join our incredible journey.

Dani Hanks- Producer

I’m Dani Hanks and I’m a Director/Writer/Producer based in New York City. Since graduating from NYU Tisch Drama in 2015, I have written and directed a handful of short films, as well as music videos in American Sign Language. I have been involved in production on short-form projects, pilots, and indie films. I’m incredibly excited to be producing The Pointe, and is proud to contribute to such a quirky script and work with such a fun team!

Dax Maier- Music Supervisor/Score

Dax Maier started at Albright college focusing on background/scoring music and flamenco guitar training. He focused primarily on production both in the electronic music space and the songwriter/scoring aspect of the music world. Dax studied and was mentored by such acts as Chachi (4am), David Grutman (Miami MMG), Nona Hendryx (Labelle), Gary Corbett (Cinderella). Aj Merlino (Albright College Music), Phil Bash (Bash Concepts), and Ryan Shemen (Success with Teamwork). Dax's music has been placed in the east coast comedy crews music, as well on his electronic side made it onto such blogs and radio stations such as THT World productions, Beyond Trance, Electropulse Music, Next Hyype, Flux BPM, CIY Worldwide. WXAC(Albright College Radio). Dax not only specializes in electronic, but also produces and scores background music for film. He also has sponsorships with Next Hyype(music ap) and Night gear co, a rave jewelry company. On the electronic side of his project Dax performs with his duo Dax&Atragun. They went on to play such places as Hammerstein Ballroom, Jewel Yacht, Hudson Terrace, LIV, Story, Lavo, Troy Liquor Bar and Brooklyn Warehouse.  

Elizabeth Viggiano - Set Designer/Photographer

My name is Elizabeth Viggiano and I'm the set designer and photographer for The Pointe. After receiving a BFA in Photography at MassArt in Boston, I started a photography business mostly revolving around weddings and fashion. I approached weddings with cinema in mind, focusing on various narratives that the guests created. To me, it felt like a movie production coming together that I had to make sense of visually.

At that, I always had a passion for staging scenes in my images. I grew up in an old Stamford, Connecticut home filled with antiques, art, and confusing design. There were things everywhere and most of my upbringing consisted of restaging rooms constantly to find "order" in it all. I like to think of this as the base that stemmed my photography journey. I can't wait for my "Pointe" of view to come across in this upcoming series!

Recent film and commercial credits include t.v. pilot Gener's People directed by Ryan Casey, the short film The Run by Vebs Rao, and a New Balance commercial directed by Dave Bour. I enjoy the collaborative process, and love working on projects that combine my interests in theatre and social justice.Justin Younts  (Jason Crouse)My name is Justin Younts. I play Jason, one of the leads in The Pointe. I'm extremely excited about the role. I've been with the production since the beginning. Jason is a role I can bring to life. He's the type of person you can hate and love at the same time.This is one of the reasons that I was drawn to him. As for myself, I am originally from Charlotte, North Carolina. I've been in New York City for four years. I studied at The Neighborhood Playhouse and The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute. I've been in London and studied Perdekamp Emotional Method. Since being in NYC, I've worked in short films. I played Nick in Whiskey Soda, Sport in Holly's Not Home, Ray in Trustworthy, and Bruce in Sunset Psycho. As well as in theatre, I played Antonio in Twelfth Night, Victor in Dead End, and Petruchio in The Taming of the Shrew. I am looking forward to working with the cast and crew on the Pointe.Jessie Kane Gill (Zoey Scott)Hi I’m Jessie. I'm a fun lil’ lady who grew up in Ohio and recently graduated from NYU Tisch. I’m an avid ukuleleist who is learning to play the autoharp and working on perfecting my banana bread recipe. I'm an actor and voiceover artist as well as a singer. Also, I wrote one song and it was not that great. I like small dogs, big pizzas, and medium sized cups of black coffee.Delaney Harter (Charlotte Horne)           Hi, I’m DeLaney Harter and I’m thrilled to be one of the cast members of the Pointe. I’m a Chicago native and a graduate of New York University, Mannes College of Music, and Walnut Hill School for the Arts in Natick, Massachusetts. I have appeared on Amazon Prime’s “Mozart in the Jungle” and “Law and Order SVU” as well as several commercials. Aside from being an actor, I’m also a classically-trained violinist and enjoy recording and concertizing in ensembles and as a soloist both in New York and around the world.Chara Kirk (Tiffany Mulligan)I’m Chara and I’m from Pennsylvania. I moved to NYC three years ago where I studied at The American Musical and Dramtic Academy (AMDA). I have been working as a actress singer and dancer primarily in Musical Theatre. My recent work include "Gypsy" at The Gallery Players and "La Cage Aux Folles" at The Axelrod PAC. I’m excited to have my first on screen debut with "The Pointe" and I’m looking  forward to this brand new adventure.Chris Cenatiempo (Austin Aldo)        I am thrilled to be playing the role of Austin in The Pointe. I was born and raised in CT, and have been performing locally for years. My favorite roles include, St. Jimmy from American Idiot and Moritiz from Spring Awakening. I studied Method Acting at Lee Strasberg Acting Institute and at Norwalk Community College under the direction of Heather Parady. When I’m not acting, I work for a nonprofit agency that promotes life skill training and character building for middle schoolers within the community. In my free time, I love anything music related from, going to live shows to crafting the perfect playlist. I also enjoy cooking, experimenting in the kitchen and can make pretty damn good tacos.Jon Abrado (Derrick Wilson)My name is Jon Abrado, an American actor, published model, & comedian, from Stamford, CT. I'm playing Derrick, one of the supporting roles of "The Pointe". Derrick is THE smoothest and coolest guy around, and I am very excited to help bring him to life. I have been involved in the arts primarily my entire life.  From a young age, I found myself surrounded by anything that included being in front of an audience, whether it was school musicals, plays, dance acts, and talent shows. That all transpired later on in life, to what I am truly passionate about now, which is TV&Film. I am fascinated by the process of turning stories into live action realities for the audience. Most of my previous work consists of print advertisement, TV&Film background, and commercial work. ESPN, Sprint, Budlight, NFL, Macy's, and KMart are some of the biggest clients I have had just to name a few. Working with some of the production team in the past is going make this process that much more fun, and I can't wait to see how much trouble Derrick can keep Jason out of at The Point.Steven Moskos (Garrett)Steven Moskos rose to fame playing the character Ellis in the Off Broadway musical adaptation of Die Hard. His ballad Hans Bubby (I'm Your White Knight) went silver in Australia. Since then he's become an MFA Acting graduate from Columbia University. Now he embarks on a new mission (he, being me. I'm Steven Moskos... Was that not clear?). He--as in me--is to portray the role of Garrett, the alcoholic, failed magician, for the silver screen. Boy can he--as in me--make a beer disapbeer. Disappear! Forgive me, for I, as in Steven Moskos, am a method actor, and I have been preparing most of the night... and day.  Who am i again?Tony Republicano (Mr. Dumas)Tony Republicano is thrilled to be back in front of the camera doing his first love, no, not his sexy The Pointe wife… comedy! His long and so called “career” has included: Plays and Musical Theatre - Sisters Rosensweig, Lend Me a Tenor, Annie, Film - The Adderall Diaries, Amazing Spiderman 2, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and Television - The Last Laugh-a comedy pilot for Jimmy Fallon, W.W.E., O.I.T.N.B. and any other New York filmed show that has policemen, prison guards or mafia. Tony brags that he shared a cell on death row with Mike Tyson on Law and Order (sadly his big scene was cut) and that like most of his film and TV credits you can not blink during the show or you’ll miss him. When he’s not performing educational theatre, or playing patients for YALE Medical School he likes to instruct IMPROV comedy workshops. He loves working with the wildly funny cast of The Pointe, and says he doesn’t mind being one of the oldest characters on the show. "Afterall", says Tony, “they don’t call me Daddy for nothing!”Justin Campbell- ProducerI'm Justin Campbell and I'm a producer based in Connecticut.  In the last couple of years, I have been involved with producing different pictures including the feature Axis and the short film Dumplings.  I have also been involved in the successful indiegogo project for Code 8 starring Stephen and Robbie Amell.  I hope to bring my experience to the project and make it the next best show.David White- Associate Director & ProducerI’m David White and I’m a self taught screenwriter and cinematographer with an emphasis on Film Directing. I began making short films at 16, and I currently make commercials and promo videos. I studied acting and motion picture editing at the University of Connecticut, where I made my thesis film “Waiting For Nick”. I focus on the complexities and hardships of the human society in my work. Wishing to spark healthy discussions, I often select film topics that have a high level of controversy or social activism. I look forward to working on this show and to collaborate with a fantastic cast and crew.Paulina Simkin (Mrs. Dumas)- Producer/Casting Director My name is Paulina Simkin and I'm an actress, producer and pianist originally from Europe. After getting my Master's in Piano Performance from The Juilliard School I decided to add an acting degree from The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute and it was the best decision of my life. Ever since that I have been acting in feature films, TV shows, commercials, I produced a couple short films and sometimes I even get to play the piano in my projects. And like Mrs. Dumas, I also like to swing... Being part of The Pointe and making it succeed is a matter very close to my heart! I believe it is a unique and at the same time very relatable story that needs to be told. I love our team and would love for everyone to join our incredible journey.Dani Hanks- ProducerI’m Dani Hanks and I’m a Director/Writer/Producer based in New York City. Since graduating from NYU Tisch Drama in 2015, I have written and directed a handful of short films, as well as music videos in American Sign Language. I have been involved in production on short-form projects, pilots, and indie films. I’m incredibly excited to be producing The Pointe, and is proud to contribute to such a quirky script and work with such a fun team!Dax Maier- Music Supervisor/ScoreDax Maier started at Albright college focusing on background/scoring music and flamenco guitar training. He focused primarily on production both in the electronic music space and the songwriter/scoring aspect of the music world. Dax studied and was mentored by such acts as Chachi (4am), David Grutman (Miami MMG), Nona Hendryx (Labelle), Gary Corbett (Cinderella). Aj Merlino (Albright College Music), Phil Bash (Bash Concepts), and Ryan Shemen (Success with Teamwork). Dax's music has been placed in the east coast comedy crews music, as well on his electronic side made it onto such blogs and radio stations such as THT World productions, Beyond Trance, Electropulse Music, Next Hyype, Flux BPM, CIY Worldwide. WXAC(Albright College Radio). Dax not only specializes in electronic, but also produces and scores background music for film. He also has sponsorships with Next Hyype(music ap) and Night gear co, a rave jewelry company. On the electronic side of his project Dax performs with his duo Dax&Atragun. They went on to play such places as Hammerstein Ballroom, Jewel Yacht, Hudson Terrace, LIV, Story, Lavo, Troy Liquor Bar and Brooklyn Warehouse.  Elizabeth Viggiano - Set Designer/PhotographerMy name is Elizabeth Viggiano and I'm the set designer and photographer for The Pointe. After receiving a BFA in Photography at MassArt in Boston, I started a photography business mostly revolving around weddings and fashion. I approached weddings with cinema in mind, focusing on various narratives that the guests created. To me, it felt like a movie production coming together that I had to make sense of visually.At that, I always had a passion for staging scenes in my images. I grew up in an old Stamford, Connecticut home filled with antiques, art, and confusing design. There were things everywhere and most of my upbringing consisted of restaging rooms constantly to find "order" in it all. I like to think of this as the base that stemmed my photography journey. I can't wait for my "Pointe" of view to come across in this upcoming series!

story:
Although originally conceived as a documentary feature film, the story was far too big and multi-layered to fit into that structure so we had to re-think it as a series of webisodes.

Women have a long history as participants and leaders in fandoms, and I am continually inspired by those women who have paved the way for modern fandom, the unsung heroes who helmed the letter writing campaigns in the early days of Hollywood, who wrote, edited and distributed the 'zines of the 60's, 70's and '80's and have now added to fandoms as outspoken voices in fan journalism, fanfiction, podcasting, fanart, social media, and much much more.

This project is a celebration, a history, and an archive of women's contribution to fandom & popular culture. 

Who is working on this project?:

I'm particularly proud to say that my primary crew is made up of women.

Hansi Oppenheimer (Producer, Director, Writer)  I'm most well known as the Creator of the feature documentary Color Me Obsessed: A Film About The Replacements. The film is the history of the band as told by their fans. My background also includes many years managing and archiving media libraries.

Dr. Lynn Zubernis (Co-Writer, Associate Producer) Lynn is well known in the Supernatural fan community for her excellent books on fandom (Fangasm: Supernatural Fangirls) and her coverage of conventions. 

Chinisha Scott (Post Producer, Editor, Co-Writer) Chinisha is a filmmaker and educator. She leads the Young Women of Cinema Program at DCTV in New York– a program that assists young women to digest and understand the gravity of representation in the media, as the participants create their own original projects. 

Meredith Levine (Researcher, Co-Writer) Meredith has spoken at San Diego Comic Con, Comikaze, and VidCon on the subject of fans. Her undergraduate degree is in Communication and Culture from Indiana University. Her master’s degree is in Critical Media Studies from UCLA, where she focused her studies on fandom. Her research interests include, fandom, transmedia storytelling, emerging platforms and themed entertainment.



We've had invaluable assistance along the way from the hundreds of fangirls who we have interviewed, helped us to transcribe hours & hours of footage, given us feedback on rough cuts, cosplayed as our logo Troubled Girl, bought t-shirts and mugs, and helped spread the word. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $5000 to pay our credit card for all the costs of our shooting, editing, audio mixing, traveling, screenings, promotional materials and equipment up to this date.
  • If we don't meet our goal, we can still pay off at least some of our costs and continue to create the web series.

The Impact

  • Squee! is important because it gives women a voice in nerd culture. It also offers opportunities for women to work together to create media and supports gender parity and representation.
  • We have been very successful at  presenting Squee! screenings & panels at cons. There has never been a better time for women to show that we have a voice in nerd culture and  the power as consumers to demand equal representation.
  • Squee! supports all marginalized people, not just women and I'm committed to offering a place to tell their stories because I believe that stories are important and if we can see ourselves in media or empathize with one another we can create a better world. 

Risks & Challenges

  • I've been working on Squee! since 2012. While researching a topic for a new film project in 2012, I discovered fanfic, which led me to conducting and filming a series of interviews with fanfic writers & readers. The project quickly took on a life of its own and became an exploration of women, transmedia storytelling, and fandom. 
    As a fangirl myself, I wanted to discuss how others felt about identifying as fangirls, our  communities, the pride and occasional embarrassment we feel, and most of all the passion–the squee. 
    Although originally conceived as a documentary feature film, the story was far too big and multi-layered to fit into that structure so we had to re-think it as a series of webisodes.
  • Once we began to think of the project as a web series it took off. I am also lucky to have found a small crew made up of women who have been incredibly generous with their time and creativity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, please help us get the word out.

  • Please post, share, write reviews, come to our screenings and panels and interact with me on social media.
  • Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you! Squee! is a community project and wouldn't exist without the hundreds of people that have helped contribute to the project, dressing as our logo, creating merch, allowing me to interview them, writing reviews, transcribing, advising, sharing, offering financing and generally being absolutely awesome.

story:
Set in Los Angeles, Maybe This Was a Bad Idea is a comedy about society's expectations of women and artists of color: Zee is an Arab-American visual artist who decides to wok on a new project involving semi-nudes of Arab men to "combat negative stereotypes". Although she’s not willing to admit it, she's subconsciously motivated by her own frustration with men in general, from her dad to her over-dramatic boyfriend Habib. Naturally things start to fall apart in Zee's world and she realizes she doesn't have it all figured out: Maybe her project isn't as groundbreaking as she thought it was. Maybe her boyfriend is holding her back in many ways. And maybe she doesn't want to be seen as an "Arab artist" anymore.

Through the intimate exchanges at her photo studio, Zee starts to realize that maybe the so-called battle of the sexes doesn't have to be a battle after all. But it also brings up new questions which lead to a major plot twist in the last episode that'll have you wanting more (Season 2 is next level!).

WHAT WILL THE EPISODES LOOK LIKE?

We are taking a "Slice of Life" approach to this web series: Every episode will introduce a different male character that Zee is photographing, with a glimpse into their lives and scenes from Zee's personal life. The photo session will be filmed from Zee's camera's POV, with her subjects addressing the camera lens, confessional style - giving viewers a more intimate look into these characters' inner worlds. And this series isn't a straight comedy - some moments will be sad, others infuriating, many hilarious... Much like life itself! 

With scripts written and some of the cast locked, we need $25,000 to shoot and edit 5 episodes because it really does take a village: From the cinematographer to their assistant, the actors to the make-up artist, sound recordist to the editor and more. Then there's equipment rental costs, wardrobe, location permits  and catering! We need about $5000 per episode to make this the best looking show it can be (and that's on the low-end of budgets).

If we don't reach our goal, don't worry - at the very least we'll be creating a strong pilot episode to shop around for more funding. IF WE GO OVER - we're shooting at least one more episode that will take the story to the next level!

BECAUSE TRUMP! 

Actually we can't blame him for everything... Look, no one is doing a show with relatable Arab protagonists on TV or online. And no one is doing a show with an empowered female Arab lead who's in charge of her life and doesn't wear the hijab even though she identifies as Muslim. Arab people are super diverse and our show has characters that are gay, blue-eyed, secular, Saudi, Lebanese - you name it!

Us Arabs have been getting a bad rap in Western media for too long. Much like our main character's photo project, this is a web series that aims to humanize both Middle Eastern men and women through a comedic lens. 

*CURRENTLY CASTING for "ZEE / ZAYNAB" 

NADIA GIOSIA as "CARLA" (Zee's best friend) - Known for her wildly popular Food Network show Bitchin' Kitchen, Nadia's a force to be reckoned with onscreen. Her natural penchant for comedy comes through everything she does, including her punk band The Menstruators!

HABIB SIAM as "HABIB" (Zee's boyfriend) - Born in Lebanon, raised in the UAE and currently residing in Toronto, Canada, Habib is probably the tallest standup comedian to hit up an open mic. He's performed in several of Narcy's music videos, with his breakout role as the two-faced Arab American agent in PHATWA.

NASSER SAMARA as "NASSER" (Zee's brother) - Nasser is a brilliant up and coming director and actor with a very distinctive artistic voice as a Latino-Arab-American. He's creatively collaborated with Hala on several of his films including Temporary, The Candle and The Brittany Show.

HAAZ SLEIMAN as "HASSAN" (Zee's subject) - Established actor Haaz has not only captured our imagination with his dreamy looks and more importantly, his innate talent: As one of the few working Arab actors in Hollywood today, Haaz has had diverse roles from Nurse Jackie's gay nurse "Mo" to the killer role of Jesus Christ himself in The History Channel's "Killing Jesus".

Born in Dubai and raised in Montreal by Iraqi parents, Hala is an LA-based filmmaker who's known for tackling Middle Eastern themes with a twisted sense of humor:

Maybe This Was a Bad Idea was shortlisted by the 2017 Sundance | YouTube Lab and her previous work includes the award-winning fiction web series Human Beasts, which premiered at the Newport Beach Film Festival in California. She's also directed music videos for Iraqi-Canadian Hip Hop artist Narcy, including PHATWA and Makoo! (see above gallery).

If you've donated, please let your peeps on social media know by sharing the link and using the hashtags below. However, if you love this project but can't afford to donate:

  • Share this page http://bit.ly/2uA6Tzi​ + the video on any of your social media platforms
  • Use the hashtags #MTWABI #FemaleGaze #MakeArabsGreatAgain #عيب
  • Talk about it with your friends!

story:
ABOUT THE SERIES

The Faithful Traveler in Portugal  is a travel television series that will explore and uncover the history behind many of Portugal's most beautiful and important Catholic sacred sites, in rich detail and high definition. Starting in Lisbon and traveling up to Porto, the show's host, Diana von Glahn, will present the history behind these breathtaking sacred sites in a fun and informative way that will inspire viewers to visit Portugal on their own, or allow virtual travelers to see things they might never have seen!

Some of the many sacred sites included in this series are:

  • Lisbon: Monastery of St Vicente de Fora, Church of Saint Anthony, Lisbon's Cathedral, Old Church of Our Lady of the Conception, Church of St Dominic, Carmelite Convent, Church of St Roch & Museum, Castle of St George, Monastery of Hieronymites, Pastéis de Belém, Tower of Bethlehem, Discoveries Monument, Monument to Christ, Tile Museum & Mother of God Convent
  • Santarem: Church of the Holy Miracle, where a Eucharistic Miracle occurred
  • Nazaré: Church of Our Lady of Nazaré, Funicular, Chapel of Saint Anthony, Memory Hermitage, Church of Mercy
  • Tomar: Convent of Christ, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, once a Templar Castle and the Convent of the Knights of Christ
  • Batalha: Monastery of Batalha, a magnificent Gothic masterpiece that was once a Dominican monastery, built at the end of the 14th century by King João I, in memory of the battle of Aljubarrota
  • Alcobaça: Monastery of Alcobaça, ​one of the first Cistercian monastic foundations in Portugal
  • Coimbra: New and Old Cathedral, Monastery of Santa Cruz, New Monastery of Saint Clare, Old Monastery of Saint Clare, Church of St John the Baptist
  • Braga: Shrine of Good Jesus of the Mount, Cathedral of Braga, Monastery of St Martin of Tibães, Shrine of Our Lady of Sameiro
  • Porto: Tree of Life Chapel, Cathedral of Porto, Church of St Francis, Church of St Clare, Carmelite Church, Church of Our Lady of Mt Carmel, Church of the Holy House of Mercy

WHY WE'RE CREATING THIS NOW

In May of 2017, Catholics around the world--and especially in Portugal--will celebrate the 100th anniversary of the Marian apparitions at Fátima, one of the most visited pilgrimage sites in the world. Pope Francis recently announced that he would be visiting Fátima in May, and will be canonizing two of the three visionaries, Francisco and Jacinta Marto, who will become the youngest canonized saints.

As Catholics descend on this amazing sacred site, we want to encourage them to explore some of the many other sacred sites that Portugal has to offer. Portugal is rich in Catholic history and is a wonderful, welcoming country. We want to share it with everyone.

WHAT WE'VE DONE SO FAR

In October of 2014, we were invited as guests of a number of Portuguese people in the travel industry to film this series in anticipation of the 100th anniversary of Fátima. While they so generously covered many of our travel expenses, there are many other costs that are involved in the production of a travel series. Out of our own pockets, we returned in October 2015 to film some additional footage we were unable to get the first time around, and will be returning a third time this April to finish up what we need. 

The Faithful Traveler in Fátima

In October 2016, The Faithful Traveler in Fátima, a 1-hour special episode from this series, was released early for the centennial celebrations of the apparitions at Fátima. It was broadcast on multiple networks around the world, including EWTN, CatholicTV, NET TV, KNXT, and others, who will continue to broadcast it throughout the celebrations and beyond. This episode is currently available on DVD via Amazon (but we hope you'll donate here and get it as a perk!).

This special episode tells the story of the apparitions, then explores the Santuario de Nossa Senhora de Fátima, the shrine built at the site of, and dedicated to spreading the message of the apparitions. By watching this episode, pilgrims will be able to better understand what happened at Fátima, and will get a look at the many amazing sites at the shrine that they can visit in a group or on their own pilgrimage. 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

None of the networks that broadcastThe Faithful Traveler--including EWTN, CatholicTV, NET TV, Salt & Light, and others--are able to pay us to produce or broadcast the series. We are not paid up front or afterwards by anyone. The only income generated by The Faithful Traveler is through DVD sales, which don't come close to covering our production costs. We pay for the production of this series with the income we receive from our full-time jobs.

With this series, we have reached the limit of our credit. We need your help to finish this series and bring it to you and people around the world who visit these sacred sites and often have no idea about the Church history behind them.

HOW WE WILL USE THE FUNDS

Your generous donation will help us pay for the following:

  • Travel expenses
  • Production and editing equipment
  • Insurance
  • Music licensing fees
  • Stock footage licensing fees
  • Creation of maps
  • Marketing efforts
  • Perk fulfillment

We've decided to set a flexible goal, which means that even if we don't meet our end goal, we can still keep the money you've generously donated toward completing this series.

*Indigogo, credit card companies, and Paypal take percentages of all donations, so we factored in this amount into our end goal.

WHAT ARE THE PERKS?

ABOUT THE FAITHFUL TRAVELER

The Faithful Traveler is a unique travel series for television that takes viewers to some of the most amazing Catholic sacred sites around the world. Produced by the husband and wife team of David and Diana von Glahn, and hosted by Diana, the series explores the history, tradition, and spiritual significance behind each location in a joyful and spirited manner. No other travel series combines the majesty of the world’s sacred sites with a down-to-earth explanation of their religious aspects and is simultaneously entertaining and enlightening.

PRODUCTIONS BY THE FAITHFUL TRAVELER

We've been producing The Faithful Traveler independently since 2003. This is what we've produced in the last 10 years.

The Faithful Traveler in Fátima

An hour-long special, exploring the history of the angelic and Marian apparitions to Lúcia Santos and her cousins, Francisco and Jacinta Marto in Fátima. Plus, a tour of the shrine built there and visited by Catholics over the last 100 years. Broadcast on EWTN, CatholicTV, NET TV, and others.

Co-Production on Series of videos for the World Meeting of Families in Philadelphia

In anticipation of the World Meeting of Families that took place in Philadelphia in September 2016, Diana teamed up with History Making Productions to create a series of short videos on the sacred sites of the Philadelphia area.

 

The Faithful Traveler: A Papal Pilgrimage in the Holy Land

Three hour-long episodes take an in-depth look at the history of papal pilgrimages to the Holy Land, and explore many of the sacred sites in Jordan, Palestine, and Israel previously visited by Popes Paul VI, St John Paul II, Benedict XVI, and Francis. Broadcast on EWTN, CatholicTV, NET TV, Salt & Light, and others.

 

The Faithful Traveler in the Holy Land

Six half-hour episodes featuring the sacred sites in Israel and Bethlehem. Broadcast on EWTN.

The Faithful Traveler in the United States: East Coast Shrines

Thirteen half-hour episodes featuring some of the most historic and awe-inspiring shrines on the East Coast, in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Maryland, and New York. Broadcast on EWTN. 

 
 

ABOUT THE PRODUCERS

David and Diana von Glahn have been producing The Faithful Traveler out of their home since they were married in 2003. This endeavor has been a huge labor of love for them, and they are blessed to have been able to travel abroad to share some of the world's Catholic treasures with you. 

Diana von Glahn is the creative force behind The Faithful Traveler, as the show’s writer, host, second cameraperson, editor, and producer. As the series’ entertaining and vivacious host, Diana imbues The Faithful Traveler with an exuberance that attracts viewers of all ages and backgrounds and makes them excited to join her on her travels. She is a lifelong Catholic who uses her knowledge of her faith, her English and legal degrees, and the marketing and publicity skills she has honed in the last seventeen years as a book editor in trade and professional publishing markets in all of her roles with The Faithful Traveler. Diana received a BA in English at Pepperdine University and a JD from the University of Notre Dame Law School. She has been a book editor since 1998, and currently edits legal books for a publisher in New York City.

David von Glahn is the director and lead cameraman for The Faithful Traveler. He is a graduate of Syracuse University’s S.I. Newhouse School of Telecommunications, and he brings his expertise with film and television and his business and marketing acumen developed over the last twenty-two years in the world of publishing, education, and non-profits. As a convert to Catholicism, David brings the inquisitive perspective of a non-Catholic to the series. He heads up video development and training and e-learning productions for a large, international nonprofit society.

WHY OUR SERIES IS UNIQUE

While many travel programs visit Portugal, few focus on the Catholic sites and their historical background in such detail as in The Faithful Traveler in Portugal.

The Faithful Traveler is the only travel series on television, DVD, and online that looks at travel through the lens of faith. Also unique to The Faithful Traveler is its host. Diana’s infectious enthusiasm and love for her faith has imbued The Faithful Traveler with a lively and energetic feel that is missing elsewhere. The Faithful Traveler appeals to Catholics and non-Catholics alike in that it engages on a non-religious level, while simultaneously addressing Catholic tradition and teachings. 

No other series contains these elements—high definition presentation, a faith-filled look at history, and Diana’s enthusiasm and joy.

Filming and producing a series of this magnitude and with such a small budget and team has been ambitious, but we're almost finished! With your help, we can release this series before the end of summer.

For more information or to watch clips from our previous series, visit our website, www.thefaithfultraveler.com.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

The obvious way to help us finish The Faithful Traveler in Portugal is to pitch in by buying one of our perks or donating money by clicking the pink "back it" button next to the video at the top of this page.

However, if you'd like to help and just can't spare the funds, there are still things you can do to help us, and we'd be totally grateful for your help!

Here are some ideas:

  • Please keep us in your prayers! We all know that nothing is impossible with God, right?!
  • Are you a blogger? Consider writing a blog post about this funding campaign. Send an email if you want an interview!
  • Do you have a radio show or podcast? Diana would love to talk to you about the show! Get in touch and we'll set it up!
  • Are you on Social Media? Like our page on Facebook and pass along info about our funding campaign! Be sure to link to us and we'll say thanks!
  • Send an email to your friends and tell them about our funding campaign!
  • Are you a business owner who can sponsor the series? Get in touch and we can make that happen!

Risks and challenges

The only challenge we face now is funding. The show is shot and mostly edited. We are in good shape to finish this series in the next few months. That's why we're reaching out to you! We just need financial help to finish it and pay for it. We hope you'll consider helping us in whatever way you can.

Stock Music: "Won't Let This Moment Pass Us By" by benjijackson, and "Rock That Crowd!" by everythingwerenot. All footage and photos copyright The Faithful Traveler, LLC .

ABOUT THE SERIESThe Faithful Traveler in Portugal  is a travel television series that will explore and uncover the history behind many of Portugal's most beautiful and important Catholic sacred sites, in rich detail and high definition. Starting in Lisbon and traveling up to Porto, the show's host, Diana von Glahn, will present the history behind these breathtaking sacred sites in a fun and informative way that will inspire viewers to visit Portugal on their own, or allow virtual travelers to see things they might never have seen!Some of the many sacred sites included in this series are:

Lisbon: Monastery of St Vicente de Fora, Church of Saint Anthony, Lisbon's Cathedral, Old Church of Our Lady of the Conception, Church of St Dominic, Carmelite Convent, Church of St Roch & Museum, Castle of St George, Monastery of Hieronymites, Pastéis de Belém, Tower of Bethlehem, Discoveries Monument, Monument to Christ, Tile Museum & Mother of God Convent

Santarem: Church of the Holy Miracle, where a Eucharistic Miracle occurred

Nazaré: Church of Our Lady of Nazaré, Funicular, Chapel of Saint Anthony, Memory Hermitage, Church of Mercy

Tomar: Convent of Christ, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, once a Templar Castle and the Convent of the Knights of Christ

Batalha: Monastery of Batalha, a magnificent Gothic masterpiece that was once a Dominican monastery, built at the end of the 14th century by King João I, in memory of the battle of Aljubarrota

Alcobaça: Monastery of Alcobaça, ​one of the first Cistercian monastic foundations in Portugal

Coimbra: New and Old Cathedral, Monastery of Santa Cruz, New Monastery of Saint Clare, Old Monastery of Saint Clare, Church of St John the Baptist

Braga: Shrine of Good Jesus of the Mount, Cathedral of Braga, Monastery of St Martin of Tibães, Shrine of Our Lady of Sameiro

Porto: Tree of Life Chapel, Cathedral of Porto, Church of St Francis, Church of St Clare, Carmelite Church, Church of Our Lady of Mt Carmel, Church of the Holy House of Mercy
