story:
Short Summary

Team Put Down is so happy with the success Season 1 has had and how it was received by all of you. It is because of this support that The Put Down Web Series won numerous awards such as Best Directed Web Series at The Hollywood Florida Film Festival. However, what was the budget you ask? God's grace. This caused many stressful obstacles that almost made Season 1  not be made.  Like seriously, this had no budget and it was by a wing and a prayer and all of your support it was made. It is with this in mind that we want production for Season 2 to be financially easier for the cast and crew. This is the reason we need your support and humbly ask for your donation to help us with the making of Season 2. This will be an awesome way to get help from out wonderful Put Down family! As little as $1 will help tremendously.

The Team

Shonnie Jackson

Shonnie Jackson is from Miami, Florida and studied Journalism & Broadcast Media at Florida International University where she earned her Bachelors of Science degree in Communications and became a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated. She is now in her second year of earning her Master’s of Fine Arts from the University of Southern California School of Cinematic Arts, TV/Film Production track.

 

Along with her close friend, Jonathan Joseph, Shonnie co-created her first original series, The Put Down Web Series, which she also produced and directed. The web series has been accepted into a number of festivals and has since won "Best Directed Web Series" at the Hollywood Florida Film Festival 2017 and "Best New Media" at the Houston Black Film Festival 2017.

Currently, Shonnie is residing in Los Angeles attending film school and interning at MACRO, the media company that produced "Fences", the Academy Award Nominated Denzel Washington film, along with "Mudbound" which premiered at Sundance Film Festival 2017 and was picked up by Netflix. This summer, Shonnie plans to return to her hometown of Miami, FL to direct and produce the highly anticipated season two of The Put Down Web Series.

Jonathan "Young D" Joseph

Jonathan grew up in Little Haiti, a Haitian community within Miami, FL. With his father being an international musician, Jonathan's passion for music came at an early age. He is a singer, song writer, rapper, and all around entertainer. He was a lead drummer in his high school band and volunteers his time at his alma mater to train the current band students in their craft. Jonathan is the co-creator of "The Put Down Web Series" as well as the Music Supervisor. He wrote all of the original music for the series and performed them as well. Currently, Jonathan is residing in Miami, FL pursuing his musical career.

Marquez "Nephew" Burnside

Growing up in Overtown, Miami's urban community, Neph faced a lot of adversity. He was only 10-years-old when he realized he had a talent for writing poems to describe and escape his harsh reality. Eventually with the support of his older brother he started making music. Although, realizing his talent for music Neph also took an interest in acting. He stared in his first role as De’Andre in a hit web series "The Put Down". Not wanting to be labeled only as a “rapper” he’s striving to be an all-around entertainer. Continuously working on his music and perfecting his craft as an actor, Neph hopes to one day make it to the big screen to keep a promise to his brother whom he lost.

Shanea Longley

Shanea Longley is a high-spirited triple threat with a zeal for life, currently pursuing a career in acting and modeling. Shanea is also the personality and writer behind The Natural-Minded Soul.com & contributing writer for The Fly Society.

 

 

 

Malcolm Jones 

Malcolm Jones is currently pursuing his Masters of Architecture. He is also a proud member of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc.; through his org he is able to achieving his passion of helping others and serving his community.

 

 

Ned Chandler

Ned Chandler is a photographer and cinematographer from Miami, Florida; well versed in the realm of digital media and film. Owner of N3dstuidos, which is a company that deals in photography, film and graphic design, and a Graduate of Florida international university with a BFA in fine Arts and over 9 years of visual arts, video and graphic arts experience.

 

Ty Sterlin

Ty grew up in Los Angeles, California. At an early age Ty was exposed to gang violence and his mother moved him to Carol City, Florida when the gang violence started to get too close to home. Ty is not new to the entertainment business. He has done different comedy events and has been in commercials and movies. Ty now is a full time aspiring actor/comedian looking to break into show business. Ty also loves making people laugh and writes and shoots comedy skits in his free time. Ty hopes one day to make his late Grandmother and Godfather proud by landing a lead role in movie. Ty stars as Shwayzee in "The Put Down Web Series".

Sherrieka Othello

Sherrieka decided she wanted to pursue a career on stage from an early age. With the last name “Othello”, she always knew the arts was her calling. Starting her career in dance, she trained in Theatre and Performing Arts, performed in numerous shows around the world, community events for Mayors and Senates, background danced for bands and artist in the industry. To later, land her first lead and acting role in the short film “Tanbou”.  From that moment on, Sherrieka eloped with this unwavering passion for acting and her resume grew. Winning 2nd place best film in The Miami/Ft Lauderdale 48 Hour Film Project for a silent film. Achieving a role in The Wrong Relationship Project stage play, “Tanbou” accepted into the Black Film Festival Community and “The Put Down” being her first web series. Sherrieka could not be more excited for what is to come for her acting career and this project. In addition to performing roles, Sherrieka is a Dance teacher and uses her BA in Communication to be a Public Speaking Coach.

In the words of Sherrieka: "Forget not to be patient with your journey. Forget not the difference between Faith and believing. Forget not that your message to the world is what you leave behind." Sherrieka is excited to be a part of “The Put Down” cast as Faith and cannot wait for Season 2!  

Dedreann Louis-Jeune

Dedreann Louis-Jeune was born and raised in Miami FL. Her  birthdate is September 19, 1992, and she is the oldest of my three siblings. Dedreann's biggest motivation in life is her three year old son Zion Hanks who is her pride and joy. She recently graduated from Florida International University with her bachelors in Psychology and she plans on pursuing her masters degree in Industrial  Organization Psychology within the next two years. Dedreann is a very outgoing person, and some may say she is the life of the party. She loves being surrounded by her loved ones. In her spare time she likes to practice skits in the mirror to see her progression and perfect her craft at becoming a phenomenal actress. Dedreann stars as Tara in "The Put Down Web Series".

Ron Edwards

Ron Edwards is 1st generation Jamaican American born and raised in south Florida to a family of Jamaican descent. He played sports all his life, mainly basketball, and once had a dream to become an NBA player but that dwindled quickly due to not performing well in school. That's when Ron started to pick up acting. He has done theatre since middle school but at this point in time he started to really take it seriously after seeing movies with Will Smith and Johnny Depp, his favorite actors. Now Ron's new dream is to be acknowledged as one of the best actors our generation has seen, the same way he looks up to those guys. Ron ultimately would just like to entertain and put smiles on people's faces, hear that they really enjoyed his performance and tell him that they can't wait to see more from him, in which he would like to reply, “Trust me, you will.” Ron stars as Rich in "The Put Down Web Series".

Le'Chicas Parrish

Le'Chicas Parrish, born December 1st, is an African American actress born  in Miami, Florida.  She made her acting debut at the tender age of sixteen as Sasha in stage play "Changed For Good". Soon after she went on to study Theatre at Miami Dade College. Her first collegiate performance was as the role of Mrs. Muller in "Doubt: A Parable". Since then  Le'Chicas has been in over twenty film and theater projects. She currently trains at the Actors Workshop of South Florida. She is honored to have the opportunity to work with Blue Milk Entertainment on "The Put Down Web Series" portraying the character of Tracy.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of this campaign is to reach $10,000 to help towards production costs. We would appreciate all of your support Put Down family towards this goal. As stated before, any contribution helps and to show how grateful we are for your support we have formulated perks and rewards to show how thankful we are for your contribution. The perks, which are listed below include: 

  • $20: Exclusive Access to Episode 1 of Season 2
  • $30: Exclusive Access to Episode 1 and 2 of Season 2
  • $40: Exclusive Access to Episode 1,2, and 3 of Season 2
  • $50: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series
  • $100: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, and The Put Down Web Series official t- shirt
  • $250: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and special thanks credit throughout the series
  • $500: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and Associate Producer credit throughout the series
  • $1000: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and Producer credit throughout the series
  • $5000: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and Executive Producer credit throughout the series

The Impact

With the help of your support Put Down family we can deliver you the most biggest, baddest, wildly entertaining season yet. This gives us the opportunity to enhance every aspect of production from pre-production, production, and post production to give you guys the best quality experience possible.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we may face during production is scheduling. Everybody involved with The Put Down has been very passionate and committed to making the best show possible. However, because of other conflicting schedules it can be challenging to get every one to be scheduled in the same place for long periods of time. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily Put Down family you can still help us out in other ways. Feel free to share this link to your friends and love ones as anything to get the word out would be of great support as well to Team Put Down. Thank you all for supporting us and we look forward to showing  you guys Season 2 in the fall!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Team Put Down is so happy with the success Season 1 has had and how it was received by all of you. It is because of this support that The Put Down Web Series won numerous awards such as Best Directed Web Series at The Hollywood Florida Film Festival. However, what was the budget you ask? God's grace. This caused many stressful obstacles that almost made Season 1  not be made.  Like seriously, this had no budget and it was by a wing and a prayer and all of your support it was made. It is with this in mind that we want production for Season 2 to be financially easier for the cast and crew. This is the reason we need your support and humbly ask for your donation to help us with the making of Season 2. This will be an awesome way to get help from out wonderful Put Down family! As little as $1 will help tremendously.
The Team
Shonnie Jackson
Shonnie Jackson is from Miami, Florida and studied Journalism & Broadcast Media at Florida International University where she earned her Bachelors of Science degree in Communications and became a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated. She is now in her second year of earning her Master’s of Fine Arts from the University of Southern California School of Cinematic Arts, TV/Film Production track.
 
Along with her close friend, Jonathan Joseph, Shonnie co-created her first original series, The Put Down Web Series, which she also produced and directed. The web series has been accepted into a number of festivals and has since won "Best Directed Web Series" at the Hollywood Florida Film Festival 2017 and "Best New Media" at the Houston Black Film Festival 2017.
Currently, Shonnie is residing in Los Angeles attending film school and interning at MACRO, the media company that produced "Fences", the Academy Award Nominated Denzel Washington film, along with "Mudbound" which premiered at Sundance Film Festival 2017 and was picked up by Netflix. This summer, Shonnie plans to return to her hometown of Miami, FL to direct and produce the highly anticipated season two of The Put Down Web Series.
Jonathan "Young D" Joseph
Jonathan grew up in Little Haiti, a Haitian community within Miami, FL. With his father being an international musician, Jonathan's passion for music came at an early age. He is a singer, song writer, rapper, and all around entertainer. He was a lead drummer in his high school band and volunteers his time at his alma mater to train the current band students in their craft. Jonathan is the co-creator of "The Put Down Web Series" as well as the Music Supervisor. He wrote all of the original music for the series and performed them as well. Currently, Jonathan is residing in Miami, FL pursuing his musical career.
Marquez "Nephew" Burnside
Growing up in Overtown, Miami's urban community, Neph faced a lot of adversity. He was only 10-years-old when he realized he had a talent for writing poems to describe and escape his harsh reality. Eventually with the support of his older brother he started making music. Although, realizing his talent for music Neph also took an interest in acting. He stared in his first role as De’Andre in a hit web series "The Put Down". Not wanting to be labeled only as a “rapper” he’s striving to be an all-around entertainer. Continuously working on his music and perfecting his craft as an actor, Neph hopes to one day make it to the big screen to keep a promise to his brother whom he lost.
Shanea Longley

Shanea Longley is a high-spirited triple threat with a zeal for life, currently pursuing a career in acting and modeling. Shanea is also the personality and writer behind The Natural-Minded Soul.com & contributing writer for The Fly Society.
 
 
 
Malcolm Jones 

Malcolm Jones is currently pursuing his Masters of Architecture. He is also a proud member of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity, Inc.; through his org he is able to achieving his passion of helping others and serving his community.
 
 
Ned Chandler

Ned Chandler is a photographer and cinematographer from Miami, Florida; well versed in the realm of digital media and film. Owner of N3dstuidos, which is a company that deals in photography, film and graphic design, and a Graduate of Florida international university with a BFA in fine Arts and over 9 years of visual arts, video and graphic arts experience.
 
Ty Sterlin
Ty grew up in Los Angeles, California. At an early age Ty was exposed to gang violence and his mother moved him to Carol City, Florida when the gang violence started to get too close to home. Ty is not new to the entertainment business. He has done different comedy events and has been in commercials and movies. Ty now is a full time aspiring actor/comedian looking to break into show business. Ty also loves making people laugh and writes and shoots comedy skits in his free time. Ty hopes one day to make his late Grandmother and Godfather proud by landing a lead role in movie. Ty stars as Shwayzee in "The Put Down Web Series".
Sherrieka Othello
Sherrieka decided she wanted to pursue a career on stage from an early age. With the last name “Othello”, she always knew the arts was her calling. Starting her career in dance, she trained in Theatre and Performing Arts, performed in numerous shows around the world, community events for Mayors and Senates, background danced for bands and artist in the industry. To later, land her first lead and acting role in the short film “Tanbou”.  From that moment on, Sherrieka eloped with this unwavering passion for acting and her resume grew. Winning 2nd place best film in The Miami/Ft Lauderdale 48 Hour Film Project for a silent film. Achieving a role in The Wrong Relationship Project stage play, “Tanbou” accepted into the Black Film Festival Community and “The Put Down” being her first web series. Sherrieka could not be more excited for what is to come for her acting career and this project. In addition to performing roles, Sherrieka is a Dance teacher and uses her BA in Communication to be a Public Speaking Coach.
In the words of Sherrieka: "Forget not to be patient with your journey. Forget not the difference between Faith and believing. Forget not that your message to the world is what you leave behind." Sherrieka is excited to be a part of “The Put Down” cast as Faith and cannot wait for Season 2!  
Dedreann Louis-Jeune
Dedreann Louis-Jeune was born and raised in Miami FL. Her  birthdate is September 19, 1992, and she is the oldest of my three siblings. Dedreann's biggest motivation in life is her three year old son Zion Hanks who is her pride and joy. She recently graduated from Florida International University with her bachelors in Psychology and she plans on pursuing her masters degree in Industrial  Organization Psychology within the next two years. Dedreann is a very outgoing person, and some may say she is the life of the party. She loves being surrounded by her loved ones. In her spare time she likes to practice skits in the mirror to see her progression and perfect her craft at becoming a phenomenal actress. Dedreann stars as Tara in "The Put Down Web Series".
Ron Edwards
Ron Edwards is 1st generation Jamaican American born and raised in south Florida to a family of Jamaican descent. He played sports all his life, mainly basketball, and once had a dream to become an NBA player but that dwindled quickly due to not performing well in school. That's when Ron started to pick up acting. He has done theatre since middle school but at this point in time he started to really take it seriously after seeing movies with Will Smith and Johnny Depp, his favorite actors. Now Ron's new dream is to be acknowledged as one of the best actors our generation has seen, the same way he looks up to those guys. Ron ultimately would just like to entertain and put smiles on people's faces, hear that they really enjoyed his performance and tell him that they can't wait to see more from him, in which he would like to reply, “Trust me, you will.” Ron stars as Rich in "The Put Down Web Series".
Le'Chicas Parrish
Le'Chicas Parrish, born December 1st, is an African American actress born  in Miami, Florida.  She made her acting debut at the tender age of sixteen as Sasha in stage play "Changed For Good". Soon after she went on to study Theatre at Miami Dade College. Her first collegiate performance was as the role of Mrs. Muller in "Doubt: A Parable". Since then  Le'Chicas has been in over twenty film and theater projects. She currently trains at the Actors Workshop of South Florida. She is honored to have the opportunity to work with Blue Milk Entertainment on "The Put Down Web Series" portraying the character of Tracy.
 
 

What We Need & What You Get
The goal of this campaign is to reach $10,000 to help towards production costs. We would appreciate all of your support Put Down family towards this goal. As stated before, any contribution helps and to show how grateful we are for your support we have formulated perks and rewards to show how thankful we are for your contribution. The perks, which are listed below include: 

$20: Exclusive Access to Episode 1 of Season 2
$30: Exclusive Access to Episode 1 and 2 of Season 2
$40: Exclusive Access to Episode 1,2, and 3 of Season 2
$50: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series
$100: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, and The Put Down Web Series official t- shirt
$250: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and special thanks credit throughout the series
$500: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and Associate Producer credit throughout the series
$1000: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and Producer credit throughout the series
$5000: Exclusive Access to first 3 episodes of Season 2, autographed poster of entire cast and creators of The Put Down Web Series, The Put Down Web Series official t-shirt, and Executive Producer credit throughout the series


The Impact
With the help of your support Put Down family we can deliver you the most biggest, baddest, wildly entertaining season yet. This gives us the opportunity to enhance every aspect of production from pre-production, production, and post production to give you guys the best quality experience possible.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge we may face during production is scheduling. Everybody involved with The Put Down has been very passionate and committed to making the best show possible. However, because of other conflicting schedules it can be challenging to get every one to be scheduled in the same place for long periods of time. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute monetarily Put Down family you can still help us out in other ways. Feel free to share this link to your friends and love ones as anything to get the word out would be of great support as well to Team Put Down. Thank you all for supporting us and we look forward to showing  you guys Season 2 in the fall!

story:
What will the full series be?

Out of It will have seven episodes!

AND mini episodes (called BUMPs) which show the fallout from another character’s point of view.

Episode 1 – The 28 Club

Available Now. Lucy has turned 28, she’s hungover. When her housemate organises a dinner party there’s only one way to deal with it. Get horrifically drunk.

Episode 2 – Mature Students

Two bottles of wine and a gram of coke down - Lucy, Frankie and Sarah decide to go to their old Student Bar. Those 18 year olds won’t know what hit them.

Episode 2.2 – BUMP – What Chloe Did

Chloe is a good person, she tries to be vegan, she does yoga bi-weekly. Why does life shit on her?

Episode 3 – Uber Rating

Frankie and Sarah try to get home, but somehow pick up coke quicker than an Uber.

Episode 4 – Lager Cunt Tom

It’s 2:00am, you’ve got kebab down your top, it’s definitely time to hook up with your ex.

Episode 4.2 – BUMP – An Open Circle

Charlotte is a dedicated Christian, she’d never sleep with someone before marriage. But how does Jesus feel about fingering?

Episode 5 – Feeling Fresh

Sarah’s back at student halls. Tristan’s 18, looks like a Topman model - it’s only a matter of time before she blows it.

Episode 6 – Class Act

Weekday-Frankie is a recently promoted, hard-working professional. Weekend-Frankie is a snorting mess. Her work party wasn’t ready for Weekend-Frankie. 

Episode 6.2 – BUMP – Check Up

Frankie doesn’t see how an STI should affect her night out.

Episode 7 – Cum Down

The morning after. There’s nowhere to hide from what you did last night. *Warning* Contains moderate amounts of; semen, Haagen-Dazs and dildos.

Episode 7.2 – Booty Call

Imagine the most graphic message you’ve ever sent. Well Lucy texted the wrong person.

But… What do I get?

We want to give back to the people that have helped us. On top of the series and bonus episodes, we have special treats for those who have gone the extra mile. Check out our perks to find out more. 

Where Does the Dollar Go?

The first episode of Out of It was totally self funded and is available for free. For the rest of the series we will need:

In Total:

£ 9,119

We want the full series to be free and want to pay all the people that make the show possible. Everyone that works on the show gives their all to make it the quality it is, in return we want to support them as best we can. 

As this is a series funded by you for you, we want you to know exactly where your money is going:

Cast

£ 3,850

Production

£3,725

This includes; Director, Director of Photography, Cameraman, 1st AD, Sound and Lighting.

Post-Production

£1,000

This includes: Editing, Sound Design and Grading.

Costume, Props and Set

£544

We make an effort to source all our costumes and props to keep costs down but this allows us to have a much bigger scope.

*Please note all "narcotics" will bought separately from the money you donate*

 

Where will the money go if you don’t reach the target?

This target will mean we can get all the episodes out, but whatever amount we reach we will create the series with as many episodes as we can with the quality you good people deserve.

I’m skint, can I do anything else?

If you are not in a position to help us financially but still want to support us, you still can. Please share Episode One (which can be found here) with your friends.

You can also show support by following us on:

Facebook

Twitter

Instagram

It all helps. So thank you and to hear more about the project, send an email to outofit.prod@gmail.com with ‘SUBSCRIBER’ in the header, and we will keep you up to date and share exclusive goodies with you.

THANK YOU!

story:
STUFF TEASER REEL & GOAL

We are producing a teaser reel as a marketing tool — sort of like a 3-minute commercial/trailer to help sell the pilot and series to potential industry buyers. We have interest from several producers and production companies, and need to give them an idea what the show is about so they can sell it!

Just think — you can be a part in getting the next new comedy TV series on the air!

STUFF WE NEED TO PRODUCE THE REEL

It is amazing how a 3-minute teaser reel to promote a pilot would need expenses to get produced, but it does. Even with the kindness and dedication of many talented people donating their time, there is still a lot of 'stuff' needed to make a professional teaser reel pitch video come to life:

*Equipment  *Location Rentals  *Costumes  *Sound  *Make-up  *Unforeseen Costs * Food

The director, cast and crew are donating their time to make this project happen.

Other STUFF You Can Do To Help

No worries if you just don't have the extra funds to donate right now, but you can still help by:

  • Sharing STUFF with your friends online
  • Sharing STUFF with your friends in person
  • Sharing STUFF with your friends over a beer (recommended)

STUFF ABOUT THE TEAM

Marie Del Marco (Creator, Writer, Producer and playing MARTHA) - has been an actor and writer most of her life. She received her Master of Fine Arts degree from the University of Missouri-Kansas City and had the opportunity to perform with the professional Actors' Equity company, the Kansas City Repertory Theatre. Marie has performed in 100+ staged productions over the years and has appeared in numerous feature films, commercials and television shows; most recently, a recurring role on "Fresh Off the Boat" and "Blunt Talk" starring Patrick Stewart. During her time in Dallas, Texas, she was very active in the film community and served on the Board of Directors of Women in Film/Dallas for six-years, and the Board of Directors for the Dallas Screenwriters Association for three-years. Her short film, "The Accident" was accepted and screened in four  different film festivals. Marie moved to Los Angeles over twelve years ago to take her career to the next level and in 2014 she received the Outstanding Lead Actress in a Comedy at the LAWEBFEST Awards for her series regular role, Belinda Dunn in "Life with Kat and McKay", the brain-child of Sandra Payne. She is represented by The Polygon Group (Agent) and Hummel Entertainment (Manager). MEMBER: SAG-AFTRA, AEA, and Television Academy (Emmys)

Sandra Payne (Director), is an award-winning Writer/Director/Producer and president of the boutique production company, SPwrite Productions, LLC, specializing in digital content and reality show sizzle reels. Her company has produced more than 100 episodes of web series, including all 51 episodes of “The Web.Files,” the 2012 winner of Best Hosted (Taped) Web Series at the International Academy of Web Television Awards. Sandra was also nominated as Best Director that year. She has made numerous award-winning short projects, including three trailer winners for the Austin Film Festival, and several award-winning short films. Her latest short film, “Death Inc.,” premiered at the 2012 Sonoma International Film Festival and went on to win a Gold Remi from WorldFest Houston, a Starfish Award for Best Comedy from Moondance and a Best Director win from the Hollywood & Vine Film Festival.

After earning a master’s degree in English from the University of North Texas where she specialized in screenwriting, Sandra started her Hollywood career as a staff writer for the global juggernaut, “Barney & Friends.” She’s written two books, has optioned screenplays, has written celebrity cover feature magazine articles and a humor etiquette column, and has published short stories in “Chicken Soup for the Soul” and “Guideposts.”

Marilyn Ghigliotti (playing ANNE) - Coming from a Puerto Rican family background born in New York and raised in New Jersey, of course there’s a lot of spunk and attitude. This Jersey New Yorican had to learn to survive many moves and many changes in surrounding cultures. Marilyn’s petiteness and shyness helped in making her aware of others who were treated badly due to differences even if that difference was just popularity. Seeing and hearing of many injustices growing up Marilyn wished there were a way to help, which ﬁts in with her niche “Clashing of Ideologies, Cultures and Belief Systems” where the characters she has portrayed, ﬁghts for the rights of others in many ways. Even if it’s the character she portrays like the one many have grown to love as Veronica in one of the most popular ﬁlms of 1994 the cult classic Clerks. Marilyn continues to be drawn to those kinds of character which is evident in the latest independent ﬁlms such as Starship Rising and most recently Rogue Warrior: Robot Fighter playing a Warlord and saving the planet from invasion Marilyn has played many strong characters with heart and weaknesses in productions before moving to LA in 1998 such as Crimes of the Heart, Same Time Next Year, Wait Until Dark and many more. Since moving to LA, Marilyn produced along with fellow acting students, a theater production titled Bedroom Stories, a series of one act plays with great reviews. Other acting that show diversity in her acting, credits include, short ﬁlms, Bad Hair day, Negotiations which won ofﬁcial selection DGA ﬁrst cut, Roadkill, winning BestFest America 1st place horror/thriller 2007, Dig, Best Director nomination and Marilyn receiving Best Supporting Actress Nomination and Neighbors. Feature ﬁlms, Dead and Gone, Alien Armageddon, Geek USA and Lake Eerie. Because being creative is all she knows, Marilyn doesn’t just act, she also has impressed audiences with her hair and makeup skills behind the camera on many a production as well as lending in still photography on set and shooting actors headshots. Marilyn was set to reprise her role loved by so many of the fans as Veronica in Clerks III written and directed by Kevin Smith but is heartbroken the ﬁlm has since been canceled. But not to worry as she will start production on Murder Hill in July 2017 starring along side Tom Proctor, Basil Hoffman and James Russo. After much work Marilyn can ﬁnally add TV credits to her resume with a pilot shot in Albuquerque, NM this past spring tilted End of the Santa Fe Trail.    Marilyn will also be adding Director to her resume with a dramatic piece soon on a project that is very dear to her heart in which she got to do a reading and was well received by the audience.

Perry Payne (Director of Photography & Editor), is co-owner of the boutique production company, SPwrite Productions, LLC, which specializes in creating entertaining digital content. Perry has credits working as a cinematographer/editor on shows for HBO Canada, broadcast TV commercials, music videos, reality show-sizzle reels, trailers, corporate videos, seminars and personal interviews. He was the Director of Photography/Editor for the 2012 International Academy of Web Television Award-winning show, “The Web.Files.” Perry has a Masters degree in Radio, TV & Film from the University of North Texas and a Bachelors degree in Communications from the University of Washington.

Perry has credits working as a cinematographer/editor on shows for HBO Canada, broadcast TV commercials, music videos, reality show-sizzle reels, trailers, corporate videos, seminars and personal interviews. He was the Director of Photography/Editor for the 2012 International Academy of Web Television Award-winning show, “The Web.Files.” Perry has a Masters degree in Radio, TV & Film from the University of North Texas and a Bachelors degree in Communications from the University of Washington.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Faustus and I love good stories.  I have worked for years as a professional stage actor,  I have written a musical that won an OEA award, and I have seen a billion of movies and read almost as many books.  Basically, I love story telling.  I am passionate about it and have assembled a crew and cast that share that passion.

This campaign is to fund the second season  of a web series entitled Stuck.  Stuck was originally a feature film called Stuck on Neal.  It was accepted into film festivals spanning both of US coasts.  We had to cut a lot out of the final film to make it to a more admissible run time for the film festivals.  I decided to turn that film into a web series bringing back all the extra goodies that were unfairly left on the cutting room floor.  Now we are wanting to continue that story in Season 2 and wow, there are tons of twist and turns in this season.  This story is important to me because it deals with themes that are important today including Divorce, Racial struggles, Gender equality, LGBT, Grief, struggles of children growing up in a harsh world and many more.  The show can make you laugh and then make you cry.  The characters are diverse that people shouldn't find it hard to connect with one or more of them.  We would love to give you this expansion of the world created in the first season.

We value and know how important it is for us to receive your support.  We have a cast and crew of over 70 people ready to work hard to make this show come alive for you.  With your support, you help a family of artists that produce an original story for all to enjoy.  Most of us have to balance working on this project with our daily jobs to make it happen, sacrificing our personal time because we believe in this story and characters.

The great thing is you can see the first season of Stuck and see our potential.  We want to grow and expand this story and it simply can not be done without you!

 

What We Need & What You Get

So, the break down of our most basic costs comes down to $1000 per episode.

This includes:

  • Equipment rentals
  • Location fees
  • Minimal food for cast and crew during  long shoots
  • Software for Post
  • Minimal advertising
  • Travel to different locations in Nebraska

We have 13 amazing epic heart rendering episodes to shoot and put together so we are asking for $13,000 to get it done on the bare minimum scale.

We are offering so many fantastic interactive perks including

  • Be a star!  Have a background acting role in the show and make your friends jealous!
  • Dinner with the cast!
  • See a special screening of the show before it is released!
  • See how passionate we are first hand with a special visit to the set!
  • Have your business sponsor an episode and we will put several blasts out in favor of the business and see the business' name in the credits!
  • Exclusive Blooper reels from the first season!

If we don't reach the full goal we won't make it past production and that's with no one receiving any compensation.  

 

Risks & Challenges

We understand that there is always a risk with projects like these.  Every project is different and has different demands, but we are confident that we can overcome these obstacles as we have a great track record.  We funded a previous film project Endor with 30% over what we asked for.  The Film the show is based on was completed and accepted into film festivals.  We have had sold out screenings of our films.  We know how to make a good story, we have the skill and the passion, we just need the finances to make it come together!

Even if you just can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise for our campaign.  Spreading the campaign around might mean it reaches someone who really connects with what we are doing.

Help our characters get unstuck by supporting Stuck Season 2!

story:
VENUS FLYTRAP! – the FIRST digital scripted series about women in rock. Venus Flytrap is a band of young women intent on grabbing rock and roll by the balls in the land of Trumpistan. It’s “Fearless Girl” staring down “Charging Bull” on Wall Street with guitars. It’s PUSSY GRABS BACK in a queer-centric provocative show whose time has come. The punk feminist VENUS FLYTRAP (VFT) and their various cohorts will disrupt the entertainment status quo with their own unique brand of comedy, anarchy, music and mayhem. We’re totally going for it, lady-balls OUT and ON FIRE!

Have you watched VINYL, FLIGHT OF THE CONCHORDS, THE GET DOWN, ROADIES or THE MIGHTY BOOSH? What is missing in these shows? Why are the women always groupies, roadies, singing girl-group femmes or facilitators to the guys? The missing female musical rebellion that has always been here will rise again through our catalysts – punk rockers TINK(erbelle), JOEY, TASHA and DEE.

We’ll watch VFT navigate a world of dysfunctional families, sexualities, rival bands (THE MOLESTED and THE PORNIMALS) and eccentric managers trying to push them into absurd concepts and styles in an attempt to snag the tarnished golden ring of rock glory. Guest appearances by artists/bands (contemporary and from punk and no wave’s glory days) will abound – the older generation of legendary wild women will show up as grannies, mothers and managers. The VFT series will raise all hell about politricks, take down the commercial recording industry and shame the cultural gatekeepers while fighting the tyranny of our present days.

What beats at the heart of this Kali-esque beauty-beast? Rock’s lost essence of protest and the absence of a gender-bending revolutionary 'fuck you' spirit in contemporary music. The moment is ripe for female insurgency in art again. Help Venus Flytrap become the VERY FIRST SCRIPTED SERIES ON THE MAP ABOUT A BAND OF FEMALE PUNK ROCKERS. Support us as we show the world how women have always held a crucial space within rock’s freedom cry and still do today, with a BALL-BREAKING REBEL YELL. And sign on for our updates. We'll be rolling out scorching little videos to push you over the brink and into a pledge!

ZAMI GIRL STORIES is creator/writer/director ADELE BERTEI and producer NATALIE HILL. Adele grew up in the NO WAVE art/music scene of the late 1970s/80s and is best known for her role in Lizzie Borden’s feminist science fiction film BORN IN FLAMES as well as bands THE CONTORTIONS and the first out-lesbian rock band, THE BLOODS. She’s had hits with Thomas Dolby and Jellybean Benitez and has toured with/ written songs for many musical icons. Producer NATALIE HILL has a long-standing reputation in the commercial film industry as a DGA award-winning producer. Natalie produced a feature, Arthur Newman, starring Colin Firth and Emily Blunt. She auspiciously began her career as production manager on Jenny Livingston’s PARIS IS BURNING.

 

Your enthusiasm and support!  We’ve created a bitchin’ teaser to give you hints of what to expect. You've heard of the Von Trapp family? Pledge with us and join the Von Flytrapp family as we give birth to a content revolution.

Our first Tier is $50,000.00 which will get you 5 episodes of VFT, but your pledged support above and beyond will insure that we're able to include all the phenomenal talent who want to be part of this. We have a boatload of scripts and songs, and we'd love to feature at least one song in each episode alá Flight of the Conchords, but we need big $$$$ to manifest our vision. Imagine Baz Luhrman meets Broad City on a tight budget and join with us in this crucial stage of development. The more you pledge, the hotter and more star-studded  the series!

story:
Hi! My name is Destiny Muse and I am the creator of Processed Self-Love!

The Truth

Processed- Self Love started as a production that was meant to help the audience go deeper into their reality and discover their individual self growth necessary for them to be the best version of themselves. I began the writing process and my motives changed. I started to experience growing pains and a realization of the parts of me that still needed addressing. The entire direction changed and I got selfish. I was hungry for more because I started seeing myself differently as the writing developed. I began to see myself wholly, stitched together and unafraid.  So I got honest and decided the best way to help anyone is through my story. 

I realized that the only thing I really had to offer anyone was my truth. Once I realized how important it was for me share my experience the selfishness subsided and the burden set in. I knew I owed it to  the people around me to share my story through my creativity, so I did. I sacrificed so much for this project, time, money, energy, and more because I truly believe the impact this series will have is worth it. I hope that my story can help those who watch it create their own narrative and find their own truth. I am still processing.  I am still growing. I am still discovering self love.

The Goal

1. People To Watch it!
I want people to find a deeper love for themselves and for the world around them in a unique way.

2. Traveling Show!
I am in the process of turning Processed Self-Love the web-series into a traveling show.  The night would consist of viewing each episode  accompanied with artistic performances that expresses the same narrative but in a different dialog all while an intimate discussion is going on that is self reflective and challenges the audience to create their own dialog.

3. Creative Self-Love Workshop
I am in the process of developing a creative workshop . The workshop will teach individuals how to explore the dialog in their own unique way. It will also help individuals already experimenting with the arts take things to a deeper level.

4. Publish The Book
I am in the process of writing a book that follows along with the web-series and takes it even deeper! I explore each topic at a deeper level than the 4-7 minute episodes allow me to. The book is intended to get people thinking about their our narrative and the things they do or do not wish to change.

More Truth

In order to make each goal happen it requires finances. I have invested every penny I possibly could into this project because I believe in it. I exhausted all of my personal resources before making the decision to reach out for support.  I am committed to reaching each goal and will continue to sacrifice in the areas I can to make it happen but I can not do it alone. Production cost was $2000 and that was without paying the people who made it all possible what they truly deserve. My goal is to raise $7,000 in order to help me continue to pour all of my energy into what I know I am called to do. I am going to do whatever it takes to birth this vision and I would love for you to join me on this process! 

The Break Down 

  • Web-Series Production                       $2000
  • Promotion/Advertising                       $300- 500 per month
  • Upfront Event Cost                               $500- 1000 per show
  • Talent Compensation (5-6 Artist)   $75-150 per artist 
  • Upfront Product Expenses                $500
  • Publishing Expenses                            $350- 550

 

Other Ways You Can Help

While fiances are a major part of building a vision from the ground up it is not the only way you can support!

SHARE

I can not spread the word alone, I need your help! It is as simple as telling a friend about what you've come across and spreading the word on your social media. Email info@destinythemuse.com and I will send you everything you need to make spreading the word easy!

JOIN THE NARRATIVE

I am always looking for more people to collaborate with and exchange ideas. We are better together! Got any cool projects coming up you think I could help you with? Let me know! Does the vision resonates with you and you want to get more involved? Let me know! The narrative has got to be bigger than my own and I want YOU to join me.

story:
My name is Zachary Gallmann. I have been in the strength community, as a competitor, coach, and representative for almost a decade. About a year and a half ago, I started a project called "Finding Strength", where I visit training facilities all across the country and try to connect people with the athletes and coaches that are building not only the best possible versions of themselves, but a community that welcomes anyone trying to find strength.

In this new venture, which I have titled, "Meathead" I will be raising funds to film a pilot episode for my concept, in which I train with various strength crews, from all aspects of the strength world, and then share food with them at their favorite restaurant. While at the restaurant, I will also highlight the people making the food that these athletes have come to know and love.

Strength sports are rapidly growing in the United States, but they are still a niche because there hasn't been a way to fill the gap between everyday people, and those that like to push themselves to the limits in strength. I believe that the common denominator between all people is food, and a television show that would link the two would generate not only new athletes, but also fans that can see what it's like on the inside of the sports that us competitors love so much. Your donation will help humanize all of us and reach a larger audience across the country, as well as give quality restaurants the recognition they deserve, and have obviously earned by their loyal customers.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding something like this isn't easy. Between travel costs, production, and man hours, it costs a lot of money to develop such a project. I am seeking $10,000 or more in donations so I can help create a series that can employ people with an interest in growing the strength world.

All donations will go toward equipment, paying production staff, compensating restaurants, and getting in to talk to the right people to make this all come to fruition.

Any and all contributions are greatly appreciated and welcomed. Here will be a few perks that come along with larger donations.

People donating $30 or more will receive a Meathead t-shirt

Donations over $500 will receive a producer credit on the pilot

Investments over $1000 will receive a full time producer credit if the series gets picked up.

If I can not reach my goal of $10,000, the money I have collected will still be put toward making this happen. We can bootstrap if necessary, but I would like to be able to create a product that I think people can get behind. I want quality to represent the people I film.

I truly believe we are on the precipice of making the strength sports and their athletes household names. I believe that with the current culinary trend, food will be the catalyst that makes that happen. If people can see the best strength athletes in the world relaxing and enjoying food with their crews, we can help show the human side of these athletes.

Thank you for your time and I look forward to seeing everyone out on the road!

story:
Real Independent Journalism

We live in a world of corporations, and organisations, controlling the news we receive, to ensure it's the news they want us to receive. Their versions of events...

This is about breaking through that, penetrating the information blockade, bringing the truth. 

The Impact

Of course, it's unlikely this reportage will be on mainstream media, but it will be up there, high on internet searches, so anyone who wants the truth can easily find it!

And for you?

I hugely value your input. This is only possible because of you. There are newsletters, updates, ongoing interaction - much more! We are together all the way!

story:
The Pilot

In the pilot, we follow introverted Dee as she celebrates her birthday with her younger sister, gregarious Cristina. She is confronted with her anxiety when Cristina invites a hundred people to their party. The pilot will introduce her struggle with speaking up for herself, her sexuality and a past relationship. 

Throughout the episode we will also give an insight into the individual journeys of Trix and Kat, foreshadowing themes we will be seeing in their episodes: Trix juggling her difficult family life with her social circle; Kat coming to terms with their gender and growing out of old habits.

Our Female Driven Creative Team

Four countries, four languages, four kick-ass ladies!

Nicky Chue

Director & Writer

Nicky Chue is a queer filmmaker born and raised in Berlin. An avid reader from a young age, her writing is often influenced by mythology or folklore, which also fuelled her interest in language and storytelling. Creating her own short films and relentlessly working on side-projects during secondary education inspired her to move to London in 2014 to persue a Bachelor's Degree in Film & Television. Passionate about editing since adolescence, she is especially interested in narrative and structure, which she has also explored through acting in high school drama productions. In her free time, she creates elaborate mixtapes and runs a bee blog.

Julia Almeida Coelho

Producer

Born and raised in Brazil, Julia studied acting & directing at the Latin American Film Institute in São Paulo for two years, where she produced her graduation play in which she also acted. From there the studied at the Institute's film school, honing her production skills. During this period she worked as production assistant for two independent feature films, one which won the Student Feature of the Year in the California Film Awards. Looking for new challenges, Julia moved to London in 2014 to gain her BA in Film & Television from the London College of Communication. When not sending emails, Julia enjoys listening to show tunes and cooking pasta.

Carmen Pellon Brussosa

Director of Photography

Carmen, born and raised in Barcelona, always had a passion towards photography and film. She finished her Scientific French Baccalaureate in 2013 and decided to move to London to do a foundation diploma in London College of Communication. Choosing the film pathway she discovered the art of cinematography, and encouraged by her teacher she decided to continue her film studies in LCC. Always working in the camera and lighting department, Carmen has been focusing in cinematography since the first day, shooting university projects as well as personal projects with her friends. She has also worked in professional film sets for commercials, music videos and feature films in the camera and lighting departments. AND she also makes and amazing tortilla.

Renée Bellamy

Production Designer

An artist and filmmaker born and based in London, Renée enjoys documenting and finding beauty within her surroundings and capturing them in the medium of illustration, collage, photography and dance. Film allows her to experiment with these mediums simultaneously, and she has found production design to be an area that inspires her. She takes pleasure in using colour palette, texture, costumes and props to unearth the emotional truth and subtext, embellishing the mise-en-scène and creating a world authentic to the narrative.

Diversity In Media

Cake & Candles features a diverse cast in terms of ethnicity, sexuality, and gender. Created by a bisexual Latina and a queer woman of colour, we understand the importance of representation in the media. Since the very beginning of our filmmaking journey, we've been adamant about telling stories that are truly reflective of the world around us. This means that we are very passionate about including and involving as many voices from minority communities as possible, which will be reflected in our cast and crew.

Risks & Challenges

Every production has it challenges but we aim to overcome them all! We are shooting this pilot with a low budget but it will be filmed whether we achieve the goal or not, though it would certainly help to raise the full amount. Our core team has worked together previously, so we are confident that we will do the characters justice.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can donate money but even a simple like or follow can help us get to our goal! Here are some ways you can help:

  • Follow us on social media! We're on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, AND Tumblr;
  • Share/reblog our posts! By doing this you increase the reach of our campaign;
  • Share this campaign! You might not be able to donate but perhaps someone else is;
  • If you're part of the LGBTQ+ community and/or non-white, and would like to share your experiences with us, get in touch!
story_txt:
The Pilot
In the pilot, we follow introverted Dee as she celebrates her birthday with her younger sister, gregarious Cristina. She is confronted with her anxiety when Cristina invites a hundred people to their party. The pilot will introduce her struggle with speaking up for herself, her sexuality and a past relationship. 
Throughout the episode we will also give an insight into the individual journeys of Trix and Kat, foreshadowing themes we will be seeing in their episodes: Trix juggling her difficult family life with her social circle; Kat coming to terms with their gender and growing out of old habits.

Our Female Driven Creative Team
Four countries, four languages, four kick-ass ladies!

Nicky Chue
Director & Writer
Nicky Chue is a queer filmmaker born and raised in Berlin. An avid reader from a young age, her writing is often influenced by mythology or folklore, which also fuelled her interest in language and storytelling. Creating her own short films and relentlessly working on side-projects during secondary education inspired her to move to London in 2014 to persue a Bachelor's Degree in Film & Television. Passionate about editing since adolescence, she is especially interested in narrative and structure, which she has also explored through acting in high school drama productions. In her free time, she creates elaborate mixtapes and runs a bee blog.

Julia Almeida Coelho
Producer

Our core team has worked together previously, so we are confident that we will do the characters justice.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand not everyone can donate money but even a simple like or follow can help us get to our goal! Here are some ways you can help:

Follow us on social media! We're on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, AND Tumblr;
Share/reblog our posts! By doing this you increase the reach of our campaign;
Share this campaign! You might not be able to donate but perhaps someone else is;
If you're part of the LGBTQ+ community and/or non-white, and would like to share your experiences with us, get in touch!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Alexandra Bender. I'm the creator and writer of Katharina the Supervillain. This is a 30 minute animated action comedy about an angsty teen who wants to live an honest life by pursuing a career path as a supervillain. It deals with independence, family issues and friendship issues with all the comedy and violence you could want in a series. The fact that we had finished animation last year helped us get pitch meetings. We're still passionate about this show, so we're still working on it.

What We Need & What You Get

Despite popular belief, artists need to be paid for their labor.

  • We have an amazing storyboard artist who just started working on her part. She's getting paid $750 though she deserves way more.
  • We also have two animators who are also $750 each. Not to put a price tag on human life, but they're worth their weight in gold.
  • The total is $2250.
  • Perks include lots of fun artwork and more hilarious one-liners from me.

The Impact

Each piece of work we complete gets us closer to being picked up.

  • This past year we got much more industry attention due to having completed animation.
  • You get to see how animation comes to life.
  • You're creating more jobs than [inset controversial political figure here.]

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute. That's understandable!

  • Follow us on Facebook or Instagram. It's legalized stalking!
  • https://www.facebook.com/katharinathesupervillain
  • @katharinathesupervillain
  • You can follow me on YouTube, Twitter, or Instagram under @amazzonkane

This will be fun!

story:
Hi, I'm Mike Nicoll the Founder of Fanview TV, former ESPN creative & die hard football fan. 

Fanview TV is a creative group and entertainment website focused on capturing the world of die hard fandom. THIS SEASON...We're teaming up with Executive Producer, Jamie Facenda to create "Sunday Heroes". We'll bring you RAW and HILARIOUS entertainment from the biggest, most underrated group outside the NFL...DIE HARD FANS. Join us on our journey as we capture their tailgate traditions,the science behind them and take an in depth look on what it takes to transform from a regular Joe on Monday, to a stadium general on Sunday.

I founded Fanview TV under the belief that sports entertainment television needed a change...Social media and streaming services have disrupted the television industry to the point that even the content needed to change. Long gone are the days of talking heads, pointless shows and fake news being interesting. If I need sports entertainment before and after kickoff, I just head over to my favorite social media apps to laugh, cry and cringe at the insane moments created by die hard fans. Those folks, are the stars and they need their stories out in a huge way.

I'd like to say it's a cheap and easy task but traveling to 16 cities, in 16 weeks and meeting over 100 fan groups costs some sweat and dough. Our production costs prevent us from visiting every fan base and we'd like to document everyone out there but without the funding, "we're stuck on the bench"-had to. Sports puns aside, your contribution will help us cover travel, lodging, equipment, editing and visual effects fees that are needed to make this the best sports fan documentary of all time. 

We'd like to represent each team's fan base the correct way so each and any donation helps. If you can't donate but still want to contribute, please share our campaign and help spread the word. If we don't reach our goal, we'll still make this documentary but in a much, much smaller version. This documentary series marks the beginning of a long term exploration into hardcore fandom across sports, music and film. Join us on our journey!

Michael Nicoll has worked in the creative industry for the past 8 years across film, television, music and social media. Based out of Los Angeles, CA his past clients include ESPN, Disney, Netflix, Amazon Studios, NBC, ABC, CBS, FOX and Universal Music to name a few. His specialties include video production, motion graphics, 3D animation, design and art direction for numerous shows, movies and video content on social media.

Jamie Facenda is a documentary and television producer who has produced a variety of successful non-fiction entertainment for multiple international television distributors and networks including NBC, SyFy, NatGeo, SPIKE TV, truTV, BET, DreamWorks TV, MTV, E!, & TLC. A Die hard Redskins fan and Marina Del Rey, CA resident, Jamie enjoys long walks on the beach, sunsets, seals and Hinanos cheeseburgers.

When will I receive my perks (general)?
You'll receive an email from Michael regarding your items and dates of arrival.

What style documentary will this be? 
The Sunday Heroes Series will range from comedy, drama and informational.

Am I going to be able to buy these perk items after the campaign has ended / anywhere else?
The Fanview Tee Shirts and Hoodies are exclusive to this campaign. We will make more apparel available in the future designed for each team. Stay tuned.

Can I buy two or more perks at the same time?
Unfortunately, Indiegogo does not have a shopping cart to buy many items at the same time. This is why we have created some bundles, which is an easy way for you to get all the essential items at one go.

Where can I find information on the perks, campaign, the show etc. after the campaign? 
Make sure to bookmark our Indiegogo page as we will use it to keep posting updates about our campaign and perks. You can follow Fanview TV on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

Keep in contact by e-mailing us: contact@fanviewtv.com

When will the series be released? 
Our 16 week shoot begins September 7th and lasts until February 2018. Our post production process will be completed by April 2018.

Who will be in this documentary?
We'll be contacting fans and groups over the course of the season. Please contact us if you know someone who might be interested or have a recommendation for some great fans!

Who is running the Indiegogo campaign?
The Indiegogo campaign is run by the Fanview TV production team members.

Please contact this address if you have more questions: contact@fanviewtv.com

story:
What is Skeleton Crew?

Skeleton Crew is an internationally award-winning gay soap opera (affectionately called a melo-dra-gomedy [or melodramatic tragicomedy]) about a bear couple & their family & friends, & what happens when the fringes of sexuality become the norm.

The series has always looked to present non-mainstream issues, ideas, themes, topics, & even bodies in a mainstream manner, & Season 5 continues to do so. We seek to provide greater opportunities to plus-sized actors, & present facets of the LGBTQ rainbow rarely explored by mainstream and indie creators. Skeleton Crew currently streams on YouTube. This season, we will be tackling themes of communication, revenge, and toxic masculinity in the LGBT world.

In December 2014, the first draft of a play called Skeleton Crew was completed. From the first read thru of this piece, it was clear the potential was there for something more. Since that time, thousands of people have tuned in to watch the adventures of Anthony, Hunter, and the rest of the characters in Skeleton Crew. The series has become a platform for people and ideas on the fringes of society, and will continue to do so as long as the series exists.

Produced by SideKick Productions, whose mission is promoting size-blind casting whenever appropriate and possible, Skeleton Crew has connected with audiences in ways I never imagined. We have been fortunate enough to work with talent from all levels of the industry, including Greg Gunter, star of the Bearcity Trilogy, LGBT and Blues Hall of Fame member Rev. Yolanda, and founder of Troma Studios and father of the Toxic Avenger, Lloyd Kaufman. Beginning with Season Four, we have been fortunate to have The Voice's Nakia join us behind the scenes creating original music as well as on screen in the role of Sebastian Jupiter.

 

Season Five

Every year, we try to improve on what we have done in the past, going bigger and better than before. This is no different with Season Five. We are particularly excited to be making our very first musical episode with 13 original songs by Nakia. 

Any donations we receive will go towards making Season Five better than ever. This includes:

  • Production of 13 original songs for our first musical episode
  • Rental of The WayStation, the fabulous bar which serves as our home away from home, MoneyShot$
  • Rental of studio spaces
  • Rental of other specialized locations
  • Costumes
  • Set pieces 
  • Special FX
  • New equipment (lights, tripod, sound, etc.)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell your friends about the series. This is huge--the more people who watch Skeleton Crew on YouTube, the more potential we have for sharing our wacky, zany, melodramatic-tragicomic view of the world!
  • Share our fund-raising efforts
  • Write to us and let us know what you think about the series. The cast and crew love to hear fan reactions, and your support means the world to us!

story:
We are a group of 3rd year students at the University of Greenwich, working on our graduate project. This year we are creating a TV Pilot episode for a Sitcom, exploring the relationship between an elderly person and their carer in a care home. This campaign is important to us because we want to to give recognition to the care workers that work long unsociable hours and give their all to helping our older generations. We hope to shed a much needed new perspective as we explore the heart warming bond between our main characters, Kenny and Veronica, as we follow them ticking off goals from Veronica's bucket list. 

With the help of contributors we will be able to build a realistic set, money will go towards buying furniture and essential props which will have a huge impact on the look of our show. Additionally this will go towards paying for actors that will portray these characters stories well on screen. With any money left over, we will be donating this to local care homes for those affected by the issues explored within our television show.  

 

 

This story follows the real connection and relationship between Veronica and Kenny, giving a sense of nostalgia.  After the death of her husband, 75 year old Veronica was dumped into a care home by her children. Miserable about her mundane routine that the care home offers. Her devoted yet air headed carer Kenny persuades her to create a bucket list. Failing to take this seriously, Veronica is determined to go to a strip club. When the permission is denied, Kenny calls a stripper to the home however this doesn’t go to plan when her son Michael pays her a visit with news of a new grandchild. She later realises that she should use the bucket list as a way to reconnect with her daughter. 

 

  

For this project we will need roughly £2,500 in order to create our pilot episode. This is a break down what the money will be spent on: 

As stated above a big chunk of this money will be going towards building our sets where we will need to buy big furniture such as armchairs, tables, beds etc. also needing to provide costumes for the characters. We are hoping to sauce these from local charity shops and online as a way of saving money, however this could still get expensive. 

Additionally, paying our actors for this project will take up a large sum of the funding, as we would like to have experienced and well suited actors this means paying them a fair rate across a filming week. Due to having 2 main characters and 3 side characters this will bump up our costs. However as our story is very character driven, we believe it is important to have those more experienced as a way to illustrate this through actors. 

Any remanding money will be donated to our local care homes, specifically one that will be used in our episode, to hopefully go towards helping better their experience in the care homes. 

Those who contribute to our project will receive a credit at the end of our episode, with a complimentary gift box which will also include a hard copy of the episode as a thank you for your donation. 

 

                                    

 

    Georgia Weaver - Producer 

With having had previous experience in producing for other films and television shows, I took a real interest in creatively organising a project and realised I love producing. I hope to use these skills to make this a fun and innovative sitcom pilot that everybody will enjoy.

 

   Emily Montyn - Director 

I’m Emily and I’m the director of our sitcom pilot. I wanted to take on this role as it’s something I have not yet done during my time at university but always wanted to do. It may be ambitious taking on such a demanding role for this project, but I am taking the necessary steps to ensure that myself and my team will succeed with our plans for our final project.

 

   Jade Sheldon - Director of Photography 

I’m Jade, the Director of Photography for this sitcom pilot. Unlike other projects I have worked on such as Swipe Right and 50PH13, this project will require me to manage a small team of camera operators to ensure thorough coverage to catch all the best moments both scripted and unscripted.

 

   Annabel Thomas-Gay - Production Designer 

I’m Annabel the Production Designer for the sitcom pilot, Veronica’s List. I have only previously taken one this role once for the short film, Swipe Right, therefore I am excited to face new challenges that come with this role. Alongside this I am keen to carry out any research that may help me along the way in order to create a well-designed set for the pilot. 

 

   Tom Kennedy - Editor 

Having studied Film and TV for over 8 years and specialising within the creative departments of film, I have opted to undertake the editorial role for the TV sitcom ‘Veronica’s List’. This will be my first time stepping up to the given job title for a TV studio production, bringing new challenges and experiences to light. I am looking forward to the tasks ahead whilst also striving to achieve a unique, visual aesthetic with my aims as editor.

 

   Evelyn Iulia Dicu - Sound 

I’m Evelyn and I’m the Sound Operator for the sitcom pilot. Being a sound operator is challenging for me because I’ve never done it before. I’ll work hard to make sure everything will go smoothly for our graduate project.

 

Thank you for getting this far, we understand that not everybody is able to donate money, however there are other ways in which you can help us. 

Like our Facebook page where you will have access to: 

  • Teasers 
  • Posts following our journey
  • Exclusive Q&A videos with actors and crew 
  • Behind the scene photos and videos 
  • Interactive sign up to create your own bucket lists to share to your friends and family. 

Don't forget you can also share our indiegogo page with friends and family, getting our project out there will really benefit us.  

Thank you!
