story:
Short Summary

Kevin Jackson is a Writer, Director, Animator, Film Producer, and Educator.  Mr. Jackson founded his own production company Nivek Pro.  He has vowed to change the animation and film industries in Jamaica by championing various organizational committees such as Jamaica Animation Nation Network (JANN), Jamaica Design Associate (JDA), and Jamaica Film and Television Association (JAFTA) serving in various leadership roles for each.

Chevonnese Chevers Whyte is a Graphic Designer, Animator, Marketer, and Educator.  She has dedicated herself to make a positive change in Jamaica through her students and the production Abeeku and the maroons.  As the co-founder and marketing manager of Night Vision Media Ltd. it is her hope that Abeeku and the maroons will entertain, educate, and change how we feel about Jamaica.

Adrian Whyte is a Graphic Designer and Educator.  As the other co-founder of Night Vision Media Ltd. he supervises the development of the Abeeku and the maroons game.

Mr. Jackson conceived the story Abeeku and the maroons (originally The Maroons) and connected with Chevonnese Chevers Whyte to assist with producing it.  They recognized that Jamaican people are losing touch with our culture and with their common goal of making a positive change in Jamaica, decided that this production can be one such action to assist in that goal.  

Your assistance will help us to pay for much needed people and equipment to produce the series quickly.  This includes: 1 Graphic Designer; 1 Illustrator; 3 Animators; 1 Motion Graphics/ Video Editor; 8 Interns/ Students; and 1 Office & Research Assistant (all Jamaican grown professionals).  We will also acquire equipment that will assist those professionals to complete their duties in a timely fashion.  If we are able to secure these people and purchase these equipment, we believe we can complete all three seasons within two years.

What We Need & What You Get

At this time, the project is wholly funded by the managers of the project, Adrian Whyte, Chevonnese Chevers Whyte and Kevin Jackson.  Through this method it has taken us seven years to develop one episode.  As such, we look to you to assist with funding the project and producing the episodes quickly.  You can help us in one of five ways:

The Plan
JA$350.00 or US$3.00 contribution
The person who contributes at this tier receives:

  • advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes

Gathering Tools
JA$1000.00 or US$10.00 contribution
The person who contributes at this tier receives:

  • advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
  • Abeeku and the maroons stickers mailed to an address of your choosing

The Escape
JA$10,000.00 or US$100.00 contribution
The person who contributes at this tier receives:

  • advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
  • Abeeku and the maroons care package mailed to an address of your choosing (package includes various merchandising items)

The Rescue
JA$100,000.00 or US$1000.00 contribution
The person who contributes at this tier receives:

  • advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
  • Abeeku and the maroons care package mailed to an address of your choosing (package includes various merchandising items)
  • listing in the credits under financing
  • a signed character poster from the director

New Horizons
JA$150,000.00+ or US$1500.00+ contribution
The person who contributes at this tier receives:

  • advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
  • Abeeku and the maroons care package mailed to an address of your choosing (package includes various merchandising items)
  • listing in the credits under financing
  • a signed character poster from the director
  • a character modeled in the image of the investor
  • dinner/ lunch with the management team

As you support our cause we will use the funds to acquire talent and equipment.  If the desired goal of gaining US$750,000,00 is not achieved, we will acquire resources as follows:

  • 1 Animator, 1 Motion Graphics Artist/ Video Editor, and 2 computers
  • then rent a location to accommodate all the talent
  • then 1 Illustrator, 1 Adobe Suite license, and 1 computer
  • then 1 Office/ Research Assistant
  • then 1 Anime Studio license, 1 Animator, and 1 computer
  • then 1 Anime Studio license, 1 Animator, and 1 computer
  • then 1 Graphic Designer, 1 Adobe Suite license, and 1 computer
  • then 8 paid Interns with Anime Studio software and 8 computers
  • then outfit the location with other tools and equipment to assist professionals

The location will then be used to educate young people about animation and then assist with the development of future animated projects out of Night Vision Media Ltd.

The Impact

This project is aimed at promoting the Jamaican culture.  Bring back our patriotism.  Additionally, we intend to stimulate the Jamaican economy by educating our young people about animation so that eventually they can create their own projects.  Our paid interns can learn and earn as they are being taught about animation and gaining real hands on experience.

This is our first project of its kind but our director, Kevin Jackson, is not new to creating shorts.  He has developed short live action films which has gained traction in Jamaica.  One such film is Heart Shaped Box

Risks & Challenges

We have been creating the first episode for a few years and can share why the project has taken us so long to produce:

  • Lack of talent.  Jamaica has always had animators but they were few.  It has been recently that there has been a drive to promote animation in Jamaica and so now there are various schools that are offering this course of study.  We are overcoming this problem as there are already students who have graduated from: various HEART institutions, at the CXC level, and coming soon are graduates at the Bachelors level.
  • Lack of the right talent.  Even though the talent existed we found that we needed to work with the right talent.  Over the years we have developed a hiring style that has worked for us and qualify the right talent to work with us and develop the project.
  • Money.  At the moment we wholly fund the project.  As we work, we donate money to our own project.  This really slows up the process in purchasing the right equipment, software, and paying people to contribute their talent.  With your help we can overcome that hurdle.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your assistance.  If you can't donate your money, we still need your help:

  • Tell others about our campaign
  • Promote our production
  • Lend us your talent
  • Assist with rendering

We are using Indiegogo to assist us to communicate with you our needs.  Please ensure to use this platform to let others know about our campaign and promote Abeeku and the maroons.

That's it.  Thanks for just taking your time to view our campaign and hoping that after you have read our campaign that you're as excited as we are and would love to make a contribution.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Kevin Jackson is a Writer, Director, Animator, Film Producer, and Educator.  Mr. Jackson founded his own production company Nivek Pro.  He has vowed to change the animation and film industries in Jamaica by championing various organizational committees such as Jamaica Animation Nation Network (JANN), Jamaica Design Associate (JDA), and Jamaica Film and Television Association (JAFTA) serving in various leadership roles for each.
Chevonnese Chevers Whyte is a Graphic Designer, Animator, Marketer, and Educator.  She has dedicated herself to make a positive change in Jamaica through her students and the production Abeeku and the maroons.  As the co-founder and marketing manager of Night Vision Media Ltd. it is her hope that Abeeku and the maroons will entertain, educate, and change how we feel about Jamaica.
Adrian Whyte is a Graphic Designer and Educator.  As the other co-founder of Night Vision Media Ltd. he supervises the development of the Abeeku and the maroons game.
Mr. Jackson conceived the story Abeeku and the maroons (originally The Maroons) and connected with Chevonnese Chevers Whyte to assist with producing it.  They recognized that Jamaican people are losing touch with our culture and with their common goal of making a positive change in Jamaica, decided that this production can be one such action to assist in that goal.  
Your assistance will help us to pay for much needed people and equipment to produce the series quickly.  This includes: 1 Graphic Designer; 1 Illustrator; 3 Animators; 1 Motion Graphics/ Video Editor; 8 Interns/ Students; and 1 Office & Research Assistant (all Jamaican grown professionals).  We will also acquire equipment that will assist those professionals to complete their duties in a timely fashion.  If we are able to secure these people and purchase these equipment, we believe we can complete all three seasons within two years.

What We Need & What You Get
At this time, the project is wholly funded by the managers of the project, Adrian Whyte, Chevonnese Chevers Whyte and Kevin Jackson.  Through this method it has taken us seven years to develop one episode.  As such, we look to you to assist with funding the project and producing the episodes quickly.  You can help us in one of five ways:
The PlanJA$350.00 or US$3.00 contributionThe person who contributes at this tier receives:
advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
Gathering ToolsJA$1000.00 or US$10.00 contributionThe person who contributes at this tier receives:

advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
Abeeku and the maroons stickers mailed to an address of your choosing

The EscapeJA$10,000.00 or US$100.00 contributionThe person who contributes at this tier receives:

advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
Abeeku and the maroons care package mailed to an address of your choosing (package includes various merchandising items)

The RescueJA$100,000.00 or US$1000.00 contributionThe person who contributes at this tier receives:

advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
Abeeku and the maroons care package mailed to an address of your choosing (package includes various merchandising items)
listing in the credits under financing
a signed character poster from the director

New HorizonsJA$150,000.00+ or US$1500.00+ contributionThe person who contributes at this tier receives:

advanced notices of screenings and publications of episodes
Abeeku and the maroons care package mailed to an address of your choosing (package includes various merchandising items)
listing in the credits under financing
a signed character poster from the director
a character modeled in the image of the investor
dinner/ lunch with the management team

As you support our cause we will use the funds to acquire talent and equipment.  If the desired goal of gaining US$750,000,00 is not achieved, we will acquire resources as follows:

1 Animator, 1 Motion Graphics Artist/ Video Editor, and 2 computers
then rent a location to accommodate all the talent
then 1 Illustrator, 1 Adobe Suite license, and 1 computer
then 1 Office/ Research Assistant
then 1 Anime Studio license, 1 Animator, and 1 computer
then 1 Anime Studio license, 1 Animator, and 1 computer
then 1 Graphic Designer, 1 Adobe Suite license, and 1 computer
then 8 paid Interns with Anime Studio software and 8 computers
then outfit the location with other tools and equipment to assist professionals

The location will then be used to educate young people about animation and then assist with the development of future animated projects out of Night Vision Media Ltd.

The Impact
This project is aimed at promoting the Jamaican culture.  Bring back our patriotism.  Additionally, we intend to stimulate the Jamaican economy by educating our young people about animation so that eventually they can create their own projects.  Our paid interns can learn and earn as they are being taught about animation and gaining real hands on experience.
This is our first project of its kind but our director, Kevin Jackson, is not new to creating shorts.  He has developed short live action films which has gained traction in Jamaica.  One such film is Heart Shaped Box

Risks & Challenges
We have been creating the first episode for a few years and can share why the project has taken us so long to produce:

Lack of talent.  Jamaica has always had animators but they were few.  It has been recently that there has been a drive to promote animation in Jamaica and so now there are various schools that are offering this course of study.  We are overcoming this problem as there are already students who have graduated from: various HEART institutions, at the CXC level, and coming soon are graduates at the Bachelors level.
Lack of the right talent.  Even though the talent existed we found that we needed to work with the right talent.  Over the years we have developed a hiring style that has worked for us and qualify the right talent to work with us and develop the project.
Money.  At the moment we wholly fund the project.  As we work, we donate money to our own project.  This really slows up the process in purchasing the right equipment, software, and paying people to contribute their talent.  With your help we can overcome that hurdle.


Other Ways You Can Help
We need your assistance.  If you can't donate your money, we still need your help:

Tell others about our campaign
Promote our production
Lend us your talent
Assist with rendering

We are using Indiegogo to assist us to communicate with you our needs.  Please ensure to use this platform to let others know about our campaign and promote Abeeku and the maroons.That's it.  Thanks for just taking your time to view our campaign and hoping that after you have read our campaign that you're as excited as we are and would love to make a contribution.

story:
[VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL ABAJO]

"Taller de Video" is a TV series with a first season of 8 chapters of 45 min duration. It is about a group of different young people who attend a video workshop dictated by a funny decadent actress. It takes place in the city of Valparaíso, the historic port of Chile. Vicente, a young man, talented in animation and drawing, prepares an internship in Japan, but his mother, Claudia, forced by justice must teach a video workshop to which the young misfits of the city arrive with particular visions of the modern video. It is a series that shows different styles and current trends of the new generation, recognizing the value of diversity and the right of young people to experience the positive of the urban culture offered to them. 

 

CLAUDIA (Vane Miller): She is an actress and singer who faces the collapse of her family life and career. She plunged into sadness and alcoholism. Teaching a video workshop seeks to regain the control of her life.

VICENTE (Jan Jacobsen): He is a creative cartoonist, Asian Anime lover, currently preparing a study trip to Japan. He is the only son of Claudia, shy and introverted, has not yet lost his virginity.

JONATHAN (Juan Cano): He is a young DJ of Mexican origin and also Vicente's best friend since childhood. He likes to be in the center of attention and he is a competitive and materialistic person. Due to its good economic situation, he feels that he lacks of real friends. 

LUCIA (Paulina Moreno): She is attractive and interested in neo hippie culture. She takes ecological causes very serious, such us green guerrilla. Lucia is very liberal in terms of relationships, she is attracted to both men and women and she lives her sexuality with no limits.

ADRÌA (Ulises Gimeno): Originally from Spain, he is a very political person and has a negative view of the society. He is an anarchist, anti-systemic and in tune with urban culture to the point that he lives in a squat. He tends to be violent and gets into trouble often.

JENNY (Paulina Goldsack): She has lived through many dramas in her life. She wants to be a famous actress and breakdancer. Deep inside she tends to be depressive, while she is an absent mother with problems of drug addiction. 

EMILIO (Nico Marchant): He is a creative genius, he is gay and likes transformism and general disguise. Emilio is constantly happy, although in the end he hides his problems and tends to be provocative.

TANIA (Constanza Blanco): Lives in a fantasy world and believes that she is a vampire. She likes to dress extravagant and create her own dream worlds. She wants to be an actress and she feels very attracted to Vicente.

 

We came to Indiegogo because we want to give you the opportunity to be part of the series and terminate this project together.

An audiovisual project includes 4 stages: development, production, post-production and distribution. In this three-year development and production period, we have managed to finance 85% of these eight chapters. 

We’ve calculated that we need a minimum goal of $ 35’000 USD for the post-production and the distribution for all 8 chapters. If we get over this amount, we would be able to finish the series earlier with higher-quality work and spread it wider to the public with more marketing & distribution work.

 

This project is unique in its kind, it is the first regional TV series filmed entirely in the city of Valparaíso by an independent company and a very young team. We believe that the series is one of the first expressions of a new generation that has the desire to live in fraternity, which for us is the heart of what Latin America represents: a vibrant culture full of optimism and joy of life. 

Thanks to the support of the National Television Council of Chile (CNTV), we have been able to film the first eight chapters, but we still need a final step to finish this first season and present it to the world. For this we need our global community to support us and most importantly we need to connect with you. 

 

We want you to be part of the project. We have been searching for ways that you can participate in the creative process, for example, giving us your opinion of the first cut or putting your company logo as a presenter. Our rewards increase the range of participation and integration in the project and our artistic work. All the perks you find on our Indiegogo page are exclusively designed for you and only available during the campaign.

NOTE: perks from $25 & up: all previous perks are inclusive, except personal hangouts

$10 USD: Digital download of the offical Soundtracks of TDV.

$25 USD: Early access to the final version chapter 1-8 (streaming online).

$50 USD: Be creative: primal access to first cut chapter 1-8 (streaming online) and give your comments and ideas to the editors.

$75 USD: Get the book of the Director "Asumir la mirada de nuestro cine" (Spanish, PDF version) + your photo in the credits.

$100 USD: Skype hangout with the Director for one hour approx. + get the scripts of TDV (PDF version).

$200 USD: Exclusive film guidance from the Director via Skype hangout: consulting of your own film project in three sessions of 1 hour approx.

$500 USD: Join the Director and some actors at a VIP dinner party at a special place in Valparaíso (travel & lodging not included).

$1’000 USD: You are the Producer of the series! Your name appears at the final credits of each chapter & you meet the Director & Vane Miller at a private dinner in Valparaíso (2 pers./travel & lodging not included).

$2’000 USD: Your company logo or product appears digital in one chapter & your logo appears at the end of every chapter.

$5’000 USD: Your name appears at the begin of each chapter + you get a personal guided tour from the Director & Vane Miller in Valparaíso visiting the places of filming & secret spots (2 pers./2 days/lodging & meals included/travel not included).

$10’000 USD: You present TDV! Your logo or name appears big in the opening of each chapter in the national Chilean television!

 

Director: Juan CORTÉS MANCILLA
Script: Juan CORTÉS MANCILLA, Constanza BLANCO, Enrique VIDELA, Vladimir RIVERA, Sebastián AYALA
Producer: Erick AESCHLIMANN
Advisor and Legal Representative: Maximiliano CERECEDA
Project Manager: Bettina GLÄTTLI
General Production: Erick AESCHLIMANN, Francisco ÁLVAREZ
Direction of Photography:  Juan MILLÁN COSTA
Art Direction: Barbara JERALDO SCHERPING
Music: Oscar JIMÉNEZ, Tunacola

[WHOLE TEAM]

 

One way to be involved in our campaign is to purchase our exclusive perks. Of course it is the most effective and powerful way to support us. However, if you wish to help us but cannot support our project financially, there are a lot of things you can do.

It is fundamental for us to reach as many people as possible. If you share or resend our campaign and online pages/posts, you will be supporting us in a very meaningful way. 

FOLLOW us on Instagram

LIKE us on Facebook & share our posts

SHARE this campaign with your family and friends by Email, WhatsApp or any other media by sharing this short link: https://igg.me/at/tdv

If you do not have a credit card and you would like to support us via REDCOMPRA, CUENTA RUT or PAYPAL it is totally possible - please contact us by Email: tdvequilibre@gmail.com.

Please also contact our Email if you have any other question: tdvequilibre@gmail.com.

THANKS TO EVERYONE WHO IS SUPPORTING US!

ESPAÑOL

“Taller de Video” es una serie de TV ficción con una primera temporada de 8 capítulos de 45 min de duración. Trata de un grupo de diversos jóvenes que asisten a un taller de video dictado por una actriz en decadencia. Transcurre en la ciudad de Valparaíso, el puerto cultural de Chile, allí Vicente, un joven talentoso de la animación y el dibujo, se prepara para una pasantía en Japón, pero su madre, Claudia, forzada por la justicia debe dictar un taller de video al que llegan los jóvenes inadaptados de la ciudad con particulares visiones del video moderno. Es una serie generacional que recoge distintos estilos y tendencias actuales, reconociendo el valor de la diversidad y el derecho de los jóvenes a experimentar lo positivo que la cultura urbana les ofrece.

 

CLAUDIA (Vane Miller): Es una actriz y cantante que enfrenta el colapso de su vida familiar y carrera profesional. Se sumergió en la tristeza y el alcoholismo. Realizando un taller de video busca recuperar el control de su vida.

VICENTE (Jan Jacobsen): Dibujante creativo es amante del anime asiático y prepara un viaje de estudios a Japón. Es el hijo único de Claudia, su madre alcohólica y es una persona tímida y introvertida al punto que aún no ha perdido la virginidad.

JONATHAN (Juan Cano): Es un joven DJ de origen mexicano, el mejor amigo de Vicente desde niño. Le gusta ser el centro de atención, es competitivo y materialista. Debido a su buena situación económica, se siente que carece de reales amigos.

LUCIA (Paulina Moreno): De estilo neo hippie atractiva y afectuosa, se toma muy en serio el tema de la guerrilla verde, la lucha por la ecología. Es muy liberal en cuanto a relaciones de pareja, se siente atraída tanto por hombres como por mujeres, vive su sexualidad sin limitarse.

ADRÌA (Ulises Gimeno): Tiene nacionalidad española, es muy político y tiene mucho discurso social. Es anarquista, antisistémico y sintoniza con la cultura urbana. Tiene tendencia a ser violento y meterse en problemas.

JENNY (Paulina Goldsack): Ha vivido fuertes dramas en su vida. Le gustaría ser una actriz y breakdancer famosa. Tiende a la depresión, de padres ausentes, vida marginal y problemas de drogadicción.

EMILIO (Nico Marchant): Es un genio creativo, es gay y le gusta mucho el transformismo y el disfrazarse en general. Es una fuente constante de alegría, aunque en el fondo esconde sus problemas y tiende a ser demasiado provocador.

TANIA (Constanza Blanco): Vive en un mundo de fantasía, cree que es un Vampiro. Es extravagante y le gusta crear mundos. Su sueño es ser actriz y se siente muy atraída por Vicente.

 

Elegimos Indiegogo porque queremos darte la oportunidad de ser parte de la serie y terminar este proyecto juntos.

Un proyecto audiovisual incluye 4 etapas: desarrollo, producción, postproducción y distribución. En este periodo de tres años de desarrollo y producción, hemos logrado financiar el 85% de estos ocho capítulos.

Hemos calculado que necesitamos una meta mínima de $ 35’000 USD para la postproducción y la distribución de los 8 capítulos. Si obtenemos más de este monto, podremos terminar la serie antes con mejor calidad de trabajo,llegar a más público con más trabajo de marketing y distribución.

 

Este proyecto es único en su especie, es la primera serie de TV regional filmada totalmente en la ciudad de Valparaíso de forma independiente y con un equipo muy joven. Creemos que es una de las primeras muestras de una nueva generación con ganas de convivir en fraternidad, que para nosotros es el corazón de lo que representa América Latina, una cultura vibrante llena de optimismo y alegría de vivir.

Gracias al apoyo del Consejo Nacional de Televisión de Chile (CNTV), hemos podido filmar los primeros ocho capítulos, pero todavía nos falta un escalón final para poder terminar la edición y presentar al mundo nuestra serie. Para que esto se concrete necesitamos que nuestra comunidad nos apoye, necesitamos conectar contigo.

 

Hemos buscado la forma de que participes del proceso creativo pudiendo por ejemplo darnos tu opinión antes de acabar la serie o poniendo el logo de tu empresa como colaborador. Nuestras recompensas incrementan el rango de participación, de integración en el proyecto y nuestra realización artística. Son exclusivas y disponibles solamente durante esta campaña de Indiegogo.

 

Director: Juan CORTÉS MANCILLA
Guión: Juan CORTÉS MANCILLA, Constanza BLANCO, Enrique VIDELA, Vladimir RIVERA, Sebastián AYALA
Productor: Erick AESCHLIMANN
Asesor y Representante Legal: Maximiliano CERECEDA
Manager de Proyecto: Bettina GLÄTTLI
Producción General: Erick AESCHLIMANN, Francisco ÁLVAREZ
Dirección de Fotografía:  Juan MILLÁN COSTA
Dirección de Arte: Barbara JERALDO SCHERPING
Música: Oscar JIMÉNEZ, Tunacola

[EQUIPO COMPLETO]

 

Una forma de ser parte de nuestra campaña es elegir una de nuestras recompensas exclusivas. De todos modos, si deseas ayudarnos, pero no puedes aportar de forma económica a nuestro proyecto, hay muchas misiones que puedes hacer.

Es fundamental para nosotros poder llegar a más gente, si compartes nuestro contenido, comentas y participas, estarás ayudando de manera significativa a nuestro proyecto.

SEGUIRNOS en Instagram

DARLE LIKE a nuestra página de Facebook y compartir nuestras publicaciones

COMPARTE esta campaña con tus familiares y amigos por email, WhatsApp o por cualquier medio social con nuestro link de campaña: https://igg.me/at/tdv

Si no tienes tarjeta de crédito y quieres apoyarnos vía REDCOMPRA, CUENTA RUT o PAYPAL es absolutamente posible. Por favor contáctanos vía email a tdvequilibre@gmail.com.

Si tienes cualquier otra pregunta escríbenos a nuestro email: tdvequilibre@gmail.com.

MUCHAS GRACIAS A TODOS QUIENES NOS APOYAN!

Es anarquista, antisistémico y sintoniza con la cultura urbana. Tiene tendencia a ser violento y meterse en problemas.JENNY (Paulina Goldsack): Ha vivido fuertes dramas en su vida. Le gustaría ser una actriz y breakdancer famosa. Tiende a la depresión, de padres ausentes, vida marginal y problemas de drogadicción.EMILIO (Nico Marchant): Es un genio creativo, es gay y le gusta mucho el transformismo y el disfrazarse en general. Es una fuente constante de alegría, aunque en el fondo esconde sus problemas y tiende a ser demasiado provocador.TANIA (Constanza Blanco): Vive en un mundo de fantasía, cree que es un Vampiro. Es extravagante y le gusta crear mundos. Su sueño es ser actriz y se siente muy atraída por Vicente. Elegimos Indiegogo porque queremos darte la oportunidad de ser parte de la serie y terminar este proyecto juntos.Un proyecto audiovisual incluye 4 etapas: desarrollo, producción, postproducción y distribución. En este periodo de tres años de desarrollo y producción, hemos logrado financiar el 85% de estos ocho capítulos.Hemos calculado que necesitamos una meta mínima de $ 35’000 USD para la postproducción y la distribución de los 8 capítulos. Si obtenemos más de este monto, podremos terminar la serie antes con mejor calidad de trabajo,llegar a más público con más trabajo de marketing y distribución. Este proyecto es único en su especie, es la primera serie de TV regional filmada totalmente en la ciudad de Valparaíso de forma independiente y con un equipo muy joven. Creemos que es una de las primeras muestras de una nueva generación con ganas de convivir en fraternidad, que para nosotros es el corazón de lo que representa América Latina, una cultura vibrante llena de optimismo y alegría de vivir.Gracias al apoyo del Consejo Nacional de Televisión de Chile (CNTV), hemos podido filmar los primeros ocho capítulos, pero todavía nos falta un escalón final para poder terminar la edición y presentar al mundo nuestra serie. Para que esto se concrete necesitamos que nuestra comunidad nos apoye, necesitamos conectar contigo. Hemos buscado la forma de que participes del proceso creativo pudiendo por ejemplo darnos tu opinión antes de acabar la serie o poniendo el logo de tu empresa como colaborador. Nuestras recompensas incrementan el rango de participación, de integración en el proyecto y nuestra realización artística. Son exclusivas y disponibles solamente durante esta campaña de Indiegogo. Director: Juan CORTÉS MANCILLAGuión: Juan CORTÉS MANCILLA, Constanza BLANCO, Enrique VIDELA, Vladimir RIVERA, Sebastián AYALAProductor: Erick AESCHLIMANNAsesor y Representante Legal: Maximiliano CERECEDAManager de Proyecto: Bettina GLÄTTLIProducción General: Erick AESCHLIMANN, Francisco ÁLVAREZDirección de Fotografía:  Juan MILLÁN COSTADirección de Arte: Barbara JERALDO SCHERPINGMúsica: Oscar JIMÉNEZ, Tunacola[EQUIPO COMPLETO] Una forma de ser parte de nuestra campaña es elegir una de nuestras recompensas exclusivas. De todos modos, si deseas ayudarnos, pero no puedes aportar de forma económica a nuestro proyecto, hay muchas misiones que puedes hacer.Es fundamental para nosotros poder llegar a más gente, si compartes nuestro contenido, comentas y participas, estarás ayudando de manera significativa a nuestro proyecto.SEGUIRNOS en InstagramDARLE LIKE a nuestra página de Facebook y compartir nuestras publicacionesCOMPARTE esta campaña con tus familiares y amigos por email, WhatsApp o por cualquier medio social con nuestro link de campaña: https://igg.me/at/tdvSi no tienes tarjeta de crédito y quieres apoyarnos vía REDCOMPRA, CUENTA RUT o PAYPAL es absolutamente posible. Por favor contáctanos vía email a tdvequilibre@gmail.com.Si tienes cualquier otra pregunta escríbenos a nuestro email: tdvequilibre@gmail.com.MUCHAS GRACIAS A TODOS QUIENES NOS APOYAN!

story:
FREELANCERS with Bill Gentile

My name is Bill Gentile. I'm an independent journalist and documentary filmmaker teaching at American University in Washington, DC. I've been a journalist for the past 40 years -- and I am deeply concerned about the state and the perception of my craft.

I began in 1977 as reporter for the Mexico City News and correspondent for United Press International (UPI) based in Mexico City. I covered the 1979 Sandinista Revolution in Nicaragua. I spent two years as editor on UPI’s Foreign Desk in New York, then moved to Nicaragua and became Newsweek Magazine’s Contract Photographer for Latin America and the Caribbean. I covered the U.S.-backed Contra War in Nicaragua and the Salvadoran Civil War in the 1980s; the U.S. invasion of Panama; the 1990-91 Persian Gulf War and the subsequent wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.

Here's my concern. In recent years mainstream media outlets have cut staff and closed bureaus around the world. Stepping into that void is a new generation of daring, determined and tech-savvy freelance correspondents searching for the truth that we consume every day.

But too many Americans believe that journalism is exclusively about commentators in air-conditioned studios debating current events. Journalism is more than that. Journalism begins on the ground, with dedicated professionals searching for truth.

I'm conducting this campaign to help fund a series of documentaries about freelancers to show the world who these independent journalist are, and how they send us information we need to make crucial decisions about our lives and the countries we live in. In an age when information is power, what can be more important?

But I’m thousands of dollars away from completing the pilot documentary, which is only the first of a global series. A contribution from you would allow me to finish this pilot, and head to Turkey to film Episode 2.

I can’t do any of this without your help. We're all in this together. And the stakes are so high.

Thanks for your support.

What We Need & What You Get

My crowdfunding goal is $60,000. The documentary is now in what we call post-production. Editing, music, promotion. All of that, and more, still have to be done.

In return for your support, I'm offering a series of perks. These include personalized, signed copies of photographs from my book, Nicaragua, to actual copies of the book, to Skype sessions with me regarding projects you may be working on.

If this campaign does not reach its objective, I'll just have to dig deeper into my own credit cards to get the pilot documentary finished properly.

The Impact

I'm not asking for just a contribution. I’m asking you to be part of a mission to help show the world who these freelance foreign correspondents are, how they do their work, and why they've chosen these lives so far away from the people and the places that they used to call home.

I've been making documentaries for some 20 years now, and this is not only the most ambitious, but also the most important. For me. For journalism. For everyone who sees this documentary.

Risks & Challenges

This endeavor is not without risk. The series takes me -- and some of the assistants who help me -- to places where a lot of people don't want to go. And shouldn't go. I've been going to these places for a long time. As a freelance foreign correspondent, and later for United Press International and Newsweek magazine, I've covered conflict in Central America, the Caribbean, Iraq and Afghanistan. I've also worked across Africa and Asia.

Where Your Contributions Will Go

Your contribution is extremely important to us. Every dollar counts. The funds will go to cover the following:

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that some of you simply cannot afford to contribute to this campaign. But there are other ways that you can support us. Use the Indiegogo crowdfunding tools, for example. Spread the word about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and any other social media.

-- Share the hashtag - #freelancersfortruth, #freelancerswithbillgentile 

-- Follow us on twitter - https://twitter.com/billgentile

-- Follow us on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/freelancerswithbillgen...

-- Follow us on Instagram- https://www.instagram.com/freelancerswithbillge...

--Tell your friends!

Thanks for your support!

story:
ABOUT US

Alex Restrepo is a Colombian-American actress, writer and producer. She was born in Colombia, grew up in New York City and now is based in Los Angeles.

Alex is the recipient of the prestigious diversity scholarship at UCB (Upright Citizens Brigade). Comedy and Sci-Fi are her favorite genres.

Currently she’s working towards creating more opportunities for underrepresented minorities both in front and behind cameras.

Ricardo Tobon is a filmmaker, artist and animator that has helped push the boundaries of performance and storytelling in animation, visual effects and games at studios that include Sony Computer Entertainment, Digital Domain, Weta Digital, and DreamWorks Animation.

Ricardo was born and raised in Colombia South America where he started his career in Film and TV. He currently lives and works in Los Angeles where he strives to make the entertainment industry a friendlier place for minorities.

 

WHAT WE NEED

We can't do this project without your help. In order to be able to hire diverse artists to make this animation, we need to be able to pay them properly. We 'll also need to pay for things such as software, equipment, studio time. The list goes on and on.

Any contribution helps, no matter how small. We have some great perks all the way from thanks and shout-outs to posters, t-shirts all the way to a guest role on the project.

 

WHAT YOU GET

When you support this campaign you'll have the opportunity to receive a wide variety of perks,  to show our appreciation. Some of these perks include: a personal shout out on Alex Tronica's social channels, a private link to view the series before it's released to the public, coffee with the series' creators, or even an executive producer credit on Alex Tronica!

You'll also get the satisfaction that comes with helping infuse more diversity and inclusion into the animation industry.

 

THE IMPACT

Inclusion and Diversity are very important to us. The story of Alex Tronica is a universal one, everyone has access to the human experience. But we want to inject diversity and inclusion to the creation process of the series. By helping us make this project you are helping infuse more diversity and inclusion the entertainment industry.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

In order to reach our goal for this project we need help from as many of you as possible. In addition to donating to the campaign, sharing the link to campaign via social media will help to spread the word about this important story.

story:
One Fun Night

Liv Luv Līv is meant to make you get up on your feet and dance to some of Philly's best underground music. The DIY scene in Philadelphia is wide and varied, we wish for our show to be true to form.

It'll be a 3 hour show for 3 acts! Graciously hosted by The Ruba Club in Northern Liberties and powered in part by PhillyCAM, Philadelphia's Community Access Center.

We want anyone and everyone to be a part of the action, and to share the music we love with all who may love it too, thus it'll be livestreamed or bust!

How Your Contribution Helps

We're close to making this show the best it can be, with your help we can make it unforgettable, and hopefully we can better amplify the call for more funding to Philadelphia's Public Schools.

We won't see a dime of the money you give, and anything we don't spend on the production will go to be donated in support of the School District of Philadelphia. So here's what we'll be using it for:

  • Equipment like lights, microphones, and computer infrastructure.
  • Feeding our wonderful talent and crew.
  • Compensating Ruba Club staff for their time and consideration.
  • Spreading the good word!

If you can't spare the money at the moment, you can still help us by sharing this campaign on your social media. Better yet, come to the show!

Following us on social media like Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, or even subscribing to our channel is also a big help.

Wait, Who Are We?

We are Līv Sound Group, a collective that produces live content of the artistic variety! For the past few years we've produced professional-grade web content for growing and talented musicians using our two sister series as platforms. Check us out on youtube!
 

Thanks In Advance!

If have any questions for us about the event or just want to know more about what we do, feel free to shoot us an email at livsoundgroup@gmail.com

story:
Hello Family,

Many of you know me personally others we probably met at a music or entertainment event or even online. I'm Cassandra Bautista  aka Spice the creator of this fun project. This project is on behalf of everyone that has ever experienced heart break, betrayal, and the painful process of divorce. I recently graduated from film school and have educational degrees in various subjects such as law, ethnic studies, and American studies. I also have a background in radio, journalism, and event planning. 

In addition to working to fund a docu-series on government housing projects I am currently a divorce party planner. I would love to bring a new comedic talk show to television that covers everything that touches on divorces, heart break, and relationships. My team and I want to not only laugh at the horror stories of dating, marriage, and separation but to capture the fun experience of planning divorce parties and showing the world that there is life after heart break.

 

This project is important to me because if this tv pilot is successful ultimately an entire tv show will be aired and it would be the first television show that focuses on the career of a divorce party planner. It is also important  that this tv pilot is made because it is a show and career that brings smiles and excitement to many families that are saddened or even depressed due to a break up or divorce. Plus the show is also about redemption.  

Contributors your efforts  and backing help many individuals such as myself and my team fulfill our dreams of being a first time television show producer or crew member. You also help give a voice to many that usually feel like that they are alone dealing with a divorce or breakup. Your assistance  helps provide resources to these same populations such as guidance from a divorce attorney or tips from a child support expert. If all of the above does not touch your heart then maybe knowing that you can get a good laugh at people that remind you of one your dreaded  exs as they are blasted on our show . Still not interested then maybe entertainment and escapism is your thing. By funding this tv pilot you will be able to view exciting and luxurious destinations, fabulous performances, fascinating costumes, thrilling activities, and outrageous pranks trustingly this may spark your interest in being the wind beneath the wings of  this tv pilot.   

Our crew and cast needs funds to help secure talent, provide meals for guests and crew, get filming permits, pay for filming locations, pay for our film crew, pay for lighting,sound, editing, advertising, costumes, music, make up, travel and lodging expenses, and camera expenses. We need like 30,000 dollars to get our tv pilot started.But we want to start with the pre-production stage which requires 5,000 dollars.

We are excited that musicians, restaurant owners, business owners, entertainment executives and community leaders believe in our vision and are offering some of their products or services as rewards for our tv show's pilot backers. You can expect some social media shout outs, music cd's, Saucy Lips sauces, media consultant seminars, and other cool items.

 

The Impact

 

Your contribution to this project helps support people of color, women, people with disabilities, the LGBT community have a presence on television, a platform that traditionally has been ran by wealthy white males.

Your contribution can help you advertise your company, build relationships with people in the tv, music, and film community, gain IMDB credits, producer credits, gain valuable guidance from entertainment leaders, support a local business, enjoy yummy food, take home autographed CD's and get unique perks.  

Your contribution has the potential to support the economy, make thousands of people internationally laugh, and make dreams come true. 

I have received over 18 scholarships in college, have a trusted relationships with my community, surrounding community, and globally, and was hand picked by Ava Duvernay to work on A Wrinkle In Time a Walt Disney Studios films. I believe my education, work experience, and  my brilliant team that constantly excels combined with perseverance and  persistence will make this tv pilot successful.

Risks & Challenges

We have our tv pilot planned out however, most of us have limited budgets, some of us are single parents, live in California a state where the cost of living is bananas, so we still struggle with finances. The biggest hurdle we have with this project is funding. That is why we are reaching out to backers. On our end we plan to invest some of our own funds, resources, time, and plan fundraising activities such as single events. If everyone contributes at least a dollar you are moving this project one step closer to our goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Let me plan your divorce party!

Interview our cast on one of your platforms such as on a tv show, radio show,or in an article.

Share our social media links and handles. Or invite a friend to like our tv pilots pages.

You can find them here at https://www.facebook.com/spicecdivorcepartyplan...

and on Instagram at @spicecdivorcepartyplanner

story:
What We Need Your Help With

We are a team of independent  filmmakers dedicated to shaking up the landscape of television with funny and compelling female-driven stories. Outer Boroughed, our first series, needs the support of the community to thrive! Currently, our goal is to raise enough money to cover the costs of:

  • The pilot’s production
  • Editing
  • Future episode development
  • Marketing, promotion, and pitching throughout 2017

Why We Believe This Project is Important

When we started this project, our original goal was to create a series about kick-ass, nuanced young women-- something we felt we didn’t see enough of on screen. We also wanted to make a show for anyone who grew up feeling like an outsider or misfit (like us) in some way. 

In the wake of recent political events, it has become increasingly clear how important it is to have both female characters and characters of diverse backgrounds, identities, and orientations in television and film. We believe that one of the best ways we can promote change and understanding between people is through storytelling. To paraphrase the wisdom of Rudine Bishop Simms, stories can be  mirrors that provide self-affirmation or windows that cultivate empathy.

By donating today, you're supporting a series that intends to fight the rise of ignorance and hate through stories about real people.

Poster by Jack Thrombly. If you'd like a print, be sure to donate today!

Our Team

CASEY JOHNSON-AKSOY, the director of "Outer Boroughed," is a Brooklyn-based filmmaker, writer, and entrepreneur.

FREYA DONEY, a writer and producer of "Outer Boroughed" who currently resides in Sydney, Australia. 

E.E. TURNER, a Queens-based writer and producer of "Outer Boroughed."

Our Talented Cast

Claire D'Angelo as Zoe Cunningham

Justin Rodriguez as Amir Haddad

Janet Admasu as Jasmine Harris

Nicole Romero as Benita Dos Santos

Sharon Feldeine as Robyn Harris

Future episode development
Marketing, promotion, and pitching throughout 2017
Why We Believe This Project is ImportantWhen we started this project, our original goal was to create a series about kick-ass, nuanced young women-- something we felt we didn’t see enough of on screen. We also wanted to make a show for anyone who grew up feeling like an outsider or misfit (like us) in some way. In the wake of recent political events, it has become increasingly clear how important it is to have both female characters and characters of diverse backgrounds, identities, and orientations in television and film. We believe that one of the best ways we can promote change and understanding between people is through storytelling. To paraphrase the wisdom of Rudine Bishop Simms, stories can be  mirrors that provide self-affirmation or windows that cultivate empathy.By donating today, you're supporting a series that intends to fight the rise of ignorance and hate through stories about real people.Poster by Jack Thrombly. If you'd like a print, be sure to donate today!Our TeamCASEY JOHNSON-AKSOY, the director of "Outer Boroughed," is a Brooklyn-based filmmaker, writer, and entrepreneur.FREYA DONEY, a writer and producer of "Outer Boroughed" who currently resides in Sydney, Australia. E.E. TURNER, a Queens-based writer and producer of "Outer Boroughed."Our Talented CastClaire D'Angelo as Zoe CunninghamJustin Rodriguez as Amir HaddadJanet Admasu as Jasmine HarrisNicole Romero as Benita Dos SantosSharon Feldeine as Robyn Harris

story:
Short Summary

I'm Kandra King.  I've been an actress in the entertainment business for over 20 years.  I wanted to produce shows that the entire family could watch together.  I wanted them to be humorous, intriguing, unique and safe entertainment for the whole family.  

What We Need & What You Get

I have worked tirelessly on this show for 2 years.  I spent a full year in pre-production writing and creating segments that I thought would be special and irresistible for viewers.  So, it actually has been 3 years.

I shot a sizzle reel for this show in October, 2018 and it has been received with enthusiasm and open-arms.  I have a contract that will put this show into millions of homes in 2019.  However, I need your support to raise the funds to shoot, edit and complete the next episodes, so I can deliver finished product to my Network Distributor.  They need to have finished episodes to deliver to all their Networks Nationwide, as well as their streaming partners.  I feel this is an uplifting show,  I hope you agree.  The world needs good, inspirational TV shows and Getaway To Paradise fulfills that need.  

The Impact

You will be part of creating something magical that you can be proud to share with your friends, family and business associates.

The positive impact and the chance to travel vicariously to exotic locations is a real treat for everyone.  And there is a lot of funny segments. Laughter heals the heart and the bones.

5% of all proceeds will go to CARRY, the non-profit I've been blessed to be part of since its inception.  As a board member, I can tell you that we are helping transform the lives of At-Risk and Foster youth in Los Angeles.  I believe this is a worthy proposition. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk will be that the campaign doesn't raise the funds to produce and deliver the next episodes.  Then you would just have the perks.  I do not believe there is any chance of this.  The hardest part is behind us and the TV channels really LOVE this show and are excited to promote and air it on their Network.  This show is God-Inspired.  I am so grateful for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

You do NOT have to contribute financially to be a huge support.  If you are just willing to SHARE this campaign, you are being a conduit to its success.  You can share this on your social media pages.  Please check out the Indiegogo share tools and make some noise!  Thank you.  I'm incredibly appreciative.  When it airs, you can Shout, "Hey, I helped make that happen!"

story:
Amortal is a series following the first clinical test subjects undergoing full nanite conversion. A procedure that over the course of 7 months will convert their entire bodies from organic cells to synthetic nanites, rendering them immortal.

Brought face to face with the physical and psychological effects, the test subjects begin to realize the true cost of becoming Amortal. For them, everything is a trade.

Amortal is the follow up series to the successful Spiderclown project "Image Killer," taking a grounded approach to science fiction. This is a story that we feel will connect with viewers in a way they haven't seen before by illuminating exactly what a person would give up by becoming immortal.

The Amortal program was created by Coil Industries, a titan biotech firm that pioneered synthetic organ transplants. While they've helped save countless lives, the company has recently come under scrutiny for claims that they have developed a cure for age and disease, effectively patenting immortality.

In light of the backlash from religious and naturalist fanatics, Coil Industries has commissioned this documentary to follow two different subjects and illustrate the full benefits of the Amortal program.

Led by scientist and researcher Dr. Ian Harrow, the Amortal program has accelerated their trial period, and exudes full confidence in their success, flaunting the program with pomp and circumstance.

Jordan Fisher (played by Dave Walpole) and Cassandra Nonni (played by Jessica Barrera) are the first two Amortal test subjects and were selected after a painstaking period of interviews and genetic testing.

A committee of scientists, genetics engineers and members of the Coil Industries board of directors met and screened each of the 126 applicants for the Amortal trials. After 9 weeks of gathering data, the selection committee finally landed on these two ideal candidates for the program.

story:
Who are Bridge The Moon?

We’re a young, startup production company based in London with strong connections to Miami and Los Angeles but we already see ourselves as an international film company. We have an endless list of ideas and we have set the wheels in motion with our Debut Short Film 'Deception' which is currently in post-production.

We're fresh, vibrant and passionate about creating an identity which defies the norms of the traditional film industry. And yes there will be things we can't change but we want to introduce moderns styles of how to operate a film company. We are a team who thrive on positivity and evolve from learning. If you are someone who shares this same passion for film production and storytelling we would love to hear from you!

 

 

The wrong side of what? What is this?

To most people, London is where it's at. It's the vibrant hub of all things culture, lifestyle and work. But what about just outside the border? Life exists there as well - doesn't it?

The Wrong Side of the M25 explores the day-to-day life within a small town just outside the epicentre of London, where nothing out of the ordinary really happens but, as a production team roars into town to shoot a Hollywood movie, there’s a sense that the community in this small town has much to offer the world.

The series is a project that we all feel a huge amount of passion for. We’ll be shooting it in a mockumentary-esque style and we feel that the scope of the series can be huge. It’s important to showcase the talents of a diverse cast and a brilliant young crew. Fundamentally, we believe that a lot of our audience will resonate with the idea of having dreams but end up becoming comfortable with what life has handed to them.

 

 

Why do we need your help?

We funded our first project ourselves and we still intend to provide a foundation for this project but to help us develop and scale as an evolving film company, we need to be prolific in our content and you could help us reach that goal. Upon consulting with several industry leaders we have an ever growing confidence that our series will be full of promise, a lot of heart and reflect well on society today.

 

Other ways you can help us...

Share this campaign! Share it with the people you know! Share with the ones you don't! Just share! The more people we can reach - the more people to take on our journey and this will make a HUGE difference!

Follow "Bridge The Moon" for latest updates, behind the scenes content and future opportunities.

You can follow us:
Facebook
Instagram
YouTube
Twitter
Website
IMDb

A special thanks to Godfrey B. for allowing us to use the image for our series poster. You can find more of his amazing photography on his website: Essex Views

story:
- Official Site - YouTube - Instagram - Facebook - Twitter -

A NaturNaL Project

BATMAN BEYOND: In the year 2041 Bruce Wayne now mentors the new Batman, Terry McGinnis. While defending the people of Neo-Gotham from its most vicious villains, Terry struggles to maintain relationships with his family, friends and girlfriend Dana.

A look at Season One...

 
-------

SEASON TWO SYNOPSIS: The arrival of Catwoman brings all new problems to the streets of Neo-Gotham and a trip to Metropolis may hold the answers to maintaining the legacy of Batman. Bruce and Terry fight  to keep things in order as their futures are threatened.

Ever since the success of the "Batman Beyond: TS" web series, fans have been asking for a second season and we wish to deliver!!

Our team of filmmakers & artists (who are soaked in comic/geek culture) have been continuously working on the pre production of season two, from writing, budgeting, and pre-scheduling the shoot dates, and now have 3 episodes ready to go! These episodes not only wrap up the cliffhangers of the 1st season with some great fights and nice cameos, it also leads us into new dangers that will take the heroes from Neo-Gotham to Metropolis and more! 

This is a long time coming and we are SO anxious to get "Batman Beyond: TS" Season 2 going THIS YEAR while keeping you updated along the way!! Because after all, it is you the people, the fans who help projects like this stay alive and grow better and better!!

www.aNaturNaLproject.com

Click Here To WATCH Batman Beyond: TS - Season One !!

 

This campaign will have perks that include posters, DVDs, exclusive behind the scenes photos and videos, plus a special copy of BBTS Season One, which has recently been re-edited into an (unreleased) full length film!

We aim to shoot 2-3 episodes at a time as to get the episodes out to you all sooner than later. Which we are capable of doing since we already have the costuming and other elements from the previous season. Our budget outlines what is needed to jump-start the production process.

 

BUDGET

Locations:                          

800 = Shreeve Building INT.NIGHT (2 days)

250 = Building Top EXT.NIGHT (1 day)

100 = Rooftop EXT.NIGHT (1 day)

350 = Neo-Gotham Alley EXT.NIGHT (1 day)

100 = GCPD Crime Scene INT.NIGHT (1 day)

200 = Restaurant INT/EXT.NIGHT (1 day)

Props:                  

5 = Hover Card

25 = Sword (faux)

10 = Large Blade or Taser Rod

Set Décor:                          

70 = Atmosphere Aerosol/Haze/Fog (5 cans)

Crew:                   

600 = Hair/MakeUp, MakeUp FX Artist (6 days)

400 = Fight Choreographer/Stunts (4 days)

Wardrobe/Costuming:                 

40 = Cobra Soldiers identifying badges

Additional:                        

225 = Crafts Service/Food (9 days)

Post Production:             

500 = Visual Effects

 

PREVIOUS PROJECTS:

"IRONHEART: It Starts with a Spark"

 

A NaturNaL Project - REEL #01 

 

Visit www.aNaturNaLproject.com for more!! ^_^

Risks & Challenges

In understanding that the primary obstacles working on an independent, non-profit, fan-series, such as this are funding and scheduling, we have positioned ourselves to be ready to start shooting as soon as funding is complete utilizing the resources obtained from season one. Former cast and crew members are signed on and ready to go!!

Other Ways You Can Help

The prime factor in having a successful Indiegogo campaign is getting the word out about it. So we ask that you spread the word about “Batman Beyond: TS” as much as possible; about the YouTube channel and the campaign!!

Please be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU ALL FOR YOUR CONTINUED SUPPORT AND ENTHUSIASM!!!!!!!

---

KEY MAKEUP ARTIST, Cat Tanchanco/AUDFACED:

---

FIGHT CHOREOGRAPHER, Joe Santos:

story:
Iight, so boom…

After a devastating break-up, Zoe moves in with her best friend Hazel and tries to focus on doing something with the rest of her 20’s. Hazel, starting her pivotal junior year in college, finds it hard balancing her impeccable GPA, staying on track to an early MBA, getting out of the friend zone with long-time crush, and still finding time to match Zoe’s carefree energy. Hazel suggests to Zoe to start acting, so she could put her dramatics to use.

Now, my girl Zoe gets a little triggered around strangers and whatnot, but actors are the perfect kinda crazy to make her feel right at home. Lead by eccentric acting teacher, Brenda Hunter, Zoe allows herself to open up and deal with her past trauma and move forward in a healthier way. Zoe even meets this dope ass chick, Leah, but Hazel starts to feel left out of their newfound bond. All in all, when struggles get too hard for you to take on by yourself, you can always count on your real friends to help get you through them.

Unapologetically Dope…

“Basic Acting” is for ladies of color who struggle with finding their identity in a world that doesn’t let them freely express their individuality and cope with years of trauma. This series will address female friendship dynamics, exploring your sexuality, dealing with mental health concerns (especially as a woman of color), and those wavering times in your twenties when you can’t seem to find the ground under your feet. Now is the time to present the lives and stories that haven’t been represented in mainstream entertainment yet.

Here's the Plan...

The scripts are written, and the cast and crew are coming together. We want to get started as soon as possible while everyone is still available. So here is the proposed timeline for the project.

Pre-Production: Completed

Production: January – March 2019

Post-Production: January- March 2019

Promotions: early March 2019

Premiere: March 22, 2019

Although there may be slight hiccups in the schedule as life doesn't always go as planned, the Basic Acting crew is going to work hard to bring you the best production possible.

 

Will You Be My Producer?

What this project needs more than anything is positive vibes. This is my directorial debut, and I couldn’t be more excited to direct something that I’ve also written. I have gathered a team of well-equipped individuals that I have all the confidence in to make this project successful. I’ll be honest, we need funds a teeeeeensy bit more than positive vibes alone. 

 

Our starting goal is $7,500. With that money we’ll be able to get proper equipment and software, props and wardrobe, and secure studio space. The chart below breaks down the budget, so you can see where your money will go in production.

 

 

On top of the allocation in our production, you get some great perks as a fan to Basic Acting! You’ll see those to the right of you in more detail. If the starting goal is exceeded, our next goal will be $15,000. With the additional funds, we'll be able to get even better equipment, popping props, and even better perks for our Top Contributors. 

 

If the goal is not met, we will produce as much of the series as possible. If we can make 50%, we’ll be able to get equipment and make it work!

 

While we’re waiting for some funding, have fun with the cast and crew on Instagram!

So You’re the Broke Friend? We can Relate.

We are looking to get any help that we can, so if money isn’t what you can contribute there are plenty other ways you can help make “Basic Acting” a big success:

  • I hope that everyone will help get the conversation started on social media sharing the series on YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter.
  • Subscribe to the Basic Acting YouTube Channel
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Instagram: @basicactingwebseries
  • Twitter: @basicacting
  • Use the hashtags #basicactingwebseries #getbasic  and #ddtwh to get it trending and make our content go viral
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help bring more backers to this page

Let the THEATRICS Begin!

We are so ready to begin, we could dance (and we have)!

 

Every bit of support counts, and we appreciate all of it! Thank you so much!

story:
Myles Cardeau and Sean Crawford have been surviving together in wilds against a new face of reality. A whole new group of vicious and bloodthirsty entities that stalk them through the woods, until a fall out forces them to part ways and survive on their own. This separation pushes both men into harrowing encounters that will challenge their ideas of survival as well as their strength to carry on.

A fantastic group of individuals who range from various parts of the industry, but all share the same drive, and ambition. A team filled with people who believe in this idea. Meet our cast below!

Throughout the years, this idea of what could happen if the world went a few steps back into civilization halted, and always hit a brick wall. That brick wall being the finances required to orchestrate such a beautiful story. 

A story of this magnitude deserves better, and the more we acquire, the better the product will be! A lot of the acquired funds will go towards- Wages, Camera Equipment, Special Effects, and Visual Effects, and plenty more. The funds will be distributed throughout the production period, and post-production stage.

Music Licensing- In order to use the proper music, we must communicate with the artists, and work out a deal where we can definitely use their music with no issues to arise!

We've come this far, we must give our blood, sweat, and tears. We can't afford to rush it, nor downgrade the quality! That won't be satisfying for both us, and for all of you guys who have helped us.

The more we raise the better the product will be!

If you are unable to make a donation for the time being, you can still help by sharing this campaign with your friends, and family on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or via a simple message!

Like our page on Facebook and follow us on Twitter, Snapchat, and Instagram.

Email a link to this campaign to your friends and family: 

The official hashtag for the project is #ProjectEidolon, and #WeAreTheEidolons

This project relies on the hard work this team puts in every single day for the past two years, and your dedicated support! Thank you!

For campaign/perk related inquiries, please contact: officialeidolon@gmail.com

When will I be able to watch it?

The production is scheduled to be complete by June 28th! It will then enter post-production which can last up to a month. August 24th, 2018 will be when we screen it for everyone! It will take place in Toronto, Ontario, Canada! Depending on where all you guys are from, we may even pen down extra dates elsewhere, possibly New York!

What will the rating be?

The rating of the project is unknown, as that is decided by the rating board! As of now, we are playing along the lines of TV-14, and Rated R. A project of this magnitude mustn't be limited to guidelines, it's a broad story to tell which we will embrace and represent to it's fullest!

Will we be apart of the 'Production Journey'?

Absolutely! We have so much to show you, and you have so much to give, and that's your support. It's only fitting to bring you along to witness it all being made. You will constantly be updated via all our social medias, Indiegogo, and through email!

When will we receive our perks?

You will get your perks, and other goodies just in time for the screening of The Eidolon in August! Expect it to be shipped in mint condition to your doorstep within the first 2 weeks fo August this year!

What if I'm outside of Canada, and the US? Will I be kept in the loop?

Consider this, how does one turn into an Eidolon? It's a bloody virus! Virus' spread around the world, so will our rewards! We will most definitely deliver to any part of the world!

story:
Here's the Deal

I've been writing, directing and producing documentary television for close to twenty years. I've been nominated for some awards. A News and Documentary Emmy, a Daytime Emmy, The KASHISH Mumbai International Queer Film Festival (no I did not attend the award ceremony) the Prix SACD from the Avignon Film Festival and an NAACP Image Award. 

I was an actor originally before I moved behind the camera. While it has been great fun over the last couple of decades to create innovative documentary programming for outlets such as National Geographic, Discovery, OWN, Showtime and other channels, I really miss working with actors.

With this new project I am realizing that dream. I've assembled a crack team of professionals that are helping me to produce what I think will be a killer hour of TV. Camera people, hair and makeup folks, the actors, even the sound guys are enjoying themselves. Everyone has pitched in to contribute their best to the show. A lot of them are people I have worked with over the years here in Los Angeles. Talented group.

The pilot describes the day to day experiences of a small family living in Los Angeles: A single mother with two sons, one black, one white, one of them adopted and one of them just getting out of prison. It's an intimate look at a slightly non-traditional family. It'll be a crackling good story I promise you that.

With your help, if we pull this off I think we can make an end run around some of the Hollywood gatekeepers and create a TV series that takes a deeper look at the way we live our lives now. Okay, that might be a bit grand, but I DO believe this show has something to say about the current mood in our country. And is saying it in a fresh and provocative fashion. Its gonna be a great ride.

I think we can sell it for sure.

Join Us

I'm looking to raise another 16,000.00 dollars to defray what I am putting up for the project myself. Like I said in my video pitch, my ambition has outstripped my bank account. You start off thinking you can do this for free, that for just a little, and the other thing for a bit more. Then you start adding on collaborators - camera people, actors and so on - and they all have ideas and they all want to make it "really look good" and all of a sudden you think...  crap, I'm gonna need more money to finish this thing. 

Here's where the money goes. Probably about eight grand would help out on the salaries for some of the crew. And then I've got a couple of big set pieces in the show that require some car shooting and more specialized filming. This kind of stuff takes more money than the scenes I am shooting in my house. (Note to self: Maybe don't do that again...) Plus there is color correction in post production, sound editing, and music. 

Bottom line is I am going to finish this thing by hook or crook but it would be a lot easier if I had some contributors join me along the way.

Second bottom line: I really don't know if this show will sell. No one ever does. But over my many years in this business you start to build up some well, instincts, shall we say. And my instincts tell me that there is something here. Actors have wanted to participate, crew members, my colleagues have been especially encouraging - there might be a diamond in the rough here. 

Join me. There is a selfish side to all these crowdfunding projects, let's face it, the guy getting the most out of this project is probably me. But I really believe that when we all work together, pulling the boat in the same direction - good stuff happens for everyone on board. Which is kind of the theme of the show actually... 

Thanks for taking the time to consider my project. Feel free to pass it around your social media world.

story:
Long, long ago...

There was a time, decades ago, when you could gather in front of your television with your entire family to watch a comedian and everyone had a great time. You could sit with your mom and dad and kid sister (and even your Grandma) and enjoy an entire evening of laughter without once hearing something dirty or embarrassing. 

Comedy like that was smart. You had to be good...and quick...and clean. It was tough to do but worth it. Everybody talks about how those guys were giants in the industry.

We call those days The Good Old Days. We want these days to be The Good Old Days too. 

Allow us to introduce ourselves: we are The Fidgets, an improv comedy troupe that has been performing family friendly comedy across the country since 2007. 

John D Hollingsworth 

“I’ve been performing comedy all my life—even ask my mom. I learned short form improv in British Columbia at Trinity Western University and have been on stage in Nashville, Toronto, Charlottetown, Atlanta, London, LA and all points in between. 

I want our comedy to be so good that no one even realizes it’s family friendly until the show is done. "

Chris Reid

 

"I got really into comedy in high school.

I love making people laugh. I love working with these two guys, jumping onto the stage in front of hundreds (or thousands) of people that we don't know, getting their ideas and turning them into really awesome entertainment. That's a great legacy."

Dave Lane

"I was more of an actor than a comedian. A family pastor as well. Then I met John and, like everyone else says, 'it was all down hill from there.’

We started performing locally, then we started touring. It seemed like there was a huge vacuum in the world of entertainment--people were hungry for guilt-free laughter. 

I know it's been a good night when we can provide that--when we can make everyone from kids to seniors have a great night of laughing together. That kind of thing is hard to find anymore."

When you contribute...

When you team up with The Fidgets, you'll be bringing amazing family friendly comedy into the world. We have been performing since 2007 but we don't have any hi def footage. You know, the kind you would need for a DVD, download or Netflix series? (Before you ask---no, we haven't been approached by Netflix but it's always good to be prepared.)

We are going to bring a professional film crew with us during our Speak No Evil tour in the spring of 2019. Lots of cameras, mics...um...sound checks...helicopters...etc. And all of this stuff costs money. Plus we have to feed the crew too. And put them up in hotels wherever we travel.

But the end result will be amazing footage of our tour across Canada. Then we edit that footage into segments made for TV specials, DVDs, downloads and YouTube clips. (And pass out some pretty cool swag along the way!)

You have the opportunity, right now, to say: "I was a part of that! I remember when they were just starting out and I gave them the boost they needed."

We appreciate you and we need your help. Good, clean comedy is one donation away and every donation helps.

What We Need & What You Get

To produce the high quality show we want (and avoid the "cheesy family comedy" look) we have a budget of $11,000 CDN. This includes flight and accommodations for our crew when our Speak No Evil Tour starts in British Columbia in February 2019. We will be performing at the Vernon Performing Arts Centre along with 5 other stops along the way until April, 2019. 

Not every venue will be perfect so we want to get as much footage as possible, at as many performances as possible to create the best product possible. 

We want to have fun through this entire fundraising journey so we created some perks that will let you know how much we love you! They include credit in our videos, donor-exclusive bling--even performances for you and/or a company/charity you designate. 

Join us for this adventure, won't you? 

 

Risks & Challenges

This project won't be easy. There are all sorts of logistical challenges to overcome when one wants to move a team of people and expensive equipment across the country. Not all venues are created equal. Some will require a lot of work to get the type of content that a streaming service such as Pureflix or Amazon Prime would use. 

And if we don't reach our $11,000 budget, we will adjust our budget accordingly in order to make the most of the donations you provide. (But seriously, are your kids really going to need a college education?)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider joining us on this adventure with your donations and your sharing of this campaign. 

We love you.

story:
Short Summary

The potential to change the course of action we have been all put during these lockdowns depends on this message being shared with all countries worldwide.

So I am taking the action to translate the last interview of David Icke on London Real to all languages.

What We Need & What You Get

  •     Add the English subtitles
  •     Translate the subtitles to all available languages
  •     Upload all the translated videos on lbrary.com where they can't be censored

For this, I need the funds to pay the fiverr subtitler, and then the translators. Then the VAs to upload it massively to lbrary.com where they won't be censored and be ready to share worldwide with each of the different languages link.

The Impact

This information should be available to all languages and translated accordingly.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Apart from funding this initiative, you can share it with all your friends and contacts.
