story:
WHO IS AL JO AND WHY IS HE GARDENING IN QUARANTINE?

Let’s be honest… finding Serenity and Mental Peace has been challenging during the Covid-19 pandemic. I’ve been blessed to be able to work from home since things shut down in March 2020, but when Spring rolled around and I realized this virus wasn’t going away any time soon... anxiety kicked in. I, aL Jo, WASN’T HAVING IT! Bored of being cooped up in the same house and unable to venture out without feeling like I was putting myself at risk, I decided to devote my free time to Gardening. Unexpectedly, this 30-minute-a-day hobby quickly transformed into something much greater. Gardening not only filled my stomach, but it filled my spirit with passion and became a source of therapy during such a grim time in our lives.

Now, I want to pay it forward. The result is a Web Series about making the most out of the little we have. My goal is to inform and inspire during a time of uncertainty and anxiety. Whether you have a massive backyard or just a window in a small apartment, you can grow your own organic food and take control of your diet at a fraction of what you’d pay at the grocery store!

ABOUT THE SERIES

“aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” will be a 10-12 episode vlog-style web series set in Growing Zone 6 - New Jersey. I was so inspired by my gardening journey and the impact sharing it can have, that I’ve already shot over 100 hours of footage. Each episode will be dedicated to a different fruit/vegetable or DIY project that walks you through what I’m growing and the process involved. Episodes will include: gardening tips, tutorials, timelapses, cooking montages (with tasty recipes for those looking for new ideas and others who can’t stand the taste of veggies), how to navigate obstacles, and much more!

By sharing the knowledge I’ve acquired during my quarantine gardening journey, challenges I’ve faced along the way, and visible evidence of success, this web series will prove that anyone can grow a green thumb, no matter how many times you’ve failed or if you’ve never even gardened before. “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” will premiere in the Spring of 2021 to align with the growing season and to provide a resource to inspire you to garden along with me!

This is more than a fun web series hoping to go viral – this is the start of a home gardening movement.

THIS IS MORE THAN JUST A SERIES – IT’S A MOVEMENT!

The mission of “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” upon release is to show how easy it is to grow your own food, regardless of where you live. I debunk the “but I don’t have space to grow anything!” myth and show that you don’t need an entire farm - you can grow vegetables right from a balcony or window and use recyclable food/beverage containers as pots/planters! My Web Series will spread the infectious passion I have for gardening and provide knowledge to create your own garden from home.

BUT, This web series goes beyond these 10-12 episodes. “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” is the first initiative of many in accomplishing my long-term goal of inspiring communities that can greatly benefit from gardening. With your help, I will start the overarching brand “aLJo Gardening”, with 3 specific goals in mind:

First, I want to help others feel uplifted by sharing how fun, physically rewarding, and mentally gratifying gardening can be. I know 2020 has been extremely difficult and the uncertainty of these times has ignited anxiety and depression for many, including myself. When you grow your own food, you are quite literally bringing something to life. This feeling of accomplishment is extremely gratifying. The act of growing, caring, and harvesting is therapeutic in of itself, and has worked wonders for bringing peace of mind.

Secondly, as a person of color, I want to raise awareness of underserved communities and provide a solution to bring healthy, nutritious food options to our communities. All across the country, especially in urban areas, many minorities live in “Food Deserts” where access to fresh, affordable produce is either extremely limited or virtually nonexistent.  Because of this, many minority communities are left with a small variety of low-quality veggies and fruits or have to turn to cheaper unhealthy food options due to lack of funds. This pandemic and resulting mass unemployment has only worsened this problem, with Covid hitting black and brown communities the hardest. According to Feeding America, food insecurity has reached a level we haven’t seen since the Great Depression. To offset this, I want to give my fellow people of color the inspiration and tools to grow their own food, start a community garden, and share knowledge amongst each other. Home gardening is an affordable and empowering way to bring better eating options to families suffering from food insecurity and families in Food Deserts, uplifting our communities for generations to come!

Third, I want to share that any person of any age, race, location, and background can and should garden! As a young Black man, I aim to bust stereotypes that gardening is “soft” or “feminine”. There is nothing that shows strength more than being able to provide healthy food for yourself and your family. With gardening comes the satisfaction of ownership. You are in control of what you're eating and know where it's coming from. Gardening is rewarding and fulfilling for people of all walks of life - and as a Black man I am living proof of that!

I CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOUR HELP

I'm not exaggerating when I tell you I have never been so passionate about a project in my life. I truly believe in the power “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” has to uplift, inspire, and empower. But the truth is, I can’t do it alone. I want this project to be BY US and our communities, not just my personal passion project. I want this to be a joint effort - to grow a community that inspires each other and eats our own delicious home-grown food TOGETHER.

I have poured an abundance of my own time, energy, and money into this project so far to get the gears in motion. BUT, If I want it to be of the absolute best quality and have the best chance to touch the lives of millions, I need help. I've put together a trusted best-in-class team to help me with post-production, strategy, and marketing. COSTS for this project include video editing, color correction, graphic and motion design, music licensing and sound mixing, digital marketing, social media management, website creation, and more. See below for a cost breakdown of launching this Web Series:

This web series cannot reach its full potential without some help. And that’s where you come in. Every dollar you give goes directly toward making this dream a reality. Every donation, no matter how small or big, holds power. I understand this is an uncertain, financially-difficult time and that the pandemic has been hard on many. This is why I'm calling for assistance. I'm providing the up-front cost and have already been investing in this project… but at the end of the day, every bit helps to make this happen on a bigger scale! Please know that your donation is appreciated beyond words and will play a direct role in sending my message to the world and providing people with skills they will have for life. I am paying myself nothing - 100% goes toward elevating my ambitious vision.YOU have the power to help make a change for the better!

Other Ways To Help

Even if you're not able to financially contribute, I still encourage you to watch and learn from my videos and reach out to me for gardening tips! I want everyone to feel a part of this, no matter your financial situation.

Even if you can't give, sharing this fundraiser with your network or forwarding this Indiegogo link to a friend helps more than you could imagine. Spreading the word and raising awareness will be so helpful to my project and to those in need of a reason to find mental serenity while taking ownership of their meals along the way!

I appreciate your time and consideration. Even reading this far down the page means the world to me, donation or not. I am beyond excited to bring “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” to the world, and I can’t wait for you to be a part of this journey.

 

With immense gratitude,

Alex Johnson

a.k.a. aLJo Gardening
story_txt:
WHO IS AL JO AND WHY IS HE GARDENING IN QUARANTINE?
Let’s be honest… finding Serenity and Mental Peace has been challenging during the Covid-19 pandemic. I’ve been blessed to be able to work from home since things shut down in March 2020, but when Spring rolled around and I realized this virus wasn’t going away any time soon... anxiety kicked in. I, aL Jo, WASN’T HAVING IT! Bored of being cooped up in the same house and unable to venture out without feeling like I was putting myself at risk, I decided to devote my free time to Gardening. Unexpectedly, this 30-minute-a-day hobby quickly transformed into something much greater. Gardening not only filled my stomach, but it filled my spirit with passion and became a source of therapy during such a grim time in our lives.
Now, I want to pay it forward. The result is a Web Series about making the most out of the little we have. My goal is to inform and inspire during a time of uncertainty and anxiety. Whether you have a massive backyard or just a window in a small apartment, you can grow your own organic food and take control of your diet at a fraction of what you’d pay at the grocery store!

ABOUT THE SERIES
“aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” will be a 10-12 episode vlog-style web series set in Growing Zone 6 - New Jersey. I was so inspired by my gardening journey and the impact sharing it can have, that I’ve already shot over 100 hours of footage. Each episode will be dedicated to a different fruit/vegetable or DIY project that walks you through what I’m growing and the process involved. Episodes will include: gardening tips, tutorials, timelapses, cooking montages (with tasty recipes for those looking for new ideas and others who can’t stand the taste of veggies), how to navigate obstacles, and much more!
By sharing the knowledge I’ve acquired during my quarantine gardening journey, challenges I’ve faced along the way, and visible evidence of success, this web series will prove that anyone can grow a green thumb, no matter how many times you’ve failed or if you’ve never even gardened before. “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” will premiere in the Spring of 2021 to align with the growing season and to provide a resource to inspire you to garden along with me!
This is more than a fun web series hoping to go viral – this is the start of a home gardening movement.


THIS IS MORE THAN JUST A SERIES – IT’S A MOVEMENT!
The mission of “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” upon release is to show how easy it is to grow your own food, regardless of where you live. I debunk the “but I don’t have space to grow anything!” myth and show that you don’t need an entire farm - you can grow vegetables right from a balcony or window and use recyclable food/beverage containers as pots/planters! My Web Series will spread the infectious passion I have for gardening and provide knowledge to create your own garden from home.

BUT, This web series goes beyond these 10-12 episodes. “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” is the first initiative of many in accomplishing my long-term goal of inspiring communities that can greatly benefit from gardening. With your help, I will start the overarching brand “aLJo Gardening”, with 3 specific goals in mind:
First, I want to help others feel uplifted by sharing how fun, physically rewarding, and mentally gratifying gardening can be. I know 2020 has been extremely difficult and the uncertainty of these times has ignited anxiety and depression for many, including myself. When you grow your own food, you are quite literally bringing something to life. This feeling of accomplishment is extremely gratifying. The act of growing, caring, and harvesting is therapeutic in of itself, and has worked wonders for bringing peace of mind.

Secondly, as a person of color, I want to raise awareness of underserved communities and provide a solution to bring healthy, nutritious food options to our communities. All across the country, especially in urban areas, many minorities live in “Food Deserts” where access to fresh, affordable produce is either extremely limited or virtually nonexistent.  Because of this, many minority communities are left with a small variety of low-quality veggies and fruits or have to turn to cheaper unhealthy food options due to lack of funds. This pandemic and resulting mass unemployment has only worsened this problem, with Covid hitting black and brown communities the hardest. According to Feeding America, food insecurity has reached a level we haven’t seen since the Great Depression. To offset this, I want to give my fellow people of color the inspiration and tools to grow their own food, start a community garden, and share knowledge amongst each other. Home gardening is an affordable and empowering way to bring better eating options to families suffering from food insecurity and families in Food Deserts, uplifting our communities for generations to come!

Third, I want to share that any person of any age, race, location, and background can and should garden! As a young Black man, I aim to bust stereotypes that gardening is “soft” or “feminine”. There is nothing that shows strength more than being able to provide healthy food for yourself and your family. With gardening comes the satisfaction of ownership. You are in control of what you're eating and know where it's coming from. Gardening is rewarding and fulfilling for people of all walks of life - and as a Black man I am living proof of that!

I CAN'T DO THIS WITHOUT YOUR HELP
I'm not exaggerating when I tell you I have never been so passionate about a project in my life. I truly believe in the power “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” has to uplift, inspire, and empower. But the truth is, I can’t do it alone. I want this project to be BY US and our communities, not just my personal passion project. I want this to be a joint effort - to grow a community that inspires each other and eats our own delicious home-grown food TOGETHER. 
I have poured an abundance of my own time, energy, and money into this project so far to get the gears in motion. BUT, If I want it to be of the absolute best quality and have the best chance to touch the lives of millions, I need help. I've put together a trusted best-in-class team to help me with post-production, strategy, and marketing. COSTS for this project include video editing, color correction, graphic and motion design, music licensing and sound mixing, digital marketing, social media management, website creation, and more. See below for a cost breakdown of launching this Web Series:

This web series cannot reach its full potential without some help. And that’s where you come in. Every dollar you give goes directly toward making this dream a reality. Every donation, no matter how small or big, holds power. I understand this is an uncertain, financially-difficult time and that the pandemic has been hard on many. This is why I'm calling for assistance. I'm providing the up-front cost and have already been investing in this project… but at the end of the day, every bit helps to make this happen on a bigger scale! Please know that your donation is appreciated beyond words and will play a direct role in sending my message to the world and providing people with skills they will have for life. I am paying myself nothing - 100% goes toward elevating my ambitious vision.YOU have the power to help make a change for the better!


Other Ways To Help
Even if you're not able to financially contribute, I still encourage you to watch and learn from my videos and reach out to me for gardening tips! I want everyone to feel a part of this, no matter your financial situation.
Even if you can't give, sharing this fundraiser with your network or forwarding this Indiegogo link to a friend helps more than you could imagine. Spreading the word and raising awareness will be so helpful to my project and to those in need of a reason to find mental serenity while taking ownership of their meals along the way!
I appreciate your time and consideration. Even reading this far down the page means the world to me, donation or not. I am beyond excited to bring “aLJo’s Quarantine Gardening” to the world, and I can’t wait for you to be a part of this journey.
 
With immense gratitude,
Alex Johnson
a.k.a. aLJo Gardening

story:
MEET THE LADS:

Callum - a care free guy with a care free life. Callum knows what he is, and he just wants to ride out his younger years in style. Sex, booze and the love for the sesh, he just wants everyone, society and responsibility to fuck off and leave him to it.

Isobel (Izzie) - Izzie lives her life the way she see fits. She is at one with God but she makes the rules that determine her life path. God forgives, so she will sin when she can. After a night of tedious sex with Callum and the hullabaloo that follows, Izzie can’t help but be attracted to the man who can’t remember if he wraps his willy before the silly, but given her divine judgement, this can only be a road that will lead to good things.

Rene - you know the guy you just feel sorry for not having a ledge in life? That’s Rene. He doesn’t know what the fuck he is doing, all he knows is he wants to do anything - and I mean anything. Finding his place in life will be hard, especially because of his stepsister Aiobheann...

Aiobheann - Rene’s step sister. We don’t know a lot about her past,  but she’ll jump on Rene’s bandwagon at any moment. Living to survive, meal after borrowed meal, couch after mates floor, like Rene she is just trying to find out what she is in the realm of things.  She’s just not that bothered about when or how she gets there.

Danny - The neighbour with a wanking problem. That is having one, and being a bit of a wanker himself. This mysterious downstairs neighbour keeps out of the way until he makes his problems yours. The only thing we know about him for sure is that he loves Rene. So much so that we don’t know what he will do to get a piece of him.

Jamie - The brute landlord who’s never satisfied with a fight until he gets his c*nt kicked in. Love him or hate him, he will get all about your business, begging for his next fight while at the same time trying to run the main business of being a landlord to multiple tenants. Just how far can these bunch of 20 somethings push Jamie to the point of breaking?

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have completed principal photography for the pilot episode and are looking to raise finishing funds to help with post production costs such as editing, advertising, distribution and of course...the all important episode 2!
  • We are aiming for television broadcast and hope to pitch the series to the newly reformed BBC3 channel in 2022.
  • In order to help us get there, we are offering some cool perks, including shout outs on our official social media pages, a thank you credit or even an Executive Producer credit!
  • If we don't reach our goal, the pilot episode will still be made, as we have already shot the footage.  However, it may mean that we are unable to raise the amount required in order to pitch to networks or to continue shooting the remainder of the series.

The Impact

  • LADS is an absurd 18+ comedy focusing on a group of 20-somethings who are trying to navigate their way through life, love and learning to be their own authentic selves.  The series will touch on LGBTQIA themes and acceptance, hopefully delivering a strong message at the same time as entertaining the audience and making them laugh.
  • This is the second offering from Stray Productions.  Our first short film 'Over Again' is complete and currently being submitted to film festivals for the 2021 season.  
  • Stray Productions is a new Glasgow based production company run by Arla Piacentini and Heather M. Brown.  Between them they have over 20 years experience in the industry, including short and feature films and have separately enjoyed success on the festival circuit.

Risks & Challenges

  • There is a risk that the series will not be picked up for distribution by a network channel.  In this instance we will take all steps necessary to self distribute via VOD platforms such as Amazon Prime Video and to self-fund the remainder of the series
  • As we have already completed production on the pilot episode, other risks and challenges are minimal.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share our campaign and social media pages!

We have completed principal photography for the pilot episode and are looking to raise finishing funds to help with post production costs such as editing, advertising, distribution and of course...the all important episode 2!
We are aiming for television broadcast and hope to pitch the series to the newly reformed BBC3 channel in 2022.
In order to help us get there, we are offering some cool perks, including shout outs on our official social media pages, a thank you credit or even an Executive Producer credit!
If we don't reach our goal, the pilot episode will still be made, as we have already shot the footage.  However, it may mean that we are unable to raise the amount required in order to pitch to networks or to continue shooting the remainder of the series.


The Impact

LADS is an absurd 18+ comedy focusing on a group of 20-somethings who are trying to navigate their way through life, love and learning to be their own authentic selves.  The series will touch on LGBTQIA themes and acceptance, hopefully delivering a strong message at the same time as entertaining the audience and making them laugh.
This is the second offering from Stray Productions.  Our first short film 'Over Again' is complete and currently being submitted to film festivals for the 2021 season.  
Stray Productions is a new Glasgow based production company run by Arla Piacentini and Heather M. Brown.  Between them they have over 20 years experience in the industry, including short and feature films and have separately enjoyed success on the festival circuit.


Risks & Challenges

There is a risk that the series will not be picked up for distribution by a network channel.  In this instance we will take all steps necessary to self distribute via VOD platforms such as Amazon Prime Video and to self-fund the remainder of the series
As we have already completed production on the pilot episode, other risks and challenges are minimal.


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please share our campaign and social media pages!

story:
OUR PROJECT

No Rest For The Wicked is a horror thriller series about a young man plagued by the ghosts of his past, returning to hometown where a serial killer ran loose, Kit reconnects with friends and family. Unfortunately his return sparks a new series of killings that patterns the previous Ripper. In order to survive they must uncover the secrets and mysteries of this small town while they are picked off one by one. 

ABOUT US AND WHO WE ARE 

Still tuning in? Awesome! Glad to still have you here. Little bit of background on who we are, we're a writing duo. Kenneth & James, originally from New York, we met in college, and showed an equal passion in horror films. 

What we have here is a lovely horror story, that we all love, which will feature, violence, strong language, adult content and the occasional comedy relief. True it is a horror story, but it is not so much about the people of the town but more so about the dark secrets lurking in the under belly of this town.

But what is horror nowadays? We’ve seen it all from, zombies, aliens, serial killers, vampires, werewolves and killer ghost girls. The purpose of this show is to attempt to break the bounds of those stereotypes and to not necessarily come up with something new, but more so, something interesting.

Our main goal is to take the concept of “Scream” and “Halloween” and sort of blend both those incredible stories, minus the ending into something spectacular. We want to take that movie theater fear, that was on the big screen and introduce that on the small screen. Is it original? Not so much. Creative? We think so, but only time will tell on that front.

We’re writing this show for the inner horror movie geek that resides inside of us. We’re writing this with the intention to show the audiences a sort of mini horror film once a week. We’re also writing this because we want to reintroduce the world to actual horror, and not the torture porn the audiences have come to know nowadays.

Let’s be honest here the horror genre is a dying genre. The tumor is growing, and it’s just waiting for two things, someone to come put a bullet in it’s head, and finally put it out it’s misery or for some lucky bastard to come on by and give it new breath of life.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contributions will enable us to cover the bulk of production and post-production costs for our pilot, such as PPE for Covid safety, meals, costumes, props, set design elements, shooting permits, sound mixing, and special effects. We value your contributions highly, which is we are offering cool perks like, Executive Producer, A signed script from the cast and crew, Producer, and an invitation to the first two episode premiere. And many, many more fun perks!

 

OUR PLAN AND ULTIMATE GOAL!

We are currently in pre-production. Production is slated to start in the spring/summer. We aim to finish post-production by the fall, at which point we will screen the finished pilot at our Virtual Premiere Party (see perks).

Next, we will prepare to pitch the series to buyers, with an eye on streaming platforms. If we don't successfully sell our series in 2021, our plan is to enter our pilot into TV festivals like SeriesFest and Catalyst Content Festival, as well as the episodic categories of festivals like Sundance, TIFF, SXSW, and Tribeca, to help it pick up the necessary steam to catch a different buyer's eye or help us finance, shoot, and release the entire No Rest For The Wicked series ourselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested in No Rest For The Wicked but can't financially contribute at this time, you can still help us by getting the word out; just use Indiegogo's social media share tools, follow us on twitter @trinityproductions, or tell a friend about our campaign.

With every episode also, one or more main character will unfortunately be killed off in a horrific fashion until the finale when there is only one left standing.

So yes, this is basically like a 15-hour horror film about life, about trauma, about love and loss, and some heartbreak, but hopefully you’ll enjoy the ride.

Thanks for reading and may the force be with you.

story:
Overview

A Woman's Worth is the crossroad of inspiration and genius. The concept is to sit with female visionaries that shape our UK culture whilst documenting what it's like to be a woman in the industries of music, film, fashion, sport, arts and more. The aim is to connect with creatives, directors, designers, executives, artists, athletes and more sharing their stories of exploration and the key moves they have made to realise their careers and cultural impact.

The main reason I want to explore this project is that there are not enough women in the UK being heard, specifically in those industries mentioned above. As some of the greatest creators are women I believe the significance of females in these industries is some of the most valuable but still extremely UNDERappreciated.

Why focus on working with women? 

Our aim is to change this conversation by speaking to women from different backgrounds to give insight into their journeys. As a man, I can never truly understand a woman's perspective so this will be something myself and other men in these industries can learn from.  

After doing research into my field I noticed a lack of female representation. Did you know the Centre for the Study of Women in Television and Film found that in the top 100 grossing films of 2018, women represented:

4% of directors

15% of writers

3% of cinematographers

18% of producers

18% of executive producers

14% of editors

For me, this needs to change and be on a more equal basis as I personally know there are so many great females that can master these roles. 

Who am I?

Hi, I’m Andre Lance. I’m a music and film director as well as the founder of online publication LOST CULTURE. The platform was created and inspired by creatives, ideas, products, brands that are redeveloping the culture today. We only care about authenticity and connecting the dots with our content at the speed of life - this success was evident in our previous series LOST CULTURE MEETS (Season 1) where we featured musicians such as: Hak Baker, Aitch, Big Tobz, Kin Kai and many more.

My experience includes filming for over 5 years in the industries of Music, fashion, sport, and film. Working with brands such as Sony Music, Manchester United, Native Youth, True Religion, Nike, Adidas etc. filming artists such as Annie Mac, Maya Jama, Stefflon Don, DJ Heidi and many more. I have worked closely with BBC Radio 5 live discussing current affairs within culture today. 

  

Why a Series?

I know from experience that the new generation learns a lot through visuals & audio as this can give them a lot more clarity when it comes to processing information. I believe this is the best way to document something with such an important value. 

Our aim for this high-level production web series is to focus on accessibility - where anyone can watch freely while on the move, anywhere in the world - provided you have internet access.

The plan: A High-Level production of  4 - 8 episodes of 20 - 30 mins filmed & edited over the next 6 - 12 months.

The timeline for the project involves;

The objective is to inspire more women to follow their passions, as well as encourage men to understand a woman's perspective in these industries so it levels up the playing field.

Who are we documenting ;

Musicians 

Model's

Athletes

Marketing & PR

Dj's / Presenters / Radio

Entrepreneurs / Business owners

Rappers/artists

What do we need & How will the funding be used?

Risks & Challenges

Getting awareness of the crowdfunding - we need people to share the love to bring awareness to the campaign. Social media shares will help and newsletter. 

Not reaching the full amount.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help financially you can still help us make some noise about the campaign by sharing with friends and family. Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign on social media.

Are you a business or individual who wants to sponsor an episode? See the perks. 

We will also accept any sponsorship for audio/filming equipment or refreshments. 

Share the following links below with someone who may need it.

UK Petitions, Grants & Links to follow:

Review state pension entitlements for all women who may have been underpaid​

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts

Women make Music (PRS Grant)

cartierwomensinitiative.com (Grant)

globalfundforwomen.org (Grant)

jointhewbo.com

womenwhotech.com

bossladiesmindset.com

www.thewomensorganisation.org.uk

bossbabe.com

story:
Dreamers' whatlist?

Set in the US in 2004, Dreamers' Playlist Set 1 follows two brothers' inheritance of mysterious spiritual power - chasing their dreams and blazing the path into a new era.

For 26 23-minute installments, the classic Shonen Jump-style formula of character progression through punching (One Piece, My Hero Academia) is remixed into an original series commenting on the nature of power and coming-of-age Black masculinity.

The big fighting tournaments, rivalries, & special moves we know and love are all here, but the story at play goes far deeper than simple homage. Elements both fresh and familiar work in tandem to fully flesh out a distinct, lived-in world through which the characters' narratives are driven. Dreamers' Playlist is an exploration and loving celebration of the visual storytelling form.

A (not-yet) animated series, Playlist's unique storytelling experience is made up of 3 key components:

  • Rich story and world developed & expanded through monthly script releases
  • A soaring, soulful original score bringing vitality to the story world
  • Inspired character art depicting the stars of this new universe as it unfurls

This project isn't the 80th re-hash of a big-name long-running franchise. It isn't the devious scheme of millionaire execs with no respect for artistry. This here is a labor of love. These artists onboard collab and converge talents to create opportunities otherwise not open to them. Your loving support turns those opportunities into reality.

Here's the deal

Traditional consumerist practices in mass media have created an industry that prioritizes overhead and profit to the point of overlooking the artists whose art forms are responsible for capturing audiences.

Our goal is to put buying power in the hands of fans & creators. In crowdfunding this project we’re simply bringing the transactional part of the process to the forefront. Even once we’re off the ground and working alongside a larger studio, publisher, etc, our core emphasis will remain on properly compensating artists for creating captivating content.

  • Your contributions to this campaign launch our efforts onto the internet & beyond
  • Backers receive our gracious thanks at the lowest levels and plenty of goodies on the way up
    • Stickers, pins, art prints, script prints, and cassette tapes of our original soundtrack
    • Backers with deeper pockets earn into behind-the-scenes conversations, workshops, and VIP status to hang with us on launch night (8/24/21!)
  • Our budget was created directly to meet the needs of our staff at this point in our journey. Every dollar donated is one empowering indie artists to feed themselves off their talents.

Like nothing we've ever seen

After spending decades as a more niche product, anime is finally mainstream in the States and around the globe. Despite this, we’ve yet to see that definitive, seminal rework of the medium’s classic tropes and formulas born from fans & creators in the west (with the very notable exception of Avatar: The Last Airbender).


At that, Black art and Black stories are needed now in today’s social climate more than ever. A generation of kids across the States & around the world deserve to grow up alongside characters that look like them, who live like them. They deserve an escape to a world so similar yet so surreal & return believing anything is possible through their strength of will.

Dreamers’ Playlist was created for that experience.

Risks & Challenges

As much as we love anime as an art form, the creation process behind it is notoriously tumultuous and tedious. Much like blockbuster films, many big-name anime series (Naruto, Sword Art Online) are adapted from pre-existing work. Coming attached to a proven fanbase makes them no-brainers for producers to greenlight. Original works (Cowboy Bebop, Gurren Lagann) have a tendency to become instant favorites with fans but tend to only be trusted in the hands of veteran, visionary directors due to the risk involved.

Dreamers' Playlist falls outside the bounds of either route.

An original series built with the DNA of a long-running franchise, it was constructed in this format to provide as much of the non-animated part of the experience as possible. This works not only to immerse readers in a unique storytelling method but to lay down a playground for future producers and animators to run wild with.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word. Creators in Japan and around the world have shared their love through their art, inspiring projects just like this one -created to breathe love and inspiration back into the world. There's no telling who's been out there waiting for a story just like this, but there is one way to help them find us. Share the word.

  • Share this campaign with friends, fam, and fellow fans
  • Follow us on Socials! @dreamersplaylist on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook

story:
"I am Lorenzo Lamas" is an episode of the show, Bail Out.  Lorenzo is trying to convince my character, Jimmy O'Neill, that he was once a very famous TV star. Yes, it is the real Lorenzo Lamas.  My name is Dennis O'Neill.  Ever since I could remember, I quit everything in my life because of fear.  After quitting High School, I worked at dead-end jobs and was going nowhere fast. One day I finally had enough of losing. I went back to school, received my GED, then an Associate’s degree in Theater Arts, where I found my love for acting and realized that it was my life long career. My tenacity to finishing what I started was and is so strong that I enrolled at UTA, Arlington, again, in 2001for a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree. I graduated on December 16, 20016. Yes, it took me fifteen years but quitting was not an option. I realized I could be part of something bigger than me, which is helping to provide jobs for actors and crew, after I began writing my Bail Out TV show idea back in 2007. We filmed a 4-minute sizzle reel in 2009 and started winning award for Best Sizzle Reel.  Sharing my idea with many actors that I worked with over the years, such as Lorenzo Lamas, (Falcon Crest and Renegade) Marshall Teague (Armageddon, Road House, etc.) Terry Kiser (Weekend at Bernie’s-Bernie) Burton Gilliam (Blazing Saddles) and many more all fell in love with it and wanted to help me by being a part of it.  I filmed about fifteen webisodes and won Best Web Series at the Lake Charles Film and Music Festival. This show will allow me to write and act in stories with great actors, crew and with humor making, the audiences feel good about what they just watched. It is also important because it will allow me to continue to work with, and supports, children's hospitals, homeless shelters, Wounded Warrior organizations and more.  My ultimate goal is to get Bail Out on the air as a weekly TV show.   As a contributor, you will be a big part of all these goals and end results. It is not about "us", it is about everyone else!

My skin in the project is that I took out a home equity loan to finance the Bail Out project so far. What I need in the short term is $5000 to complete the editing process and get it out there through screenings. I am willing to give walk-on roles and one-liners in a future episode, which I am in the process of writing, called, "Where is Lou Diamond Phillips?"  In addition, T-Shirts and Coffee Mugs will be given to those who give at least $50 and for a T-Shirt, $100. 

I have gained more open doors and connections with TV producers, directors and those in high places, but I need to make sure our product is spot on ready for them to see through their professional eyes and many years of experience. I set the goal low enough to get the ball rolling and since this will not be the last of our episodic, I thought a start always leads to a finish. Like going back to school, and although it took me many years to complete, is how I look at everything I do. I will not give up; I will only give it my all, to the finish! Winners never quit and quitters never win. I did not make that up. I was told that I need to explain what qualifies me to overcome any hurdles. That is why I shared my life from being a quitter to being a finisher. I will not give up on what I set out to do, not just for myself, but mostly for everyone else involved. I have obligated myself to help all those who worked on this project for little or no money at all. I will do the same for those of you who give to this Bail Out project. My tagline is true, “Everybody’s got a Story.”  It is also true that, there are times in life that, Everybody Needs a Bail Out! Thank you for your time and thank you for allowing me to be transparent enough to share a glimpse of my life with you.

story:
The News Dudes

Since the election, we, the team at The News Dudes, have realized that the majority of America does not get the news. Facts are getting lost – what’s real news, what’s fake news, who’s on what side, who is Russia currently screwing (it’s us by the way.) Americans no longer trust their existing news sources. So let’s give them a new one. One they can relate to. One that “tells it like it is” to the American public. Taking a page out of the current administration’s handbook, let’s not worry about being “politically correct” and just deliver “real talk.”

Enter THE NEWS DUDES, an animated series for people who want to understand the issues that are relevant to their lives but delivered in a way they can understand. Think Beavis and Butthead meets Drunk History for the current news cycle. 

 

What Are We Doing?

If we meet our goal, we will create a season of six 15-min episodes of The News Dudes to begin airing fall of 2017. The more money we raise, the more episodes we can make!

The News Dudes is sketch comedy. We know the issues are serious but we also know people find the news boring and sometimes hard to understand. But it’s important, now more than ever, to know what’s going on. Even if you’re two stoners like The News Dudes.

Current sketches we’re working on include, "Cory Bookworm," "The Dating Game with Melania," "Ann Coulter's Reform School," "Paul Ryan Ramsey Michael Bolton," “Betsy DeVoss College of Astronomy," and "Pussyriot".

 

Where Can I Watch It?

We are currently in talks with some major networks - both cable and digital but at the very least, we will release it on our own YouTube channel and via Vimeo. Thanks to Indiegogo’s partnership with Vimeo, any backer that pledges $25+ will get early access to The News Dudes episodes this fall. You will also be able to purchase the show on iTunes if you don’t get an early season pass here now.

 

Why Are We Crowdfunding?

The News Dudes is tackling issues in a bold way. We are approaching the news differently and we’re calling things out like we see it whether it’s about race, immigration, the current administration or baby duck rights. We don’t want to be beholden to the established media giants in place. We want to tell the stories our way and truthfully without it being colorized through a corporate lens. We don’t want a network or studio to tell us what we can or can’t write about. Because we’re going to write about everything that matters.

More importantly, we want to get YOU involved. We’re writing about and animating about today’s issues and how it affects all of us.

The team behind The News Dudes are Hollywood veterans that have worked on award winning projects. We’ve made movies and shorts before but it’s hard to sell an animated series that doesn’t fit conventional criteria and is willing to go out on a limb with opinionated sketches on current world policies. It sucks asking for money but it sucks even more not getting this made.

Freedom of the Press is important. Calling things out when it’s good or bad is important. But it’s even more important to get people to actually watch and understand the news. The News Dude is the answer.

Help us get The News Dudes off the ground. Even if you can’t give right now, spread the word on this project by letting the everyone know!

Follow us: www.thenewsdudes.com

Twitter: https://twitter.com/The_News_Dudes (@The_News_Dudes)

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thenewsdudes/ (@TheNewsDudes)

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TwoNewsDudes/

#TheNewsDudes

 

What Do I Get in Return?

Help Us Make The News Dudes a Reality!

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Ask your awesome friends, family, co-workers, mailman, that lady you always see on the corner of the street to get the word out and support us!

Follow us: www.thenewsdudes.com

Twitter: https://twitter.com/The_News_Dudes (@The_News_Dudes)

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thenewsdudes/ (@TheNewsDudes)

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TwoNewsDudes/ 

#TheNewsDudes

story:
The story is not only about a woman, gay, bisexual, and transgender in Korea, but also about anybody who are struggling to be themselves in any part of the world.

 

SYNOPSIS

Characters from each episode confront and/or participate in different forms of prejudice, discrimination, and hate speech in their everyday life. In their daily spaces, such as home, workspace, public bathroom, café, restaurant, and social platform, they resist, accept, or contribute to inequality.

 

DIRECTOR'S NOTE

In South Korea, misogyny, homophobia, and hate speech/crime prevail on the daily basis. With doubts, I was convinced to accept the social “norm,” as everyone seemed to do so. When I came to New York in 2013, I was surprised to see how people here are resisting rather than committing.

I remember reading an online post about a NYC college student who was facing exactly the same situation as one the characters in our web series. US and Korea might seem substantially different, but people are facing the same issues. I wanted to contribute to the global conversation on women and LGBTQ rights to make our voice heard across the geographical, social, and cultural boundaries. With Ordinary Days and continued conversations around the same issues we face, I hope we stay and stand stronger.

- Nabin Park, Director (박나빈, 감독)

 

WHO WE ARE

We are New York-based filmmakers, actors, students, political activists, and artists who gathered to stand and speak for women’s and LGBTQ rights.

Also, Space Nabi and Sikgaek are supporting Ordinary Days.

 

WHERE THE FUND GOES

We are looking to raise $5,000 from Indiegogo to finalize this project. 

Post-production:

·       Editing

·       Sound Design

Making up the production cost of:

·       Equipment rental fee

·       Paying / feeding the cast and crew

·       Transportation

·       Art / set design

 

PRODUCTION TIMELINE

 

WHAT YOU GET

We appreciate any amount of donation, and would like to give you back. We are working with zzigeul, a calligraphy design team. We have sample designs for our postcards and tote bag below, updated as of March 9, 2017.

Postcard Sample A

Postcard Sample B

Tote Bag Design

Please check out other perks!

 

OTHER or EXTRA WAYS TO CONTRIBUTE

·       Follow our Facebook page and Twitter and subscribe our YouTube channel, share your perspective with global audience!

·       Please share our Indiegogo post with your network.

·       We would appreciate any in-kind support for our post-production and marketing! Please contact us at ordinary.days.production@gmail.com

story:
UPDATE as of April 19

 

 

Short Summary

I moved to LA two years ago to do this - create. To bring my humor and insight into reality. To be a part of the most beautiful and collaborative art form of the modern age- television. Shows can only be made when all the painters get to put their mark on the canvas, when all the writers and crew and editors come together in sync for a common vision. This project is my baby and is dedicated to the friends back home I wish I could have brunch with.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need at least $10,000 to get this web series launched. We have an amazing team of talented people who are giving this their all. Every cent will go into the production of this series for your entertainment pleasure. With your donation you will receive a selection of wonderful gifts ranging from social media shout outs to joining us on set for a day with an experience you are sure never to forget.

The Impact

While the theme might seem frivolous, the subject matter is pretty powerful. Our characters are dealing with things like learning how to embrace their sexual orientation and love themselves after living in a repressed environment. We’ve got someone trying to save the ocean through his documentary about real things that are happening to our environment, while struggling to keep his own life afloat. There are two strong, independant characters who are setting the example of what powerful female friendships can look like when we stop living in competition with each other. These are relationships we can learn from and connect to.

Risks & Challenges

I have a full time job, no money, and clinical depression. So it gets hard when people refer to your passion as a hobby. You doubt whether it’s worth it, whether you can even fulfill this dream you have. But you have to preserver, you have to try and possibly fail, you have to forgo sleep to achieve your goals. And when you’re working toward something you love, missing the nights out with friends, or home with your tv aren’t that terrible in the grand scheme of things. I think it’s worth it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about BRUNCH SO HARD. Tell your friends, followers, random people on the street. Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools. Anyway to get the word out helps! We have two great marketing campaigns going on right now through our Instagram and Twitter. #followthebacon is about our mascot, the Bacon Babe, as she travels around LA spreading the joy of brunch. And #brunchspot is where we go to cafes across LA and feature their brunch menu for an entire week to cross promote with businesses.
story_txt:
UPDATE as of April 19
 

 

Short Summary
I moved to LA two years ago to do this - create. To bring my humor and insight into reality. To be a part of the most beautiful and collaborative art form of the modern age- television. Shows can only be made when all the painters get to put their mark on the canvas, when all the writers and crew and editors come together in sync for a common vision. This project is my baby and is dedicated to the friends back home I wish I could have brunch with.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We need at least $10,000 to get this web series launched. We have an amazing team of talented people who are giving this their all. Every cent will go into the production of this series for your entertainment pleasure. With your donation you will receive a selection of wonderful gifts ranging from social media shout outs to joining us on set for a day with an experience you are sure never to forget.

The Impact
While the theme might seem frivolous, the subject matter is pretty powerful. Our characters are dealing with things like learning how to embrace their sexual orientation and love themselves after living in a repressed environment. We’ve got someone trying to save the ocean through his documentary about real things that are happening to our environment, while struggling to keep his own life afloat. There are two strong, independant characters who are setting the example of what powerful female friendships can look like when we stop living in competition with each other. These are relationships we can learn from and connect to.

Risks & Challenges
I have a full time job, no money, and clinical depression. So it gets hard when people refer to your passion as a hobby. You doubt whether it’s worth it, whether you can even fulfill this dream you have. But you have to preserver, you have to try and possibly fail, you have to forgo sleep to achieve your goals. And when you’re working toward something you love, missing the nights out with friends, or home with your tv aren’t that terrible in the grand scheme of things. I think it’s worth it.

Other Ways You Can Help

And #brunchspot is where we go to cafes across LA and feature their brunch menu for an entire week to cross promote with businesses.

story:
Short Summary

  • Kurt Fitzpatrick has toured the Fringe circuit for twelve years.  He has a B.A. and Film and Television from Temple University.  Tommy Nugent (Rev. Nuge) is a former preacher turned law school drop-out turned strip club bartender turned college speaker and fringe performer.
  • We are looking to fund a 22-minute absurdist comedy TV pilot episode of "Campus Martius," In "Campus Martius" we will play struggling motivational speakers in Detroit.  We will use this pilot episode to market a full series for either TV or streaming.  The show also features Martin Dockery, Bob Brader, Xan Scott, and a mechanical cat.  Marcel Nunis will be the director of photography.
  • This is the culmination of many years of performing and writing for us.  If our plan is successful, we will give light to many talented people we have known and worked with over the years who haven't yet reached the mainstream.  They should!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $6,500.  About $2,000 will be used to pay crew in production and post-production.  We are shooting in Fresno, CA, Detroit, MI, and Jersey City, NJ.  We're using local talent, but we'll need money for travel, as well as for props, costumes, locations, meals, craft service (little snackies!) and the construction of that mechanical cat. 
  • You'll get perks!  We have DVDs of live shows we've done together and apart, and even DVDs of "Speed 2" starring Academy Award winning actress Sandra Bullock!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll use what we have to produce as much as we can.  Ideally we would like to be able to fund a full episode, to show what we are fully capable of.

The Impact

  • We know there are a lot of people who have enjoyed our live shows on the U.S. and Canadian fringe circuit over the years, and many people who never saw them.  This project is our chance to expand the skills we've obtained through touring and share them with a wider audience, while also utilizing the communities we've spent time with and the talent that we've witnessed on the road.

Risks & Challenges

  • Kurt developed the script last year during a TV pitch class at NYU.  The teacher, Michael Zam, recommended filming the script to serve as material for the pitch because "trying to explain this show means trying to explain what makes the comedy work.  Once you explain absurdist comedy, the joke is dead."
  • We're aware that there is a possibility that TV executives will unanimously declare, "Go back to performing in black box theaters, you hippies!"  It may be challenging to break into TV, but we have been proactively creating work for years on stage and in video, and with the current TV and streaming opportunities out there, we think there is a place for us. 
  • No matter what happens, we will find a platform to share "Campus Martius" with you and make sure that you are part of the experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially, please share this campaign with others via Facebook, Twitter, etc.  Tell a friend!  If you are in Fresno during the first week of March, or in Detroit or Jersey City (shooting schedule not set yet), volunteer to be an extra, bake us a pie, or just send us good vibes!  We never would have been touring artists without the support of others, and that support is not always monetary.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
